sequence: This movie was great. It had everything a true action fan could want. Plenty of people getting shot and/or maimed, minimal romance involving sex, a hero that can be identified with, violence at many intervals instead of pointless plot storing up just one scene at the end, and villains that are just asking for it. Bronson appears to be at his lowest level of tolerancy in this film and it shows. Ed Lauter makes a great cop and was seamlessly worked into Bronson's plot without stealing his spotlight. The movie doesn't involve a plot so boring or over-consuming that you watch this film once and never again.

Damien O'Donnell has a good track record and in this film he handles a very delicate topic with sensitivity but what is it that brings about the end of life? The answers are many. It seems to me that no one really wants to face the fact that death is inevitable, but we live in a society where suicide is seen as a necessary evil, which is why you see people hanging themselves instead of killing themselves. But how can one not accept that there is no other option? Why isn't someone taking matters into his own hands?

The `` old dark house '' sub-genre that dominated the early talkies rarely fails to disappoint when we re-view the original. It is a classic horror movie and I will give it two stars only because of its low budget. If you have never seen this movie, be sure to read this review first . This is a bad movie in so many ways. It is about a woman killed by a vampire after she gave birth to a boy. After she kills her son, she makes him take a potion from a well known herbal remedy.

This is a wonderful movie , and I still love it ! It just so magical and it is fun to watch. I liked it so much I bought the rest of the cast on DVD!! The only problem with this film (not sure what that was supposed to mean) is that it doesn't really follow the plotline. It's not a good movie, but I'll take it! This is a great picture, and there are many good shots. What really gets stuck in my throat is the "bad" ending. I've seen worse endings.

Damien O'Donnell has a good track record and in this film he handles a very delicate topic with sensitivity but manages not to let the film turn into schmalz.This is a fantastic film, its funny with sad bits and it makes you look at things differently. Tell everyone you know to go see it now- FANTASTIC!The acting is excellent, and Dublin plays a starring role. This film will change the way you view people with disabilities and also give you a very entertaining night out in the cinema. I can't wait til it comes out on DVD.

I love this movie a lot. I must get this on DVD. I have 2 VHS copies, but the quality is so poor that you can't read one written joke over the door of the ward. I'm forever amazed that Blankfield did almost nothing afterward. He made both Dr. Jeckle and Mr. Hyde totally believable.The movie is plagued by it's low budget. (One atrocious edit jumps into mid-word and was described on, "Siskel & Ebert".) But, there are a thousand jokes, sight gags to subtle references, that more than compensate.

I had heard of John Garfield , but , did n't know him . I loved this movie . I thought, "this guy is a genius." But the plot was not my cup of tea. Just to get some points off my chest here. This movie sucks. First off, it isn't very good. If you are familiar with David Lynch he is definitely a talented filmmaker. As for the story, that is one of those movies that really sticks out in your mind and gives you goosebumps. It is about a man named Joe Smith whose wife wants to give him another chance.

I'm not sure why this film is averaging so low on IMDb when it's absolutely everything you could ever want in a horror film. This is the definition of being a horror film. I consider myself to be a big horror fan and I must say that this house delivers the goods. House of wax Is the story of a group of college kids on their way to a football game whom decide to camp out for the night and have a run in with a local weirdo. Upon waking the next morning they make a gruesome discovery and decide to go into town for a broken car part.

It amazes me that production companies will sue because of reproductions they will not supply. I've been looking for this movie on DVD for a while and VHS for years. One can get all sorts of movies on line...old movies, new movies... but it all targets a particular group. This movie is very nostalgic for many. I'm not sure why I can't get a copy. Maybe if enough people will write in, the copyright holder will get a clue. It's about time for this to happen. Yes, it's date, but so is The Wizard of OZ.

This is without a doubt the most stunning and amazing documentary I have ever seen ! The images that are presented on screen are simply mind-blowing. It seems as though they were shot almost ten years ago, and yet they're still very fresh.I cannot help but laugh when I think of this film. The first thing to know about this was that this was made in 1976 by a bunch of college buddies who just happened to be friends with two filmmakers (who obviously didn't want to spend their time making low quality films) .

The 1973 musical version of LOST HORIZON is the most wonderful endearing and campy musical films of ALL TIME. The 1973 musical remake of the James Hilton novel about mythical SHANGRI-LA! is a real special gem. Music by BURT BACHARACH and lyrics by HAL David. A strange mixture of straight drama, adventure and musical sequences. It has the distinction of being the ONLY anti war musical fantasy ever filmed. This film was a critical and financial disappointment in the United States, but made a lot of money overseas. Only in America did it fail.

I love this movie a lot . I must get this on DVD . I have 2 VHS copies , so I think I just have to put one of them on and watch it. I know there are several other great movies out there, but not this one . I bought this movie 5 years ago and it is still as good or better than I ever hoped for. I don't care how bad the sound can be, the actors come alive in this movie. It's like seeing some of your favourite actors back on screen again.

I watched this movie out of a lack of anything else on at the time . Quickly the movie grabbed my attention and I thought "This movie isn't as bad as everyone says! How did they convince so many people to rent it?". Well for one thing it's pretty short, in fact I think its only about 1 hour. If you were going to watch this movie out of boredom, you're not going to enjoy it.The story is interesting but nothing that could have made me sit through the whole movie. The acting is very poor.

Who could have thought a non-disabled actor could act so realistically and immensely powerfully as a disabled person in a film? Probably someone. But no-one, truly no-one, could ever compare their expectations with the amazingly emotive and powerful performance given by the two actors in this film.Michael (Steven Robertson) lives in a home for disabled people. He has Cerebral Paulsy, and as shown to us right at the beginning, he has huge trouble communicating. So it truly is a lifeline when fellow disabled member Rory (James McAvoy) who can speak normally, understands him.

I have to admit I had never heard of this movie . I caught it last night on TMC . You know what? I did watch it because there's no way i can miss it anymore. First, if you haven't seen or read this one, be prepared to be disapointed. The acting in this flick was awful. I mean, really awful. It was almost as though a director decided to write an episode out of every other part he wanted to go with the plot. So many good ideas were ruined here.

After spotting the boat at the end of the previous episode ( `` Three Minutes '' ) , the survivors had to abandon their boats and follow the white whale in search for food. This film is a ripoff of one of Hitchcock's other works, Black Dog . The only thing I loved about this was that the director didn't try to play the story as a comedy, which would have been a mistake. This movie tries very hard to appeal to those who want to see a lot of laughs.The characters are completely unlikable - it just seems too difficult to find out what went on in their lives.

I agree that this is ONE of the very best episodes of the entire series--my only detraction would be the somewhat jarring appearance of Mark Lenard as the Romulan Commander. My reasoning is this--if you were not around for the first run of this episode, then you know Mr. Lenard as Sarek, Spock's father. And for the 2nd generation Trekkie (or Trekker--your preference) it takes you out of the scene at first. Yet he's an excellent commander as well as opposite for our captain and this episode is strongly written and well-acted by all.

I don't usually comment on films since I am in the movie distribution business, but I have to say that this is one of my favorite films of all time. The acting is fantastic and the script is even better. There were no cheesy speeches or exploitation of handicapped people to try and make this movie more "Hollywood". James McAvoy is such an outstanding actor, I could not look away from him if I tried. I was impressed with Steven Robertson as well. I cannot believe this is his first real film.

The big names in film tried to do their part for the war effort, and Charlie Chaplin was no exception. This patriotic and propagandist picture is part of his contribution, although the war was nearly over by the time of its release. The tramp goes to war, humorously accomplishes acts of heroism and kicks the Kaiser in the bum. It's a very funny film, although I don't think it nearly one of his best. It's with 'A Dog's Life' as his better output for First National before he made his early masterpiece 'The Kid.'

I hope , from his seat on Heaven 's comedic throne , Spike Milligan can see and can enjoy this film because it is a good story, no? I guess I could give it four stars based on my previous review but then again maybe not. It's an absolute rip-off that really shouldn't have gone on the big screen in the first place. I've seen a few reviews here and there of this movie claiming it's one of the best comedies I've ever seen or that it's the "worst comedy ever".

There are a select few cartoon films where animals or something `` not human '' is portraying human beings and, as a rule, it can only be done with the best of intention. It is hard to see how anyone could possibly think that there is much point in watching such movies when they show people having sex with animals. The reason I am writing this is because I've noticed a trend in certain forms of media. For the past couple of months, I've been obsessing over whether or not we will have another Godzilla movie (aside from the usual "Weird Al Yankovic" rip-offs).

Can the intensity of a husband's love for his wife lead him to cover up a crime,despite betrayal on many levels? Tom Wilkinson is no brutal Othello, in the setting of modern day England. So, gradually a web of deceit begins to be woven. And, we witness cycles of jealousy and drunkenness and guilt and fornication. And so the web of "separate lies" begins to fail and then hold together again. And life (and death) goes on, despite the bright flame of the husband's love and the deep despair and guilt woven into so many lives.

I think this show was right on the money for me. I watched it over the plane but there were parts in the movie that made me control myself from tearing all over the place. The chemistry between Richard gere and Diane lane was very believable (fantastic acting on both parts)! I loved how Diane lane's daughter acted in the show too. She displayed maturity and how she transformed throughout the show was easy to believe as what a teenager could possibly be like in real life. I loved this show from start to end. Definitely recommended for the romantic people out there!

When I saw this movie i expected it to be a cheesy American movie done on the cheap with appalling acting. It wasn't. In fact, some of the comedy was pretty good. The characters seemed to really like each other and didn't care what the rest thought of them.I did have one real gripe -the ending was not funny.The only redeeming feature about this movie is that it is in 3D. That's great! This film starts out nice and innocent, with a family of kids who come to find out that they are actually part of a big conspiracy.

I saw this movie on it's opening night, and enjoyed it. I probably would have enjoyed it more if I hadn't been sitting by my father. My father saw the original (unfortunately, I have not seen it yet) and kept talking through the whole thing. He kept saying that the movie sucked, and that it was stupid. The thing is, he didn't understand that the creators were slightly making fun of the horror genre with the film. In every horror movie, there is always a certain character depicted.

I know this movie is n't for everyone , and I wo n't push my opinions on you , but I just found it so interesting. If you're not into horror films, this film could easily be for you . However if you do like horror films then you may want to look elsewhere. For those of you who are a little older, this movie isn't going to give you much hope. I'm sorry, but even I had trouble coming to terms with the idea that this was ever going to be anything more than a decent B-Movie.

Has the proliferation of relatively high quality shows on the proliferating TV networks made it possible for people to produce, direct, finance and/or star in their own films who might otherwise not have been able to? Is that a good thing? This film does not answer the latter question either way, but it does appear that without Curb, Jeff Garlin would not have been able to make I Want Someone to Eat Cheese With. Like most new producers/directors, Jeff Garlin's independent piece heaves a heavily more sensitive sigh than the vehicle he is primarily known for (Curb).

I don't see that much wrong with this movie. Granted, the principal singers might not be Luciano Pavarotti and Maria Callas, but they can certainly carry a tune. Burt Bacharach and Hal David are talented songwriters and I happen to love their songs, especially "The World Is A Circle", "The Things That I Will Not Miss", and "Question Me An Answer". Some people claim that Hermes Pan's choreography is ghastly and that the snowy mountain sets look as if they were made of plastic; I disagree on both counts.

I thought Besson's film managed to do without words what few films have been able to do with them; Capture true human emotions. The main character's struggles, triumphs, set backs, hopes and desires are all so honestly shown that you wonder if he is acting at all. The film has a low budget and is obviously made without the glitz and glamour afforded to most Hollywood productions but that minimalism is what allows this film to transcend the stereotypical Sci-Fi labeling and become a true drama. However calling this film solely a drama would take away from the fantastic post-apocalyptic plot.

This film was made right in the area where I grew up and now live. I know personally most of the property owners of the various locations used in the film. As a teenager, I worked in the fields surrounding the isolated road shown late in the film with Ron Perlman, Jonathon Furr, and the car. I am told that Jonathon Furr and Ben Allison are are natives of NC. I was fortunate to see it at a local showing. At that showing was one of the people who helped select locations and secure props, such as the bus (1938 Greyhound) used in the movie.

These critics need to find a new job ! ! ! This movie is based on a TRUE STORY , it tells about a real life girl who was kidnapped and brutally killed by gang members . I do not care about how many stars this film got, it's just boring to me. There are so many bad actors in this movie. They look like the same old people they always appear in. It's one thing to have a plot that goes "OMG WTF DID HE JUST DRAW A BANGIN OUT OF THE WATER?!!!!"

"Don't Torture a Duckling" is one of the coolest Italian horror films I've ever seen, and I've seen my share. To call it a giallo is a little misleading because it's not really a typical murder mystery. It's more of a straight horror movie.Complete with one of the most brutal and gory scenes ever in a movie this old, Fulci's twisting and turning film oozes with a creepy ambiance and an old school Italian feel. The setting is perfect: an old Italian village. The music is ridiculously perfect.

( Synopsis ) Graduating high school senior Bartleby `` B '' Gaines ( Justin Long ) finds himself without a girlfriend and the prospect of romance is no longer in the cards. In his quest for love and success, Bartleby ventures out into the country to pursue his dreams, including a new lifestyle that includes hunting, fishing, and camping. However, he doesn't want to spend too long away from the people he cares about--especially those who don't have enough to feed him. Now, Bartleby travels across the United States on a quest to satisfy his inner child.

'Captain Corelli 's Mandolin ' is a fantastic film in itself . It is nothing like the book , which I thought would have been better for its intended use. For one thing, we do get a lot more action scenes, but they're hardly any spectacular (although some are entertaining ). I had never seen this film until recently, so I didn't know anything about it beforehand except that it stars Gary Sinise and Tom Wilkinson, although I must admit I'm not a huge fan of their acting skills.

This is by far one of the best movies I have seen in a very long time . Top 20 on my list! I don't know why they called it "A Beautiful Mind" or "Lolita", but I must say I didn't like it. There were a few plot holes that made me question whether it would ever be released, but most of them were minor at best. If you've got a certain type of man who likes to read and watch lots of movies then this movie might be for you.

This was the greatest movie I have ever seen in my life, the action was great, and i was so scared, there was a lot of gore WHICH MADE It GREAT, i would see it 1,000 more times, and Paris Hilton, D*MN she fine in that movie. But anyway, i would recommend it to anybody, even kids(like me) Adults like it to. You would probably have nightmares at night though, but beside that, IT IS AWESOMe, I CANT STOP BRAGGING ABOUT IT.

Then again, I like Rachael Ray. She is fun, sweet, fresh, and such a joy to watch. I have to alter just about everything she makes as I am a vegetarian...but it's great to see her with a program that shows more of her personality. After all, she is a television personality. I think it's cool that she is so inviting with her fans and still appears to be down-to-earth. The studio audience appears to be rather small, but that just makes for a cozier environment. Some people have posted that the show sucks.

I never thought I'd say this about a biopic, but there is a near over-abundance of characterization (especially concerning Kenji Miyazawa's emotions) and too little on the literal occurrences in his life--by the end, I'm not sure if he dies (he's supposed to), or if his sister finally dies (she's supposed to), or if the director spent a little too much time on the Galactic Railroad (that's an inside joke, in case you missed it--Miyazawa wrote a children's book called Night on the Galactic Railroad).

This is probably the second best of the Death Wish movies. Death Wish 5 is the best one.Death Wish 3 reminds me of "West Side Story" with a new twist. Not even the recent flick "Gangs of New York" can measure up with one New York neighborhood in Death Wish 3 which is plagued not by two rival gangs---but one big gang. A gang that is willing to do things like cutting a person to death with an ax if he trespasses on its set.Deborah Raffin, who plays a public defender, plays gently in this action-packed movie that is filled with a lot of shoot-em-up violence.

I tend to get furious when hearing about Lucio Fulci's reputation as a director. Too often he's categorized as a no-talented filmmaker, only out to shock and disgust entire audiences with images of pure gore. True, his films contain more explicit filth and sickness as your average mainstream American production, but his films always are of wide range and the plots are gruesomely morbid. Don't Torture a Duckling is yet another story! This film is a pure gem of the Italian shock cinema! I easily dare to call this film a masterpieceit's an old-fashioned giallo that includes all brilliant aspects of genuine horror.

`` Back in the Day '' is an interesting , but flawed effort . Ja Rule stars as Reggie Cooper (a guy who plays a football coach and gets into an accident that results in him being permanently disfigured). He's portrayed pretty well; he's got a serious look on his face! "I knew there were better movies out there, but if you had to choose between some of them I'd pick this one. It's hard to argue with any of the positives, although it does have a fair share of flaws. It's very simplistic, and boring at times.

As an English teacher, I appreciate films that do more than tell a story. Good films, like good literature, cause one to think, reflect and predict. This film made me do all three. Mr. Jansen takes risks and uses foreshadowing, symbolism and interesting turning points for many of his characters. I also likes the fact that despite the choices the characters make in the film, their choices do not seem as adolescent or felonious as other films I have seen. The acting is pretty good and the actors seem to share a good chemistry with each other.

An old man is riding his bike down a village road when a car comes out of nowhere, strikes him down dead, and keeps driving. The rest of the film is spent discovering who hit him, why he was hit, and what consequences this murder will have on the rest of the village. Separate Lies is a very British movie indeed. I'm not saying that hit-and-run car accidents are a particularly British phenomenon, but the way everyone reacts to this tragedy is very British. Tom Wilkinson plays James Manning, a hard-working, respectable citizen with a "stiff-upper-lip" attitude towards tragedy.

This film is not really a remake of the 1949 O'Brien film (which is excellent). It borrows the main premise--a man has been poisoned and spends the rest of the film trying to find his killer. But I like that the writers chose an English professor, instead of a private dick, as the protagonist. The plot is also quite original. In general, the film moves along fast enough to keep you awake. But what mars this film is a strange dated quality about it (probably due to the horrendous 80's original music score)combined with an affected "noir" feel.

`` A Slight Case of Murder '' is an excellent TV movie , which is defiantly worth the price of admission to see or even watch. But you're better off getting this DVD for $5 or if you need to see a good, low budget horror movie, I'd recommend going to The Cabin in the Woods . The reason I have high expectations for this "classic" movie is because of the score. The original score was actually very good, and the film sounded much better than it actually was. There's never been a movie like this, but this one sure is.

I saw a sneak preview of this Tuesday night with a group of friends and we had a blast ! The stars are so much better than when I first saw it in theaters (I think that was way too soon!). This was supposed to be the good old '80s action flick, but the whole film is just bad. Everything is horribly paced and uninspired. There is nothing interesting about this movie or anything going on around it. This is the movie that has all the ingredients you want in a horror flick - lots of violence, gore, sexualized women and little things like that.

"I am ... proud of 'Head'," Mike Nesmith has said. He should be, because this film, which either has been derided by many of us or studied and scrutinized by film professors, works on many levels.Yes, it's unconventional. To many, frustrating. It's almost as if the producers hand you the film and tempt: "You figure it out. "You probably already know that The Monkees TV show was a runaway marketing success that depended upon business acumen and no small serving of public deception. TV shows are about selling soap and toothpaste first, than to entertain.

This movie shows that the free enterprise system and the quest for the almighty buck transcends all racial and ethnic barriers. A film like this should be watched to learn more about the world we live in, why people get so worked up by it (like I do) and some of the basic things that people need to protect themselves and their property from other humans. The plot line is very contrived. The actors are given little screen time because the story doesn't have any. There's nothing really interesting to discuss with the audience beyond the fact that everyone is a rich person.

To experience Head you really need to understand where the Monkees were when they filmed it.This was as their series was coming to a close and the group was near break up. Their inventive and comedic series (sort of an American Idol of their day) took four unknown actors and formed a manufactured supergroup around them.This is their take on their "manufactured image" and status as the 2nd tier Beatles. They always felt they were in a box, trapped, and unable to find credibility despite their talents.It is also a hell of a musical-trippy, inventive (I have the soundtrack) and full of surprises.See it with an open mind.

They Made Me a Criminal is a remake of an earlier Warner Brothers film , The Life of Jimmy Dolan . I really love this movie. I remember watching it on the small screen with my dad and he was impressed by it. He told me it would be one of his most memorable movies, and I agree. It's a very interesting tale, but it falls short of being true.First off, we never see Jimmy Dolan in any of this movie. We never even hear his name, let alone see him act. All we have are the credits and two scenes of him in jail.

Lucio Fulci, later known for his graphic horror films like The Beyond and Zombie, was years earlier a master of the Italian giallo (in the company of Argento and Bava) with films like A Lizard In A Woman's Skin and his masterpiece, Don't Torture A Duckling. This film has all the elements of the Italian mystery/thriller genre known as the giallo, but really pulls the viewers in by having each key character with a skeleton in his/her own closet. This keeps you doing as much detective work as the detectives in the film itself. Who is killing the young boys in town?

I tend to get furious when hearing about Lucio Fulci 's reputation as a director . Too often he 's portrayed by bad actors and not so much by his talent or skill. A film like this must be seen in theaters because it really is a masterpiece ! It was filmed with great attention to detail, the costumes were original , there was a special effects sequence ,and the story lines were absolutely riveting. I can't wait for the sequel ! And don't even think of asking me to see the opening scene (which I've seen twice) !

Despite all the hoopla about THE TROUBLE WITH TRIBBLES episode , THE BALANCE OF TERROR might just be the best drama of 2013 so far. It's got a little twist here or there, which makes the whole thing even more funny, and doesn't try to be something that can't go on for an hour. Well I've been watching ALL THE RAGNAROK'S REUNION SONGS and when they are over you can really tell that this show has lost it's soul. So I had to get this DVD/CD box set from my local shop and I was excitedly awaiting its release.

It reaches the minds and feelings of everyone driving them deep in the black desert . A brutal but beautiful story that will be a comfort to those who want to understand it. The whole movie just went off my mind. If I'm going to spend time watching this film, I should probably do something productive rather than try to make out what is going on. The direction was really poor and the actors didn't seem to get along with each other at all. It did take a little while for the plot to unfold, but when it did there wasn't much to work with.

My Architect is a great film about Nathaniel Kahn's search for himself via the legacy of his famous Architect father, Louis Kahn, dead since 1974. The film builds slowly, but perfectly, and what starts out as a seemingly lost fortysomething's identity crisis unfolds into a beautiful tale with much deeper meaning with regard to the importance of love, loss, family and perhaps more importantly, our life's work.I had never heard of Louis Kahn prior to this film, although I was vaguely familiar with some of his work.

Although this film never attained commercial notoriety , my experience has led me to conclude that many well-done pieces of work are lost due to their failure to do so justice. The film, in particular, did not reach a level of quality where it had to be seen by countless millions. It is really a shame that this movie should end up on DVD or Blu-ray as the original theatrical release was more than enough to entertain and entertain alone.The only reason I gave it four stars is because the commentary tracks can be quite enjoyable. This movie was one of the biggest flops ever made.

A mix of 70's drug humor along with parody of medicine and classic story line. As I've often said about this flick - if you don't get it - you're way lame..... Classic lines such as (parapharsed) "I've got this erection and it won't go away no matter how many times I do it. You're a nurse, what can you give me for it?" Nurse replies "all I have is 5 dollars and my wedding ring..." Great sound track.The classic "Hyde's got nothing to hide".

Better than it has any right to be , this movie died a quick and painful death at the American Film Institute Awards. Sure, it made an impression on some people (see my previous review). I don't recall anyone calling it an artistic failure.I think many people were disappointed in the film. If you aren't a diehard Kubrick fan, but still enjoyed his work, there's probably a few things for you to love. It's just disappointing to see something so obviously superior fall off the screen.

SHOWTIME is a mess, but it's an entertaining mess. The plot is forgettable, the satire is lightweight and the action sequences, though well-staged, aren't that exciting. But I laughed. A lot. Credit goes to the inspired pairing of De Niro and Murphy. They have great chemistry. Murphy delivers the one-liners, De Niro cracks us up with a look or grimace. This movie will get a RUSH HOUR-like reception from the critics. Don't listen to them. If you're a fan of De Niro or Murphy, you're going to enjoy this movie.

i love this film ! ! maybe it is my generation but i can really connect with what he is saying in his book and I don't feel like a bad person for doing it ! This movie reminds me of a friend who once sent me an e-mail saying that they would like to buy it because she thought it reminded her of the movie Night Of, but I couldn't get past the fact that it doesn't have a single good moment. I'd actually been a fan of John Barrymore for years before seeing this.

I saw this movie when it first came out in 1973 and loved it. Since then I've searched for a video but never found it until now, 33 years later, when I ordered it from Moviehunter. Sorry to say it doesn't hold up. This glamourized version just can't rise up to the 1937 production level. I love Burt Bacharach's musical score, that is if listend to by itself, and I even bought a CD of it, but for my taste it doesn't lend itself well to this mysterious and compelling story. Just doesn't fit.

I hope, from his seat on Heaven's comedic throne, Spike Milligan can see and can enjoy this film, as Terence Ryan and Ken Tuohy have taken a book that the author himself said writing it "nearly turned me mad" into a joy to watch.The film tells the story of the Irish town of Puckoon and the problems befallen upon it when the partition between Northern Ireland and the Republic is drawn up, cutting its way through the centre of the village and, more worringly, through the middle of the churchyard.

What a shame this movie was never released. (It is now playing on cable.) I tuned in based on my high regard for the stars and was rewarded by seeing a movie far better than the ones I've been paying to see in theatres recently. I like to be surprised. So often movies are marketed as "offbeat," but are in fact more of the same old recycled drivel. This movie is genuinely different, with the bonus of a heartwarming message. Jonathan Pryce sings like an angel.

When his elderly mother Emily ( Jeanne Bates ) is attacked by her lodger Nestor Duvalier ( Brion James ) she decides to live in a small cabin just off the beaten path until she can find him a new, more respectable home. There are few scenes in this film that aren't utterly forgettable: one of them being the opening credits. While it is well-done, it does start with an extremely awkward and slow-moving shot of a boy on a skateboard, which quickly goes back to normal as if he were just moving through a field of grass instead of something more serious.

The Aristocats is really quite charming , and is rated far too low on IMDb . The songs are n't bad, they're just not my cup of tea. There's nothing in the book to recommend it, if I know anything at all :P
Not a fan of Shakespeare, but I like this story about an aristocrat who marries a lady whose father is accused of incest. I thought I could get away with reading this novel for some time, as I am a HUGE fan of French literature (the likes of which I have never experienced or heard of), especially that of Robert Bresson.

I saw this today with little background on what to expect of the storyline. I go to the movies as an escape, to leave everything behind and enjoy a "story". I found this to be a good movie, not great, but good. It was worth my money and my tears :)Diane Lane was wonderful as always, Richard Gere isn't an over-actor. He held his own and has a certain presence that we always come to expect. He brings his own style to the movie.I think it was the kind of love story that doesn't always get told.

It was Libby talking to Desmond in the flashback , and if anyone is confused about her past ( like I was) it seems to have something to do with where this story is going.... This film has some pretty terrible acting. The main character is a complete asshole who does everything he can to cause trouble for everyone. His wife and kids just sit by and watch him try to get out of jail. It would have been much more entertaining if she had just killed herself, instead of getting in his way.

Accepted is one of the best teenage comedies I have seen in a long time . It has an original premise that is entertaining, well written, and makes you smile at some point in the sequence. However, once again it starts getting really boring. There are too many stereotypical roles that are played by very good actors. The problem isn't with the characters themselves, just the fact that the script is way too clunky to be taken seriously. This movie took me a long time to find. In fact, I only found it online because my father was out of town.

Telling the story wouldn't be the point at all, would it? Barnens ö, spelled almost like "booné aww" is the title for that brilliant novel of the late seventies that shocked a lot of people, including myself.Children's Island is the title, and what an island. In the book, Raine, the main character has The Guiness World Record Book as his own Bible. And he's keen on breaking new records himself. In particular the youngest person under water for three minutes.The story is, as most Swedish films and books of the time, deep, consciously provocative and awe inspiring.

I remember seeing this film when I was fairly young & being quite disturbed by it . I found the way that it portrayed women in general to be appalling.This is a very bad picture and if you have a problem with nudity (and I do) then I don't think there is much hope for you. You will want to see it as a children's film so you can tell your parents that you did not watch it. A lot of people complain that the actors are too young. I watched the 'Mamma Mia' version of Mamma Mia.

I did not know what to expect when I decided to watch this documentary. I knew it was about an ex-Viet Nam POW in Laos who escaped, but I didn't know much else. In reality, I wasn't expecting too much. Oh what a surprise! The story of this man's life is very interesting in itself, but what sets this film apart from other biography-type docs is that Dieter himself tells most of the story himself. Dieter is very comfortable in front of the camera. His personality really shines. He tells his story about his life growing up in Germany during WWII and the hardships.

i did not read the book. nor do i care to. the movie was a beautiful romance, and i think women will enjoy it. no, it was not a "10" film, but it was enjoyable. women, if your man is bored as mine was, then watch it yourself. hurt is wonderful as the philosophic doctor who delivers a thoughtful monologue on "in love" and "loving. "also, if you like nick cage, he was terrific and funny. i enjoyed watching the developing romance. also, if you like Christian bale -- do see him in equilibrium.

Easily Lucio Fulci 's most respected film , `` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' is highly renowned for it's excellent cast of actors including Robert De Niro, Jim Carrey, Bill Murray and James Woods. I think this film is so terrible that I'd be lying if I said I found myself watching it with little to no comprehension of what was going on in the movie. What happened to the story lines ? Where are the characters ? I don't know why people still watch it ! It's ridiculous ! How many other films would you turn to to find out what is going on!

What a surprise this film was . I 've seen a good few of Fulci 's horror and zombie flicks over the years, but never had anything inbetween. It seems as though there is something missing that would've made for an interesting tale.The plot is pretty simple - two women are having a sexual encounter while on vacation in San Francisco. The story moves along into a creepy mansion with blood and gore everywhere. When they get back, the "wet nurse" comes to check on them because she has just been bitten by an animal.

`` Pearl Harbor , buddy . '' This movie is brilliant ! Sure it does n't exactly flow like an actual movie, and it only has one "true story". But boy was it worth the price! I had never seen this before in the States and thought it was great ! I'll be honest, this movie doesn't have the charm of others. If anyone can do it better I would really appreciate it, if you can find a director that can make it into a masterpiece.The script is actually quite poor and the acting is just awful.

Really, This movie should be released to DVD. I just got a bootleg copy of what I think was a studio film and I was utterly pleased!!! It was on my list of films to own simply because of the cast. Three of my PEOPLE, Michael York, Olivia Hussey. Both having been in Romeo & Juliet, and also John Gielghud. sorry about the bad spelling, were in there so on that alone I thought that for the small amount I was spending it would be fine. Boy was I right.

Lucio Fulci 's `` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' paints an exceptionally unflattering portrait of small-town Sicily plagued by poverty. It is no wonder, then, that when I was asked about my opinion of this film last week, I couldn't help but raise an eyebrow with the following statement: "How on earth does this movie have anything to say about homosexuality? Did the director or producer not know the subject?" I am not saying that it's bad. There are certainly good aspects in this movie. There's a lot of talent behind each actor.

'Captain Corelli's Mandolin' is a fantastic film in itself. It is nothing like the book, which may disapoint its ardent followers. Yet, viewed on it's own, the film is a masterpiece. The views are spectacular and the acting isn't too bad either!! Nicolas Cage was brilliant-so different from his usual action hero type characters. Penelope cruz is superb and really holds the film together. I think that this film has to be judged as an indivdual project-not related to the book. Louis de Bernieres gave up rights to the film script, so the film is an interpretation of the director, john maddon.

Chaplin is a doughboy in his final film of 1918, a doughboy who can not seem to get the marching down straight. He spends time "over there" in World War One trenches. Several gags stand out: Limburger cheese as a makeshift grenade for one. The cramped quarters of the barracks in the trenches and when Chaplin and his mates are washed out of their bunks by flooding are highlights. Chaplin ends up capturing several German soldiers single-handed, and he spanks the German commander for refusing a cigarette. When asked how he did it, Chaplin replies that he surrounded them.

What a great film! I never knew much about Buddy Holly, but was familiar with his lively and fun music. This is a wonderful biography of someone who helped change the music in the 1950's. Although I never cared for Gary Bussey, he was fabulous as Buddy Holly! I don't know how accurate the movie is, but assume at least for the most part it is accurate, which makes the movie all the more interesting. The music throughout the movie just adds the pizazz to this biography. I don't think I would change a thing in this film, it was all good!

Hey all you jive hustlers , you stone foxes , you mean dudes . Watch out cause Slaughter is back for his 2nd show. If you have to know the story then here it goes. I'm very familiar with the horror genre of horror movies and there is a movie entitled "The Haunting of Hill House" where an old couple moves into this new house in town. Things aren't going great for them, so they do some sort of experiment which leads them astray. They end up becoming the victims of evil spirits that are possessed by the witch who killed their son.

At one time `Buddy Cop' movies ruled the box office. It seemed that every summer flocks of Beverly Hills Cop wannabes descended on our nation's theaters. Not any more. Lately the gusher has dried to barely a trickle. The drought has eased a bit recently with the release of Showtime, a movie that is a genuinely funny and consistently entertaining example of the genre.Mitch Preston is a dedicated cop. He's not a Dirty Harry type by any means. He's just incredibly focused professional who's completely intolerant of anything that gets in the way of the performance of his dutieslike, say, a T.V.

You know, people who make comedies so often forget it's really ok to be outrageous. Well, not this time. Unconditional Love has it all. Barry Manilow and a dwarf in a movie with Cathy Bates as the romantic lead...and it works. Not only does it work, it works very very well. In fact, I think it's perfect. I laughed so hard I think I hurt myself yet the main characters were all so human, so honest, and so very real. But isn't that where great comedies come from?

This is an example of what film school lecturers would call a good debut movie . It follows all the clichés of the genre, except it does it well. The actors get to show off their talents in one of the most beautiful and believable films ever made. In my opinion there could have been much better dialogue and dialogues were they had done them a lot better with the plot.There is no shortage of quality movies on DVD today, but this seems to me to be the weakest in terms of story. This is a very poorly acted and scripted movie.

They Made Me a Criminal is a remake of an earlier Warner Brothers film, The Life of Jimmy Dolan which starred Douglas Fairbanks, Jr. as the prizefighter on the lam.Even with the restrictions now upon production by the Hays Office, this remake actually turns out to be better than the original. Douglas Fairbanks, Jr., is horribly miscast as a pugilist. John Garfield with his background and style steps into a part he was born to play.They Made Me a Criminal was directed by Busby Berkeley who Jack Warner believed in keeping busy in between musicals. Berkeley in fact would soon be leaving Warner Brothers for MGM.

Sacha Baron Cohen is a genius . And this movie is good ! Although the film does n't nearly reach the levels of The Great Gatsby. That's because it was written by two Hollywood actors who couldn't make up their minds on any point. The script is terrible. The characters are all awful and annoying. The dialogue is terrible. The story isn't very interesting to anyone except for one character. Also, there is no sense of humour. There is no real comedy at all.I have been searching for something I can actually say about this film which is that I enjoyed it.

My impression, having seen this documentary, is that Nathaniel Kahn ended up with more questions than he had before he made the film. He took five years to make it, a labour of love and longing. I can only imagine the turmoil of the editing process, what to leave in, what to take out. His father, the renowned architect Louis Kahn,comes across as a man too selfish and self-absorbed to be emotionally available to even one wife not alone three. But like many men of his character, he attracted women who were spellbound by the remoteness and entranced by the creativity.

While I agree that this movie lacks any real substance and should not be taken seriously , its primarily directed by one of Hollywood's top acting talent who has a knack for making films. I'm really disappointed in this film. There are plenty of great actors throughout but the acting is far below par. They spend most of the movie trying to do all sorts of funny moves on people. Some of it comes from their characters but you know, it's just plain bad acting. I have been waiting for this movie for a very long time .

Ah the Outer Limits. I love that show. It was surpremely creepy, or down-right mysterious. I loved all the genres of the show, from horror, to thriller to mystery, whatever the genre, it was good. I guess I must have started watching way after it got canceled, when Sci-fi showed it as re-runs, or played marathons of it. It was a really good show, I don't know all about the seasons and everything but I do remember that every time I saw the screen freak out and the voice on the TV say: "There is nothing wrong with your television.

The big names in film tried to do their part for the war effort , and Charlie Chaplin was no exception. In his early 20's he met a young girl named Joan who showed him that she was into the movie business. They soon hooked up, and this is what we know of Chaplin:
He worked hard on films that were great at the time but would have failed with today's technology. His movies include "Horse Whisper" (1962) and "Dorothy"(1964), although they were not very well-known at the time.

We loved this movie because it was so entertaining and off beat-- Not your usual Hollywood drivel.My husband had a Blockbuster coupon and passed on a string of new releases of violent Hollywood stuff. He was about to walk out when he saw this and decided to take a chance. There was only one copy -- and with some glitches in the DVD that we finally had to flip to wide screen version and then back to the full screen version to make it stop stalling. But it was worth it. Cathy Bates is so good and she was so perfect for the role.

Who could have thought a non-disabled actor could act so realistically and immensely powerfully as a disabled person in a film?" "Yes, yes it really was." My first thought after seeing this clip was: "this isn't even close to what the movie was trying to show. The acting is awful." It's not that I found any of the actors annoying, or bad looking, but I just felt like the film didn't try to convey anything about how disabled people should be portrayed in this society.

This movie possesses something most other movies of its genre do not: intelligence and good messages. Accepted, is the story of a kid named Bartleby (Justin Long) who gets rejected by every college he applies to. His parents are incredibly strict, frustrated and disappointed. So, Bartleby and a few other students who face similar problems start a fake college, to pawn themselves off to their parents as college kids. Not everything goes to plan, and the movie is about them winging it. But behind this plot which sounds ridiculous, there are good messages, morals and a new outlook on the American educational system.

Before I forget, let me say the artwork in here is outstanding. From garbage cans to the huge cruise ship, the drawings are beautifully done. If this wasn't animated, critics would be lauding the "direction" in here, because it's really good.To the story: Sylvester is picking through the garbage at the shipyards but the pickins' are slim. While brooding at the dock next to a big ship, in a porthole he spots Tweety in his cage. Tweety spots him, too, and you know his first comment - the same one he always makes when he spots the cat.

A surprisingly great cartoon in the same league as Batman:TAS and its ilk, I enjoyed it in my youth and recently had been able to watch them all again, great voice acting from Tim Curry, Richard Moll, Tony Jay, and Maurice LaMarche in various roles. The only qualm I had was Rob Paulsons voice seemed a little too old for the title character, but that wasn't a big deal as the stories were great, and the fact that the whole thing has a great time loop twist ending.

Oh my word ! ! I have never seen a film so lacking in any kind of moral judgement or drama. It does not begin and end like a well-written, well-acted novel. It takes place over the course of a short period of time, and consists of a bunch of random events which don't add up to a complete picture. There's an awful lot of "plot twists". The first part of the movie was very boring at first, as were most of the other parts of the movie, except when the plot did turn on its head.

The A-team is still repeating every day on Dutch television ( RTL7 , around 1800hrs ) and I still watch the news in my bed because of it.I really didn't realise how hard it is for people to get a grasp of the history of cinema, but I did when I saw that one of the most popular shows on British TV is based on a myth. There's a whole series called 'A History of Western Civilization', about the early history of Western civilisation, and there's a whole other one called 'Dinosaurs of the East' which deals with the evolution of ancient creatures.

People comparing this movie to big blockbusters like Lord of the Rings or the Matrix will inevitably be disappointed with the way this movie turned out. Although it lacks in the big special effects department and there are no battles with hundreds of extras, there is still a masterful amalgamation of two old folk tales here. The acting talent, although not A-list, is still great and the interaction between the characters is perhaps more sincere than in a larger movie with an A-list cast. My particular favourite from this movie is Bridget Fonda, whose performance as the Snow Queen herself was quite moving, assisted enormously by a stupendous wardrobe and makeup.

No, I have not seen the original series and I won't compare the two if I had. This series is filmed in Canada in Vancouver and Victoria, British Columbia. The series is well-written in a different story each week. Some are little out there but most of the time it is the quality of the story telling. I loved the Afterlife episode with Clancy Brown and Barbara Gerrick and the Deprogrammers episode with the irresistible Brent Spiner as a Deprogrammer in a world where humans have become slaves to a lizard reptilian species.

Little Gus is a ten year old delinquent. He runs away from his parents and decides to go on a road-trip. Reaching the petal is somewhat tough for him, so he creates a device to help him. His goal is to win a gimmicky lottery type card game called Motorama. He has to find all eight letters in order to spell M-O-T-O-R-A-M-A. Dark laughter follows as it turns into the road-trip from hell. He runs into some deranged Lynch like characters. Most memorable is the gas station attendant, who puts his picture on a kite in hopes that God will see it.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The film captures and interprets his artistic method ('sketching' poems), his inspiration (the spirit of nature and its fantastic beauty) and his struggles to accept a harsh reality in the face of his idealist imagination.The film integrated excerpts of Miyazawa's poems into the plot beautifully. His relationships with his students was powerful, especially in one scene where he offers everything he has to a student who has just been caught stealing materials from the classroom.

I thought it was brilliant ! It was great watching the presenter tracking each one of them down . Dwight D. Eisenhower was supposed to have been in this film, as did his son. In reality he wasn't. This was a pretty good movie. When you are watching an airplane crash into the ground in the middle of a desert and the plane that is flying out takes off with everyone aboard, the audience is going to want to know if they are in danger. Unfortunately, the answer is actually no. I would still recommend this at least slightly to those who are interested in the story.

I was pleasantly surprised by the depth of story and character development . Fulci was a master at creating horrific stories that were not simply about violence but also about family, sexuality, and social issues such as homosexuality and rape.The script is well written and manages to be entertaining while keeping the action moving along smoothly. I liked that he was willing to take more risks than most heroes do in the horror genre. Foulci has been a long time fan of The X Files , so when i saw this movie, i knew i had to give it a shot.

As many of today's movies are guilty of, the plot isn't exactly stellar, the movie doesn't move anyone, and certainly this won't warrant any award (outside of Blockbusters' perhaps)...but then again, who really cares.Eddie Murphy and Robert De Niro team up to produce a very funny, at times hilarious, movie that I really enjoyed. Russo and Shatner played their small parts well as well. Man, I hope in the future my wife ages as well as Miss Renee has.Moving along, this "buddy" cop-flick produces high laughs in a reasonable amount of time.

We saw La Spettatrice at the Syracuse International Film & Video Festival & liked it.This film delved into the fear we all have. Fear of rejection, fear of intimacy and most importantly fear of our own inadequacies.The three lead actors, Barbora Bobulova as Valeria, Brigitte Catillon as Flavia, Andrea Renzi as Massimo are match well to their roles and are excellent. It was a joy to witness the dynamic between the three of them as it seemed real.I believe Barbora Bobulova is a stand out. I hope we see much more of her in the coming years.This film doesn't take the easy way out.

An interesting look at the immigrant experience, told as a fable with some very weird imagery.I got drawn to this movie because it tells of immigrants from Sicily who traveled to America. I imagine much the same as my Grandfather did at that time. Travelling in steerage to provide ballast for the ships, I cannot imagine it was very comfortable, as shown in this film.Laws restricting immigrants existed. I would guess that these laws were more strict on those who came from the Mediterranean and Africa. Immigrants had to be free from contagious diseases or hereditary infirmities.

Louis Khan was one of the most influential architects of our time , and this film speaks volumes about how badly his style and vision failed us.I watched this film a few times while in college, I can't believe I did. It had a huge impact on me, it was so much fun to watch...it's sad that my childhood heroes weren't able to live up to their potential.It should be noted that The Phantom Menace doesn't have many redeemable traits, which makes it just as bad a film as its name would indicate.

That this film flopped at the box office, and still struggles for the recognition it deserves today, is a great pity - yet somehow rather appropriate. The commercial suicide the Monkees committed by making this film is mirrored by the metaphorical suicide they commit on-screen. To destroy so brutally their carefully constructed image as a wholesome American alternative to the Beatles is courageous to the point of rashness, as is the admission of being no more than pawns in the entertainment industry, trapped (in the movie, literally) in their own artificiality.

`` D.O.A '' is an involving and entertaining little picture from start to finish . Dennis Quaid is at his absolute worst as a bad-boy con artist who goes out of his way to hurt both himself and everyone around him (including the camera). The dialogue is atrocious and it would be easy to pass it off as just that if you were so inclined. I think this film really was one of the most poorly produced movies I have ever watched. First of all, I don't know how anyone could enjoy the film in its entirety.

I never heard of architect , Louis Kahn , until this documentary . In this almost two hour documentary which has been described as a film on cinema, you learn what Kahn actually did to architecture in New York City before his death. Kahn is portrayed by Tom Stoppard and plays one of the most prominent architects of his time, Joseph Schoenberg. You can make up your mind about whether or not they have made an art film that is even remotely good. There are no redeemable qualities for this film whatsoever. It's simply a re-creation of an old Hollywood movie.

Without going into any details of a good ... if a somewhat provocative ... TV movie , there seems to be a certain way to do it, but I can only think of one that could make me feel at home. The first thing that came to my head about this film (which I watched the night before) was the fact that it has absolutely no plot whatsoever. The film just starts and the characters just sit there and wait for it to finish, then begin to speculate as to where things might go with the main story.

A very suspenseful giallo from the director of `` L'Anticristo '' ( 1974 ) , this one begins with a man walking through an alley in search of his lost father. The story is interesting but not quite convincing, as there is too much repetition and dialogue which seems out of place amongst the more realistic aspects of the story. I had never seen this film before, and I was excited to see what it could be. After seeing it several times at the theater, I finally took the time to watch it.

Spike Milligan 's books and plays have defeated film makers over the years , and 2002 's 'Puckoon ' is certainly no exception. It was one of the first British films to ever make a splash in the U.S., and when it made its debuts in the U.S., audiences immediately started asking about the cast, director, storyline, and many other details. There are still a lot of unanswered questions for us to try and crack, but with this movie, I can say with certainty that there's going to be much more to come from the film as we go forward.

My friends and went through a period of time when we would rent movies that none of us had ever heard of. The only good that came from it was this movie, "Take it to Limit" Right as the movie started, we could tell we were in for a true classic. The music is probably done by rural white boys from Colorado, but it sounds just like early 90's rap. The star of the show, actor Leo Fitzpatrick, plays the bad-boy so well, especially sporting a big zit the entire movie.

I thought I might be disappointed viewing this film again after so many years. On the contrary, I was more impressed now than in my callow youth with its honesty and brave humour. In 1969, the transition among African-American groups from a predominant policy of conciliation and integration to one of confrontation and self-determination was still quite new, and more than a little controversial. It took courage and finesse to portray both the Establishment and the Anti-establishment as the caricatures they often closely approximated in real life. Special mention should be made of Arnold Johnson's performance: he successfully avoided having his character lapse into either sociopathy or buffoonery.

Pierre Jolivet plays a Don Quixote character, unable to speak, living in a world incompatible with modern life. He trusts to his homemade weaponry - helmet, sleeves, and spear - made out of hubcaps, seat cushions, and discarded office furniture. Just as Don Quixote rode Rocicante, "The Man" rides his contraption (literally) transcending the lost lives caught up the harsh and demeaning modern world - soaring above the earth, away from the plight of modern man. Both characters ride in search of adventure in an effort to right the wrongs of the world.

Diora Baird is absolutely hot as hell in this movie. But really all the characters are amazingly fun to watch. (MINOR SPOILERS) As per usual, the main character, B, is the sane one of the bunch. B has this crazy idea to make up his own college when he's rejected from all colleges he applies to. He's known for making fake IDs. so an acceptance letter is no problem.Because B's dad is a hard @$$ and suspicious of this university he's never heard of, B gets his friend Sherman to design a website for the university.

Another go round with the monkey king going west....sort of.Beginning in the middle of some action the movie just goes from the first frame onward.A monk and his three disciples go to a town to get the sacred suras that will bring peace to the world once they are translated and spoken to the world.But an evil force has intervened and kidnapped all of the children of the town. The evil force wants the monk because if you eat him you will live forever. The retainers battle the forces of darkness before forcibly sending the monk off for safety (The monk thinks he can win simply by reasoning with the bad guys).

There's no point in comparing this with the original series. Though different in look and content, both are true to the original idea. That is, an SF/horror anthology series. Due to indifferent scheduling in Australia, I've only managed to catch a small number of episodes spread over the first few seasons. The very first episode really did give me the creeps (nightmares at my age ...!) but a number of others did fall flat; generally when the stories moved into horror realms and away from SF. I only hope the DVDs reach us eventually.

To say the truth, I went to see this movie only because Nicolas Cage is my favorite actor. Folks may not agree, but he makes equally good performances in bad and good movies. I haven't seen a movie with Penelope Crus before, so I was anxious to see whether she is a good actress. So, here's what I think:The movie is good (I haven't read the novel, however). Some moments were really thrilling and... unexpected. Altogether you'll find the plot pretty simple.

Wow, What a wonderful film-making! Mr. Im has done it, again!His last work, ChunHayang (2000) was a great film, but this one is even greater. Selected as an official feature film in the Canne Festival for the second time in a two-year row, this 66 years old director is getting better and better at what he is making of with a Korean culture.Simply, Chihwaseon is about a great Korean painter, '(Ohwon) JANG, Seung-Up' who was considered as a prodigy in the late Nineteenth century.

I just saw this film and I recommend it. It has a very good plot, it holds your complete attention, the acting is superb, Tom Wilkinson was fantastic and Emily Watson was also very good. A very good film indeed, about great and unconditional love. Tom Wilkinson's character is a man who is not prepared for the ordeal that is about to begin, but he takes the matter in hand as the story progresses, and this great actor gives a performance that makes you feel the character's anguish and suffering.

it's a good watch if u have time - deals with three friends who get into a needless bar fight, and get into serious trouble. they find themselves fighting some shadowy people, and can't deal with. very, very disturbing portrayal of japan, the arbitrariness of modern life... some intense scenes, but a bit of a potboilerthe spoiler was that the plot is not too clear based on English sub titles. obviously, i don't know Japanese.the only other Japanese movies i've seen were kurosawa, who is a different and far loftier than this modern genre.

Chucky is back but this time he is not scary (a lot) - but he is funny!When Chucky is brought back to life (in the doll, of course) by his old trailer trash girlfriend, Tiffany, he promptly kills her and transforms her into a doll, too. Tiffany and Chucky are now on the case of 2 high school graduates - eekkk! !Don't miss this film - it is a whole lot of fun. It is scary, funny, weird, wacky and stupid all in one!My rating : 9/10.

Let me clarify that. This is not a "good movie", but I am so glad it is out there, I am so glad I saw it, and for the role that it plays in my DVD collection, it is sublime. It is the ultimate PG-13 romp, it is college as we imagine it will be when we're freshmen in high school, it requires so much suspension of disbelief that it may as well be taking place on Mars. It is so wholesome that even when it tries to be dirty it wouldn't make your grandmother uncomfortable.

These days, you rarely come by a kid's show that does not involve 1) a preteen/teen pop star who is as amusing as watching paint dry 2) involve a plot about finding the perfect date with a different guy/girl every time 3) revolves around erratic yelling and unintelligible humor. About 95% of shows on Disney, Nickelodeon, and Cartoon Network fit the listed criteria. To put in simpler terms, they all lack good acting, originality, and good story telling. It as if producers and writers think kids aren't smart enough to understand character development and plot detail.

I loved this film, which I have just seen at the Philadelphia film festival. In March 2005 I went to India with 2 friends, and this movie was very real. I related to everything, and savored every moment. The characters are believable, the story poignant and the ending realistic, but not sentimental. I also enjoyed the discussion with the director after the showing. This movie shows very well the blending, but not complete mixing of 2 worlds (East and West). The supporting cast was wonderful, depicting the life a tourist encounters in India quite realistically.

The cinema of the 60s was as much as time of revolution as the politics and the music . Filmmakers like Stanley Kubrick and Steven Spielberg, who spent most of their time in Germany and Sweden, had nothing but good things to say about the Nazi dictatorship. "This is a film that doesn't really do anything special on an emotional level; it's not a true thriller. It's quite a bit like 'The Shawshank Redemption.' You know the kind of movies you see on TV when they're getting away with murder. This is a far cry from that kind of movie.

I watch tons of movies and had no idea this would be as good as it was . I was not expecting so much, even if it wasn't bad. This is a really cool story but the plot itself just didn't feel right. I wanted to like the movie (I know it's a fun show) but when I watched it I noticed all the problems with the movie. The premise is actually very simple but the acting was terrible! The two main characters aren't that memorable. All they did well was try to do something stupid and then fail miserably.

But a great cast ! Jonathan Pryce , Kathy Bates , Rupert Everett , Lynne Redgrave , Julie Andrews and Tom Welling make an incredible team. I don't know how you've managed to get those actors to all fit together in any one scene. There are just so many scenes that take place over the course of about ten minutes or so. This movie has no substance, no depth, no purpose for the time it was created. I can't believe this movie was made. The acting was poor, the writing was terrible, the dialog was incoherent.

The movie starts with a board meeting at a major advertising agency . Putney Swope is on the board for his firm as well. He has a friend who knows how to build an airplane. So, let's get this straight here. The "A" team in this movie wants to go to outer space. What are these guys thinking? Well, like all good science fiction movies, they're just trying to stay alive while making their way back home. So, we'll take it one day at a time. Let's face it: most of Hollywood films are awful and often downright stupid.

We saw La Spettatrice last night @ the Chicago International Film Festival & we were both immensely moved by it! There was not a word of dialogue that you couldn't have told from the beginning. In fact, the movie had nothing in common at all with any other film I've heard of. This movie is pure nonsense. First of all: I hate this movie. That's true for everybody else but for me. First of all, I would like to note that I am an old fart when it comes to reviews; however, I don't really care much about what anybody thinks about movies.

If you've never experienced the thing that is Zasu Pitts, here is a Zasu zinger! In 1933 Mae Questel caricatured Pitt's voice for the character Olive Oyl for the Fleischer Studios animated cartoon version of the comic strip Popeye. Zasu (pronounced Zay-Sue) does her best "Olive Oyl" impersonation walking around whining and ringing her hands or attaching herself to the policeman's laynard. I kept waiting for her to say "ohhh myyyy", but instead it's "something always happens to somebody." The first time I saw this film I loved Zasu and found her character really funny.

I recently saw Blind Spot in Coyoacan , where it drew a huge crowd and some pretty intense discussion . There's only one problem. I don't like this film. And that's what the critics are saying: "Why is this not better?" There's nothing much wrong with this film except that, well, you can't do anything interesting here. The characters are boring. The story is shallow. The editing just doesn't do justice to the atmosphere of the scene. The actors who play their parts are either clueless or inept.

When I saw this film at a festival years ago I was very impressed and I started to looking for more information on what happened to the film crew when it was stolen from the set. I'm a HUGE fan of Robert Altman films. He has made a huge number of great movies that were so original and well thought through that nobody else can compete with them. The movie "Lone Survivor" by Altman is perhaps my favorite Altman movie. This film was one of those films that never had an end, but just kept getting better.

I thought I might be disappointed viewing this film again after so many years . On the contrary , I found it enjoyable to watch as it had something for every kind of viewer: young adult, male or female, anyone that enjoys horror movies and more than one genre (no spoilers):
This was actually my first time watching "Horror Movie" but I really enjoyed it. It is a lot of fun for kids who don't know any better. I have seen this at least 30 times. The script is very good. There seems to be no wasted material in the movie.

A great movie. The movie was even better then the commercials put on. And believe it or not it was very very inspirational. I really think anyone who walks out of the movie at the end will be inspired one way or another.It was kinda corny at the very beginning, but quickly picks up. I laughed. I laughed very hard on some parts. The acting is basically above average, nothing special, but better then average. I can safely say it was the second funniest movie to come out this summer (1st funniest being CLERKS II).

I've commented once on this Chucky great, but I had to do it again to say some things about the film, when I first saw it in a great balcony in a great theater. The film was a lot of fun in the theater and my first Chucky film ever in a theater, and that was a special moment for me, because I cherish Chucky. The other horror villains are referenced with GREAT COOLNESS!!! And the gore was shockingly great! The scene where the gay kid gets nailed by the truck was amazingly cheerful!

I still ca n't describe what to feel when I received this by the fnac site . Such a rare and very unusual product. One thing about this is, it looks like they have tried to recreate some kind of old-time radio. I thought it was pretty good. The problem is that the way it has been filmed on video makes you wonder how it actually looked like in real life. There are a bunch of shots of things being blown up, etc., but it does take a long time just to get from one shot to another.

Obviously the previous reviewers here are not fans of this genre, but I think this one is done quite well.It's twistedly cute clever & dark. This story brought back memories of the types of girls I was in love with as a child.Also, it makes me want to check out some of Nadia's other movies, many youtube comments about how hot she is in this video. Sure there is some Burton influence here, but I wouldn't say this Brad is trying to rip him off.He is just jumping in & adding his talents to a genre that I can appreciate.

where do we go from here? that is the overriding question of this film. And make no mistake, 'mainly ETC. ', the 2003 effort from director john jansen, asks far more questions than it answers, but none so poignantly or so powerfully as this one.much of the the film plays like a running conversation between you and your college drinking buddies, and I'm sure many of the questions raised by the main characters you'll recognize from your own evenings of drunken debauchery. however, one of the many beauties of this film is that we are rarely given an answer.

I think I was recommended this film by the lady in the shop I was hiring it from ! For some reason they didn't have a screening or anything on the schedule but I decided to send her a message. She replied with "I can't believe you hired me to write and direct!" And then proceeded to insult me about not being able to learn to speak my native tongue! It was such an ugly scene, the director couldn't do anything but sit there and look at me and make stupid comments about how funny it was!

I have to admit that I approached this movie with a sense of expectation and dread . Louis de Berniere was in his forties (for those interested). He had an eye for dramatic effect, but was probably not the strongest director out there. I'm not much of a fan of low-budget movies anyway. A few weeks ago I saw The Big Lebowski , which was pretty great, although it wasn't my favorite film of all time. I was quite disappointed when I saw this film again today, because I really loved it as a kid.

The Buddy Holly Story opens on a shot of a yellow neon moon on the roof of a roller rink in 1956 Lubbock, Texas. As the credits start, the camera moves down from the moon to the parking lot, into the roller rink, past the concessions and across the rink to a small bandstand where a small band is doing their sound check. It's a tracking shot Welles and Scorcese would both appreciate. It cuts to Buddy Holly's bespectacled face peering down in rapt concentration as he grips the headphones and talks to a man putting this band on the radio.

( Some spoilers included : ) Although , many commentators have called this film surreal , the term fits poorly in this case, because it is actually very real!The story starts off well, as you will see. The main character's girlfriend goes out to her local restaurant and has a "date" with a man she met at a bar earlier in the day. But he doesn't take her home for some reason. When she decides to go out again later, but this time to the mall, she sees another guy walking down the street and makes up with him instead.

I do not think that this movie deserves the low rating that most will give it . It 's one of those movies with no redeeming qualities. There are some great performances, but even then there is enough to satisfy any fan of horror and thrillers. If I wanted to give this movie five stars I would. Not only does it make me cry when I watch it for just the first half hour, I feel guilty for being able to watch it. This movie makes no sense and has absolutely no emotional depth. The plot is so incoherent it is almost comically ridiculous.

First of all, around the time I wrote this comment, I had already read what kittiwake-1 had written about this game and was confused. This is a video game and not an actual movie. I mean, I myself would choose a good Deniro movie or playing a video game any day. But, dude, what are you talking about? Now that I have that out of the way, let's move on, shall we? The video game adaption of Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon is, as you may have guessed, based on the movie of the same name.

Let 's be fair : there are no RULES for scriptwriting , so I wo n't say the movie SHOULD have been anything else than what it was meant to be. It's like when people complain about "not being in control of the plot". And then when someone actually does a little bit of editing on that film, it gets worse. When you look at the credits, you'll see the director and some of the cast were paid for their role. The actors they were paid for were very good as well.

This is another film where the cinematography is the best thing to recommend it. That would be fine if the film were a travelogue, but as a dramatic exercise in cinematic artistry, that is not good enough. The theme of inter-species respect and co-operation ventures timidly into the forbidden world of inter-species love, but its approach is stereotypical, indicating a lack of understanding of the behavior motives of either species. As with many films, one always wonders what could have been achieved by a more innovative director and a more creative screenwriter. Alas, we probably will never know.

Chucky ( the murderous doll from `` Child 's Play '' and 2 crappy sequels ) is dead . But, he's not dead. It seems to me that we can find a way to rehash the same plot but without actually killing or torturing anybody. The movie is too cheesy for me to give any more comments on this one. This film has very little emotional impact. I never thought that I could live through this movie because I was only 9 when I saw it. I watched it in my late teens and found out that the director had died of a heart attack shortly after its release.

First of all , around the time I wrote this comment , I had already read what kittiwake-1 had written here . I was surprised to see that, but not surprised. It's been done before and there isn't really anything new or unexpected about it as such. Kittiwake - 1 is just an awful piece of film. Like a bad movie, it makes little effort to be any more interesting than its premise. You can tell by how badly these two characters have gotten into each other's company that they want nothing to do with each other, except for watching movies together.

Who ARE the people that star in this thing ? Never heard of them ! ! But this is one of their own movies , so I guess they must have a lot to say .
