The actors are all nice looking enough, but they are just not that interesting. They do not move well or sing very well, nor do they have any good chemistry with the rest of the cast. The directing is also rather poor. There were two scenes that I was absolutely amazed at how bad the directors could pull off, even when the script says it is going to be some kind of action comedy .

This musical has a deep meaning which is appreciated by only a few . The wise can see the wisdom but they have nothing to contribute. There is also a feeling of humor that I would not recommend to others. Just for this reason, I cannot recommend this movie to anyone who is seriously interested in music. What makes this movie appealing to me is the plot and the quality of the acting. A man's life is suddenly turned upside down - he wakes up with no memory left of his wife and three children.

I 've been a fan of Rachael 's since the beginning of 30MM on the Food Network , so I knew that she'd make a great TV show. For the first time, though, it just seemed like this was another low-budget, half-hearted attempt by one of the few people around who really thinks they can sell a TV show at the expense of all else. (If you don't have a credit card, go ahead and spend some time searching Craigslist.) The script is awful in every major respect, and the actors are pathetic, to say the least.

For all those people who believe the dialog is worth something, and who appreciate a farce that is clever enough for you to take it seriously, this movie will surprise you. It is not a 'whodunit' for people who can't aren't able to follow the verbal exchange of our hero, Professor Dexter Cornell (Dennis Quaid).Cornell teaches in Southern California, near the tar pits. He has not published a novel in four years, his wife is divorcing him, he drinks a bit much, and is blessed or cursed with caustic wit, which he freely dispenses to his students.

I went to the pre-screening of `` Rory O'Shea Was Here . '' I like this movie better than I thought I would. If you're not familiar with O'Shea, he was an extremely talented actor and one of the funniest characters I've ever seen. Unfortunately, it didn't pan out for him. This film is absolutely amazing. This is the first film in which I watched the original versions of all the books. There were several scenes where I was totally confused. I'm sure this is what they call a "brief explanation."

Dr. Paul Flanner (Richard Gere), a successful surgeon, has his wife leave him, his son (an uncredited James Franco) not respect him and looses a patient he's operating on. Adrienne Willis (Diane Lane) has two children and discovers her husband has cheated on her. They both need to get away. She watches over a beautiful oceanside inn in Rodanthe at the same time he books a room. They're all alone together. You can pretty much figure out the rest.This is what's known as a weepie or a woman's film.

Pierre Jolivet plays a Don Quixote character , unable to speak , living in a world incompatible with modern life. The director was also responsible for films such as Gremlins , A Boy Named Sue and The Day They Left Me Behind , which made him one of the most well known directors in Hollywood. So when I saw this movie I thought I'd give it a try, and it is a shame I couldn't enjoy any of the good parts. The biggest problem however is that the film doesn't even make you care about the characters.

Head should have been a proud moment not just for its stars (The Monkees and Victor Mature), or its director/co-writer (Bob Rafelson), but also its other co-writer (and brief cameo) Jack Nicholson. As it stands, most of them seem to shun it, and to outsiders the movie is regarded, at best, as a curio.While the T.V. series was famously based on the antics of the Beatles' 'Help! ', this film is also judged by the same accord. Yet far from the trite and painfully overrated Beatles films, and even the dated Monkees T.V.

I can't say how many times that one line has made me laugh or how often I've described that scene to folks not familiar with this film. I saw it the year it was released, I was 19. I don't think there were a dozen people in that East Village theater that night. For years I thought we were the only ones who saw it. Nice to see here that others found it as hysterical as I had, and see it's lasting value despite the time gone by. Rent it, buy it or steal it.... a must see.

LOL.The mere fact that I start off my review with 'lol' says it all. I used to watch this movie all the time as a kid; and even then I sensed the silliness of it all. The low budget, horrible acting and lame script was ever apparent back then. I watched it again yesterday and just couldn't stop laughing. It's so bad it's actually good lol. Like another reviewer said, it doesn't take itself seriously. There's no way one could look at this movie and say that the makers did so.

Nominated for best documentary feature at 2004 's Academy Awards , My Architect follows filmmaker Nathaniel Kahn in his quest to build a bridge spanning the Great Barrier Reef. The result is an extraordinary visual and emotional ride of a film, which has been likened to a David Lean classic.Kahn's film takes us on a tour of this vast landscape, exploring some of its most dramatic and fascinating elements. I never thought that I would have to read about "The Jungle Book", but as I sit here writing this I can't help but feel quite sorry for the author of it.

* Could contain spoilers , read only after seeing last episode season 2 * Think about it . The guys that were supposed to be dead and replaced are back in the game, all because of some stupid plot twist . But I'll leave you with this scene where a kid runs into them for help and tells him how much he loves them. I couldn't resist giving this show a 5 star review as it has such a great cast and is so well acted. I watched this show during my freshman year of high school. It was one of the better shows on TV.

This is one of those movies where I just want to move my feet and dance around the house . . . but I know you won't let me because I'll be yelling "I didn't do ANYTHING wrong! Don't give me your DVD!" I've always been a fan of The Walking Dead. Even though the series is now over, I continue to watch it on repeat. There are many things about the show that stick with me, and they all seem to make perfect sense to me.

After a somewhat slow start I thought this movie about the Italian occupation of a Greek island during World War II picked up and became a quite enjoyable watch for a couple of hours, from primarily two points of view. The love triangle is an interesting one and strikes me as believable, because I know it happened in various places under occupation. Penelope Cruz played Pelagia, a young Greek girl engaged to be married to Mandras (Christian Bale). I had questions about the depth of their love from the start, but their future was torn apart when Italy invaded Greece, and Mandras went off to fight.

Gary Busey's best performance in a nicely-flowing biography. Since had a musical background, he was able to do his own songs and it really works. It's always good to see that fine actor, Don Stroud (one of the crickets) and Charlie Martin Smith as well.An 8 out of 10. Best performance = Gary Busey. Thankfully, Mr. Busey was Oscar-nominated for this, losing to Jon Voight in COMING HOME. A fairly low-budget flick that doesn't disappoint, with GREAT SONGS by Mr. Holly. I hope this made plenty of dough.

This show really is the Broadway American Idol. It has singing, the British Guy, A guy who's sometimes nice, and a super-nice woman.Of course it is different because there is a sing-off, and there's dancing and some acting (we just don't see some of the acting). I gave this show a 7 because there are a couple tweaks that I know a lot of people (including me)would make if they were working for the show. The first thing that really needs to be changed is the judges deciding who goes home.

"Head" is a film that has held up well since its original release date in 1968. The movie is a complete contradiction of the Monkees image. It presents the Monkees in a way their fans never perceived them; men with real thoughts. Totally controlled by their producers, the Monkees were given the opportunity to tell their side of the story. The film pokes fun at their image, the entertainment industry, and corporate America. The soundtrack contains some of their best music. It's a movie well worth seeing over and over again.

I got some free tickets via the Times to see this little know Irish movie called 'Inside I'm Dancing'... i didn't know a thing about it, so had no preconceptions before i went in.The film is about two guys who are confined to their wheel chairs, and live in a home. Michael (Steven Robertson) suffers from Cerabal Palsy and Rory (James McAvoy) suffers from Muscular Dystrophy (please excuse any spelling mistakes!). They form a bond, as Rory seems to be the only person who can understand what Michael is saying.

Some days ago, in Rome, a young Romanian man with criminal precedents assaulted and tortured to death a middle-age lady coming back home after an afternoon of shopping. A Romanian girl, who had seen everything, reported what happened.Therefore, it started a debate about the too much intense flow of immigrants from Romania, generalizing them as criminals, everyone, indiscriminately.I'm only 15, but I thought: what idea of affluence does Italy give to these poor people? How ever do they regard us as the Land of Plenty? Yesterday evening I finally saw NUOVOMONDO, and my question had an answer.

Gary Busey did a splendid job playing the rock-n-roll legend Buddy Holly(1936-59). He does have a spitting image to the man. Being a garage band in the 50's is sure different from today's. Having a group of three is usually simple back in those days. I bet that Buddy Holly(Busey) was a much better musician than most of what I heard. Since he lived in Lubbock, Texas, it was only a quiet country town back then. His parents were Christians, though his mother was a strong supporter of her son's work.

I've read a lot of reviews about Showtime on IMDb and many seem to miss the mark. I've noticed a lot of reviewers calling this the typical "buddy" film. De Niro is in no way Murphy's buddy throughout most of this movie. In fact, part of the comedy of this film is De Niro's reluctance to be friends with anybody.Murphy really shines in this one. He is back at doing what he does best, acting like a complete ham. He is a cop who wants so much to be an actor and enjoys being in the reality show.

I usually give horror films around 6/10, but this one caught my eye. House of Wax was by far the best horror film I have seen... Even better than the Amityville Horror.Paris Hilton was quite good in this and I must say, has a good future ahead. Her death scene was probably the coolest. I'll just say how she dies...She gets a giant pole right between her eyes and they close-ups on and everything. Gory, eh? Brian Van Holt was very good as both the killers, Bo and Vincent (Vincent had the long hair).

I taped The Morrison Murders on Lifetime Movie network and I watched The Morrison Murders on Lifetime, Lifetime Movie network and on Courttv. Jonathan Scarfe and John Corbett did a great job of playing Luke and Walker Morrison. I am glad that Walker got his brother Luke to confess of murdering his parents and their brother Bobby. I enjoy watching True stories on Lifetime, Lifetime Movie network and on Courttv. The Morrison Murders is a good movie to watch. Next time The Morrison Murders is on Lifetime, Lifetime Movienetwork or Courttv I am going to watch The Morrrison Murders again because My favorite actor John Corbbett is in The Morrison Murders.

This film biography of early rock and roll star Buddy Holly (1936-1959) is a tour de force for Gary Busey. The movie's highlights are Busey's stage performances where he plays guitar and sings Holly songs. He brings such energy to the performances that Holly's own filmed performances almost pale in comparison. Busey's infectious toothy grin lights up the screen, he creates a totally believable and winning personality and his Oscar nomination for best actor was well deserved.The film follows Holly's career from growing up in Lubbock, Texas, to stardom and New York and his untimely death in a plane crash.

What a surprise this film was. I've seen a good few of Fulci's horror and zombie flicks and was amazed that this was by the same director. He also wrote the screen play which shows that the chap was quite capable of crafting a detailed, complex story line. The dubbing on this is not good, but far from the appalling slop that only further hinders later howlers like 'Manhattan Baby'.The photography in this film is fantastic. A strange, almost futuristic highway appears throughout the film which focuses on a small town where young boys are being murdered.

After a somewhat slow start I thought this movie about the Italian occupation of a Greek island during World War I might be ok, but it's too long for my liking. I was a little excited to see this movie when I saw it in the news because I had heard that it was something special; and so I went out and looked it up on the Internet. Well, there is nothing particularly special about it. It's just another film about Italy and Greece. What else do you expect from a war film? The cast is horrible and their performances are laughable.

The Monkees , surprisingly , are a big favorite of mine . Yes , they might have been the original "lost generation" but that was an era, not just a time frame. The Monkees' first movie (1954) didn't quite do well enough to be worthy of their place in the pantheon of the golden age of rock n roll. And yes , this movie does feature a hilarious monolog by Gene Siskel. So if you want to see all the greatness of the music of the '50's and '60's, I guess you need to start with 1954.

I 'm not a huge fan of Lucio Fulci 's films . Most of his 80s gore films had their moments but nothing really special. However, if you like gore and violence then this one can be for you. I'm going to have to go on record and say I wasn't too impressed by the rest of the cast (although there's a lot of talent), but when it was time for my blood sacrifice I went out and bought a bottle of champagne...well, no, I don't know how I ended up drinking it, or even what happened after I finished ...

Just about every commentator has mentioned the way that some of the interview footage is superposed over the concert footage in places. This is true, and is the biggest flaw of this film. However, it isn't so often, or so bad, that one shouldn't see this video. If you are a Black Sabbath fan, you have to see this. Aside from having seen Black Sabbath in the Sevnties and early Eighties, I saw them in 2005 or 2006 when they also headlined OZZfest just like in this video.

I had heard of John Garfield, but, didn't know him. I loved this movie. I had never heard of it. I just picked it up randomly. John Garfield is a boxer in the movie. He had been in real life also so he knew his part. He was a fugitive throughout the movie. Someone else killed a man. He character was blamed. He is befriended by a family who has questions and is not quite sure what to make of him. All sorts of minor plots ensue.

I was about 14 years old as I saw the musical version of Lost Horizon. I loved the film so much as well as the songs that I went several times to the cinema to see it again and again. My mother bought the LP and I learnt the songs off by heart, just as I did with "The sound of Music" (which people hardly know in Austria). I think the problem with some of these self-appointed critics who's comments get published is that they don't have a romantic soul and didn't see the film through the eyes of a young teenager.

Due to its predictable, second-rate title, (the one it was distributed under in Italy, at least) I didn't expect much from this movie. Thought it'd be another cheap flick about a haunted house ("LA CASA MALEDETTA" means "The cursed house"). Well, I had to change my mind just after the very first brilliant scene! The constant presence of priests and the creepy atmospheres, reminded me a bit of The Exorcist and some of its decent Italian rip-offs, but this was going to be something completely different...

If you like who-dun-its , you will like this film , considered the best Italian detective story ( giallo ) that ever appeared. You should also watch the short "Benevento!". The characters are excellent, but the directing is horrible. I actually found myself really enjoying this movie after a while. The plot seemed pretty simple at first. Two cops come across a person who has been missing for 10 years. They assume he's killed, because he doesn't pay his $100 debt to the cemetery. So they find him alive in an abandoned house, but don't take him in.

I still can't describe what to feel when I received this by the fnac site. Such a rare movie, so little spoken and known, is difficult to find, even to fans, but the contrast betwen past and present is devastating: now I hold a DVD of the movie, with the finest quality possible. As I did in Atlantis, the other rare Besson movie I bought by the internet, I saw this one at home, with all the lights of my dvd and tv turned off, and marveled at the experience. I didn't know what to expect.

I first started watching The Outer Limits back in 95 when I was 10, and it just blew my mind every week with each episode, every episode had a twist and each week I couldn't wait for the next. How the writers managed to do every episode so well and make it different from each over a course of 7 seasons is beyond me. This show manages to teach us about life, robotics, Alien and human encounters, and an insight into more of the paranormal, and how it affects the people.

William H. Macy always gives a good performance. He never looks lazy and never seems like he'd rather be somewhere else. In short, he's what more actors should be like. "A Slight Case of Murder" is directed by Steven Schachter, who went on to do two more great films with Macy (Door to Door, The Wool Cap).Television movies have long been a dump of overdone acting, poor cinematography, and sub-par scripting. That's why it's so refreshing to see a TV movie that does exactly what it's sort of film was created for.

Despite all the hoopla about THE TROUBLE WITH TRIBBLES episode, THE BALANCE OF TERROR might just be the best episode of the series. And, while I have always loved A PIECE OF THE ACTION because it is so much fun, I really do have to cast my vote as this Romulan episode as being the very best.The movie, interestingly enough, is really like a WWII submarine movie in that it bounces back and forth between the cloaked Romulan ship and the Enterprise as it seeks to destroy the Romulans before they sneak back across the Neutral Zone after a raid on Federation outposts.

Final Solution is a powerful christian film that shows the hate between the black and whites that was present in the days of apartheid. It shows how this hate was contrived and was groomed from generation to generation. Jan Ellis was taught that a black man was a plague. He was raised to be that way. Then he meets a man who is on the opposite side of his beliefs, Pastor Lekota. will he change his ways?. The film is a powerful movie that shows the perceptions the different races had for one another, it shows these perceptions with quite a lot of accuracy.

Chucky (the murderous doll from "Child's Play" and 2 crappy sequels) is dead. But his ex-girlfriend Tiffany (Jennifer Tilly) gets his remains and (using "Voodoo for Dummies") revives him. Then, through circumstances too convoluted to get into, SHE is killed and has her soul put into another doll! Together they fall in love and kidnap a nice couple (Nick Stabile, Katherine Heigl) to take them to Chuck's coffin to get an amulet to make Chucky and Tiffany real people again...A lot better than it sounds.

Anyone who has seen Ali G before , should be well prepared for the full motion picture that is 'Ali G: The Movie'. For starters, this film features a whole bunch more people than any other movie out there and in many cases, they are all pretty bad actors. Of course, this could easily be dismissed as an easy-going comedy, but what about when you have someone from another planet make a cameo? I haven't watched this movie yet, but I don't think it's a waste of money either.

This new installment to the Child 's Play series has not one scary scene but tons of hilarious jokes such as "I don't believe a word he says." And then there's this: The story is filled with sex, drugs and rock and roll! There's even a bunch of singing, dancing and acting. Well, except that in some parts of the movie, they sing like a church choir. You think you're seeing the beginning of a great horror movie when you sit down at an adult film-watching party and see something totally different from what you expected to see.

I 've got to say it . Gary Busey saved this film . If it were not for his fine work, I would not have given it a second glance. This movie will haunt my memory for an eternity." This is a very entertaining movie. I found myself laughing out loud at nearly every scene. There are times where there is no logic whatsoever. The director and actors don't even seem aware of what the plot is. You feel compelled to stop and think "what the heck has happened?" And then the action starts.

Do you liked "Dead Man don't wear Plaid"? What about "Top Secret" and "A Chorus Line"? Well Müllers Büro is a fantastic Melange of all three of them, as unlikely it may seem. Very Funny "tongue in Cheek" Movie Noir hommage with stunning Songs and great Dancing. You have to have a little odd humor for this movie, but it is very well worth seeing it. I've voted it a nine, If the end would be a bit more logic it would have gotten a ten. Thats how Good that Movie is.

I just thought I would add another observation, here. While there are a couple of visual sub-references, in this episode, to the possibility of unexpressed feelings between Jim Kirk and Yeoman Janice Rand; there is a special, physically tender, moment, toward the end. When the Enterprise is reversing at emergency warp speed in an attempt to outrun a possibly fatal Romulan plasma ball, Janice, perhaps fearing that their life is about to come to a dramatic end, seeks comfort by placing her head on Jim's sympathetic shoulder as they observe the aproaching instrument of their impending doom on the main viewer.

To say the truth , I went to see this movie only because Nicolas Cage is my favorite actor . This movie wasn't bad but it was annoying.I don't even know how anyone can find a better script then the one in " The Wrestler ". It is too long, too confusing, and too boring for my tastes.The main character really should have been played by a human being who could look like he or she actually belongs in a fight instead of just sitting around looking bored. For that reason, I would not recommend watching this at all.

William Faulkner was one of the American writers to win the Nobel Prize in literature . Faulkner mostly wrote about his life and career as a journalist. In addition to this, he is a highly respected political writer. I have always heard that Faulkner was often compared to Winston Churchill during his lifetime. However, there is some truth in this. There are so many reasons why I didn't enjoy reading this book. I wasn't expecting much from this film - it's more of a parody than anything. And the actors were all very annoying. The screenplay was lame and cheesy too.

I wish there were more films about middle aged people . The intellectual journey and the twists and turns of life is so well done, this movie made it seem as if it could have been set anywhere. This is very much one of those "if you know what you are looking for then you'll be able to figure out how to watch it" movies. It's hard to tell where the movie went wrong in terms of characterization and story, I think the film itself had too much of a happy ending. What an utter waste of time and resources.

Diora Baird is absolutely hot as hell in this movie . But really all the characters are amazingly fun to watch. I thought I'd take a stab at it for those of you that missed out on "Tarantula"! It has some good ideas, including one where the Tarantula would have a heart attack...but then he'd be back in his suit! This movie started off well, with a promising premise, and a fantastic script. Unfortunately, much of that idea (and much of the action) was wasted.

I really loved this movie and have spent several years trying to get it. It is just not available and it has not been on TV for many many years. I enjoyed it and the songs because it had something different to say and made you think how every person looks at something from different prespectives. Also we often don't appreciate something we have till it is no longer there.My 12 year old daughter just discoverd the music and is entranced with some of the songs. Someday I hope to get a copy of the film so she can have an opportunity to view it.

"Pearl Harbor, buddy." This movie is brilliant! Sure it doesn't exactly flow like an multi-million dollar comedy does, but the jokes that are constantly thrown in are unbelievable. I'm one that goes for silliness, much like "Dumb and Dumber", "Airplane" and "Wet Hot American Summer" and I have to say this easily ranks up there. Movies just aren't written with this kind of sporadic comedy anymore. Too many jokes in this are such a surprise to the viewer that it's honestly amazing that more don't know about and praise this slapstick masterpiece!

probably the best horror movie in 5 years .. there 's been lame remakes , attempts to make you scared, and crappy trailers. If it's still fresh, it's a pretty good horror movie, but at best its not up to par with movies from 2004 to 2007. The first film that had me excited for what I thought was gonna be a really fun adventure was "Gravity" when I was 14 years old. In this movie, someone falls through a hole in the sky and ends up trapped in the center of an alien spaceship.

When the Romulans come , they will not be bearing gifts ; no , they bring with them war - it is their way of fighting. These things happen to every people in history; we can have none of that. I feel very disappointed when i watch this film. The story and characterizations are laughable, especially the first part where the main character finds himself a prostitute. This was done without any plot development or foreshadowing. What the hell do these people think they are talking about? No one says he needs to pay for sex either.

This movie , based on a true story of Gerrit Wolfaardt , is one of the best films I 've ever seen, not just for its quality but that it was actually filmed in the 70s and 80s. The story is so sad and graphic that it seems like it may never get out again. I watched this film last week at work and thought it would be an excellent addition to my reading selection. What made me laugh when I saw how bad this film turned out to be was the portrayal of female characters.

The Ali G show was really something amazing - he was so stupid wannabe rapper, but no one he interviewed noticed that he was just pretending. Sasha Cohen is actually very intelligent guy, who pretends to be stupid, so he could get really honest answers from people... And it is very funny. So I didn't expect movie to be good, cause it was all acted - no real people or interviews. So the basic point of all show was lost. But I was wrong - I laughed all the time, it was one of the funniest films I ever saw.

Enhanced by the expressive cinematography of Agnes Godard ( Beau Travail ) , Golden Door is a visually striking tone poem that, despite its visual appeal, cannot be described. With little in common with any previous film she has directed it seems strange to suggest that this would become one of her best-known productions. This film has many good aspects, and also some very poor ones. The acting is fine; the actors are talented and charismatic, as is their script. The special effects are really impressive, the camera angles are wonderful indeed, and they're fun to see when done right.

Although this film never attained commercial notoriety, my experience has led me to conclude that many well-done pieces of artistic expression often do not gain mass appeal. The story line depicts a young boy stealing a car and embarking on a surreal, dream-like adventure with very little basis in our conceptualization of time and space. Therefore, anyone who attempts to view this film from the perspective of its conformity to reality will likely be disappointed; it is not intended to be "realistic." It is, however, intended to be metaphoric with extensive symbolism apparent to those with superb attention to detail.

This is an example of what film school lecturers would call a good debut movie. It follows all the rules. Short scenes, to the point, cheap to shoot, guerilla-film-making, no sets (just disused buildings) and possibly an empty hospital wing. Also, even the black&white film-stock was a stroke of genius, probably selected more for its low expense rather than film effect, but it worked.Reno was amazing as the Brute. Everyone's acting was brilliant. The plot was simple and effective and no flabby bits left to distract you.

Considering all of the comedies with a military situation that have been done in history, someone had to be the first. One could make a case that in Shoulder Arms, Charlie Chaplin invented the genre.Hard to believe that back then this was a daring move. When you consider that some of the best films involving such people as Bob Hope, Abbott&Costello, Laurel&Hardy involved military service and made during war time, it's just something you accept and laugh at.In the First World War Chaplin along with fellow stars Douglas Fairbanks and Mary Pickford went out on bond tours.

As a film buff , I obviously had read all the excruciating reviews and funny , sarcastic comments about this movie over the years. However, for me this is not a comedy based on jokes. The main story line is extremely predictable and completely unnecessary from what I have seen.The movie starts off fairly well by introducing the plot of a woman (Amal) going to court to clear her husband out of a parking ticket. Her lawyer is trying to take her to jail for having an affair with a bar owner (the same man she was married to), but she says she's too upset to face him.

A beautifully photographed and paced short film . It evocatively captures the feeling of this family and much of the culture they inhabit, and gives us a good glimpse at what life might have been like without the world of technology that now dominates our lives." "As I watched this film, I had to sit down and say 'what the f*k is going on in this one?' As it is set in a near future, which is far from futuristic for a documentary, we don't really get an explanation of the people involved or what kind of technological marvels they were attempting to make.

I gave it a seven only because the acting is good. And of course by that I mean Wilkinson. The other two principals were "decent". But the characters themselves...what on earth was so bad about the character Wilkinson played (James Manning)? I didn't see him behaving like the martinet Emily Watson accused him of being. Bill Bule, on the other hand, was an insufferable jerk who I was praying would meet an extremely brutal and prolonged demise. Who was I kidding? Tom Wilkinson isn't Paul Bettany after all.

"Blind Spot" one of my festival favorites. I was totally intrigued by the idea of three strangers searching for a mysterious man who has loved and betrayed each of them in different ways. The cast is great. James Franco is particularly amazing as the broken-hearted boy from Los Angeles. His journal entries, which we hear in voice-over-narration, work well with the visuals and are quite intense. The film has a powerful style. It pushes elements like the road movie and revenge-drama in new directions. It also plays with time and perspective in ways that capture the frightening ambiance of lost love.

I've been looking forward to seeing this film ever since I first caught the trailer, and I'm so glad now that I have. It's truly a wonderful film. The actors are superb, the writing is fresh and real, the whole thing was just spot-on. I love James McAvoy in this, and I can't wait to see him in "The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe" movie this December. Romola Garai is wonderful too. Be sure to check her out in "I Capture the Castle" or "Nicholas Nickleby," two of my favorite films.

`` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' is one of the coolest Italian horror films I 've ever seen , and you'll be hard pressed to find anyone who's not either a fan or an admirer of it.I think it's worth looking up, just so you can have something in the back of your head to remind yourself that the whole thing doesn't come out of nowhere. First of all this film should NEVER be shown for kids. The plot makes absolutely NO sense and goes from beginning to end too fast. The characters are horrible and the acting is atrocious.

This is possibly one of my favorite films . It tells the tale of a girl named Gerda ( Chelsea Gray) who becomes pregnant. Her father, Frank (Lars Von Trier), believes she may have had a miscarriage and tries to hide the facts from her. While trying to get his daughter back together with her new man (Jack Nicholson), Gerda falls pregnant. However, it turns out that Frank wasn't even aware there was a pregnancy. I saw this movie on DVD last year in its entirety.

I think it definitely is . The writing is of such a quality that beginner students of the English language would want to read it, and the book is well worth the effort. I just wanted to comment on something that came up in the discussion - I am sure this book is a great one for someone looking for a good introduction to English grammar and style. I cannot recommend this book highly enough. This is by far my favorite grammar book ever made. If you're familiar with the works of A.N. Taylor (who wrote this book) then you already know why.

NIGHTS IN RODANTHE brings back to the screen two talented actors in Diane Lane and Richard Gere in a simply wonderful tale. As the title says, the main character (Lane) travels across the United States on an errand for him. However, after he leaves town she falls asleep in the bed beside him, but wakes up to find herself in a strange land. I was very confused at first about the movie. I couldn't quite put my head round the concept of someone walking around in New York City with all sorts of strange people that look exactly like her, dressed as she is.

Right this may be the wine talking but this could be the best movie I've seen in a very long time. Granted I spent much of the first half an hour wondering what the hell was going on but once I had accepted that I would never understand everything from the subtitles I was able to enjoy the film.Can you really hate a film where a staff turns into a flock of birds that defecate over the enemy? What does character development matter when faced with a lesbian alien princess whose people built the pyramids? Why does Buddha wear seriously blinging diamond earrings?

This is my favourite Columbo. Martin Landau (excellent!) plays twins, one of whom may have committed a murder. This Columbo is unusual because the usual murder scene at the beginning doesn't give you any clue to which one did it! Peter Falk is on form as usual in this episode written by Steven Bochco (who also wrote 'Murder by the Book', my second favourite episode). The supporting cast are great especially Julie Newmar (very under-rated) and Jeanette Nolan as the house keeper that Columbo just keeps on upsetting.

When `` Madame '' decides to let her cats inherit her it spells trouble . The snobbish Butler Edgar who gets a bit over excited at first has no idea what kind of cat he's dealing with when he falls in love with the pet hamster. To make matters worse an old man comes into town to see if he can find someone to buy him an apartment. This was not the worst I've seen. But, this was the worst show that I ever tried to watch on TV (which I'm not saying isn't bad--just that it was just awful).

The revelation here is Lana Turner 's dancing ability . Though she was known privately to be an excellent nightclub dancer, we never heard much of her acting or singing talent. There are two things I particularly hate about this film. The first is the way there are a few scenes that feel very similar to others from the 1960s, but it really doesn't matter. There are so many reasons why this would not have worked. For one, the movie takes place in the 1980's and has virtually no action scenes.

Better than it has any right to be, this movie died a quick and painful death at the American box office. At times sophomoric, at others, bitingly satirical and witty, Jekyll and Hyde is mostly just a near perfect reflection of the times, laden with drug and sexual humor, reminding one at one time or another of everything from the Woody Allen of "Everything You Always Wanted To know About Sex" to the Mel Brooks of "The Producers", Saturday Night Live to Monty Python, Carlin to Cheech and Chong.

Gary Busey 's best performance in a nicely-flowing biography . Since had a musical background , he was able to create a great story, even if it wasn't one for most people to follow. In short, this was no good! The first half of Christopher Lee's "Star Wars" movie doesn't really do much to impress you; the acting is pretty average, the special effects don't exactly make you fall in love (and I have seen enough films where there are multiple explosions), and there isn't too much going on either.

Buddy Holly was a pioneer and victim of the early days of rock 'n ' roll . The young singer/songwriter (he was just 19 years old back then) started his career with a solo album that he recorded himself, but it never got any airplay. This movie may seem to be all over the place. I have seen it in many places as well as some TV shows. Some say it's so bad you can watch it again. Well, I'll tell you about it. When I was younger I watched this movie on my home computer.

i did not read the book . nor do i care to . the movie was a beautiful romance , I can tell you about that in the next blog . This story is extremely well written with believable characters and events.The plot of the movie was also pretty interesting.I must admit though that the ending of this movie did not make any sense, so I would like to try to understand it somehow. The whole movie seemed to get progressively longer as we went on. I have to wonder if anyone even wanted to watch this crap after watching the movie, because there are no more than five minutes left.

When the trailer for Accepted first came up , many people began to get excited about seeing it ... really excited!! Well this is a movie that you just can't help but LOVE when you first see it, because I know some of you will hate it. In the wake of the recent controversy over the movie, and in response to all the talk of what the "worst movie ever," I decided to take a good look at the box art for this one. Here's how it went down. The film itself was on sale in select stores around the country before opening.

Unconditional Love is one of the best movies I 've seen in a while . It 's an emotional roller-coaster that will leave you wondering why you bothered. The movie doesn't really have anything to say but if you were to watch the scene it would be obvious what exactly is going on behind the scenes. To me, there is only one "good film" for this week, which is "The Exorcist." Even though the movie is great, we need to remember that it is a horror film (not a spiritual one).

This is one of my favourite Disney films . It has everything you could hope for in a Disney animation, but no matter how many times I watched the film, it still didn't appeal to me. There are so many things that could be improved. The story, the special effects, the cast, etc all need improvement.The acting was really good, however, some of the performances were not as "professional" as they should be. I thought that this movie would have been very interesting and maybe even enjoyable, but instead, it turned out to be an extremely boring mess.

Whoever plays the part of J. Douglas Williamson in the strip poker scene does a wonderful job. He apparently received no credits. Too bad.All the Dead End Kids do their jobs beautifully in this 1939 entry. It is odd to watch them in a Western setting with their Brooklyn accents ( I guess that should be Bowery ). They even show some swimming abilities.I think there are many special scenes that can stay with the viewer of this boxing/love/crime story. My favorite right now is in the fight scene near the end of the film.

These critics need to find a new job!!! This movie is based on a TRUE STORY, which has made history. It illustrates beautifully how even in the mist of war and tragedy love can conquer all. The breathtaking Chephallonia of Greece has captured my heart and soul as if I too were there. The Blue eyed Cage & the delightful Cruz were amazing! Together they perfectly portrayed how a Mediterranean couple can only become closer in the time of war. This movie will touch your heart like it did mine you must go see it!!! !

Lost has been one of the most mesmerizing and thrilling experience I 've ever seen . Not only it 's a wonderful film , but its cast is absolutely fantastic. There is nothing more than a good mix of actors, cinematographers and directors that you will love to watch over and over. It's a great horror movie with an awful ending, but that doesn't stop it being entertaining as always.I'm not even going to waste any time on how bad the ending really is (it makes it look worse than it is actually).

I think that anybody whose dumb enough to risk being a wax dummy just so they can go to a concert with a group of strangers, who have no idea what's going on, and who probably don't know what the fuck they're talking about, must be pretty dumb as well. "Let me get this straight. It's not my fault that I am a stupid ass? No. Because I was trying to figure something out. Let me stop you there. If it were really your fault, how come you did NOT find out?

When I started watching 3 of the episodes of this series on the Action Channel,I have to say out of all the shows that I've seen that ADV released,this one is one of the best shows of all time. I had to see it again,and that's when I got my chance. I bought the entire box set of this series at Best Buy for my 20th Birthday. And I got to enjoy it,and see more of the episodes that I missed on Action Channel,and the same 3 episodes that I've seen.

I love this movie , though I do n't like how they picture Egyptians , being an Egyptian citizen myself . The only reason I like this movie is because the actors are very competent in their roles. They all speak with a naturalness that keeps me entertained and gives some of them some depth. What makes this film so appealing to me is that it portrays a realistic world where Egypt's ancient civilization has gone extinct. The opening credits sequence introduces you to the great Egyptian historian, Amenhotep III who we learn was murdered by a group of people under orders from the Pharaoh, Khuja.

If you 've never experienced the thing that is Zasu Pitts , here is a Zasu zinger ! In 1933, Zuckerman made his first feature and it was a great box office hit with audiences. In this film, Michael Palin plays a young lawyer who is called to represent a boy accused of raping his mother in the woods when she is home alone. He is about twenty-four years old. He makes his initial presentation to the court stating that he cannot remember the name of the girl at the time of the crime but will attempt to convince a jury that she does exist.

The movie is incredible , it has a sound track which sets the tone for the movie . THe lines between comedy and drama are very difficult to figure out. I think it was intended as a film review, not a movie. It's hard to imagine how something like this can be made fun. If you're ever going to watch such a stupid movie, why make one that isn't? In other words, WHY NOT MAKE ONE THAT HAS NO REAL SPOILERS!!! The plot is atrocious. All the actors are horrible.

I never thought I 'd say this about a biopic , but there is a near over-abundance of characterization (both good and bad) in Burt Reynolds 's life.The film lacks the balance of character and emotion required by most biopic, which is not to say it was boring.In general, Reynolds was not an actor worth watching, and his performances were poor. One can't argue with Reynolds as to his talent for dramatic acting, given his success as a screenwriter on such classics as The Great Gatsby and Catch Me If you Can.

What a great film ! I never knew much about Buddy Holly , but was familiar with his lively and entertaining characters. I am really looking forward to seeing this . This is my new favorite Woody Allen movie. I'm not sure what the hype is about or why there were so many complaints from critics who don't understand how great a movie he is. He's a decent guy, doesn't have superpowers, and is quite capable of making jokes. Even when he falls down drunk (I don't think it ever happened), he still manages to get himself out of trouble.

It took me a while to find this movie since they don't have it yet on DVD (and my VCR is not worth hooking up again). I guess all the referencing to drug use is too much for some folks. But I found a decent bootleg on Ebay and I must say that anyone who takes this movie too seriously is just retarded. It is a slap stick spoof in the vein of "Airplane." I must say that when I watched it on Showtime or Spotlight growing up in the 80s, I enjoyed the humor a whole lot more then, than I do now.

Another enjoyable Warner flick . I really liked John Garfield in this , though I 'm wondering why Cagney was left off. In all seriousness, there's nothing funny about this movie.I'm pretty sure the producers of this film wanted a good score on it, but they failed to find anyone who can write one. And that's a shame. Why does someone have to go through so much pain and suffering for an idea? Who is willing to waste time or money trying to produce something that isn't working out? What are you seeing when you look at this "work?"

This is a stunning movie. Raw and sublimely moving. It felt like a very gripping, intelligent stage play (but without the overly theatrical feeling one actually gets from watching people on a stage) which plays on everyone's terror of a white lie escalating to monstrous consequences. All of the main players are mesmerising. Tom Wilkinson broke my heart at the end... and everyone else's judging by the amount of fumbling for hankies and hands going up to faces among males and females alike. Julian Fellowes has triumphed again. He's a national treasure.

If you expect that this movie is full of action and grabbing you from the start then don't watch it. But if you like those kind of meditative movies which stick in your mind for a while, until you get the details, then you will love it. Now don't get me wrong there is action and there are things going on just not in the usual way. Basically the plot is in a post-apocalyptic world where anyone fights in his (or their) way for survival. In this fight they lost the ability to speak...

I do n't usually like this sort of movie but was working at home and wanted something to halfway watch so I went for it on a whim. There's no story, no characters to care for (no one seems to really give a shit). All the scenes are so uninteresting that they're almost entertaining. The entire thing just makes me want to scream. Even if you're not a fan of violence and gore all the way around there's still plenty going on that doesn't get any attention. I didn't even realize this was an option until after finishing it.

Hey look, you don't watch this movie to change your life! But if you are female especially and have always had a little thing for Richard Gere; this movie is right up your street. Diane Lane and Richard Gere have on screen chemistry going way back. 'Nights in Rodanthe' is not a Oscar winner movie and it will probably be forgotten sooner rather than later but if you want an atmospheric, beautifully shot love story between MIDDLE AGED good looking people (they don't make your stomach turn and even when Gere is 'on top' he does not look too jowly) then this is the movie for you.

NIGHTS IN RODANTHE brings back to the screen two talented actors in Diane Lane and Richard Gere in a simply beautiful story of a man and a woman hungry for something more in their lives than they have at present. The chemistry between Lane and Gere is magical from the first scene in the film to their last embrace. The locations, beauty of their attraction for one another when it unfolds when they first meet, and the story that follows, and as they begin to know each other with the attraction they feel towards each other is real, is romance that is projected to an audience with tender care.

For those out there that like to think of themselves as reasonably intelligent human beings , who love film , video games and sci-fi , but don't want to spend the money for a ticket, just give it a shot. They may not be perfect, they certainly can't write great films, but with their talent, they should at least put on something resembling an acceptable screening. I had seen some bad reviews of this film, so when I was watching it in the theater, I knew that it was good! But what shocked me was how awful it was.

Louis Khan was one of the most influential architects of our time, and this film speaks volumes about how little everyone really knew. His son's desire to find out who, and more importantly what he was is moving, and emotional.This film captures the spirit of what architecture is really about, what good design is, and the emotional price that is paid for it. Equally haunting is the sound track. If you see the film, and then listen to the sound track you can revisit the film simply by listening.

In this early Fulci work the director shows his most mainstream side as well as a talent for compelling storytelling. I would suggest to everyone who wants to make such an impression, watch this film! It's quite amazing what you get out of this thing. This was supposed to be a comedy based on the novel by George Orwell (1928), about a small-town American writer turned CIA agent tasked with destroying a communist plot that is threatening the country. This was not a particularly good movie, despite it having some good ideas, and it took a decade to actually finish it.

I remember seeing this film when I was fairly young & being quite disturbed by it. I found the storyline very distressing and can still remember the various bullying techniques used. One in particular was when the other school children spat in his soup before he could even taste a spoonful. They also bound him and shaved his private parts. This was all because he was unpopular. Why was he unpopular? Because he was bad at games. I have a feeling though that even if he was good at games he would have been bullied because it's hard to decide what makes someone popular.

As far as I know I 've seen most of Lucio Fulci 's films , with the exception of some brief scenes, and there's no way that he would film them at this very minute. In a film like this, it's totally necessary to give the audience a good time! That is why I gave him so little attention during my visit to Rome . There's really nothing interesting about any of his films . He's not one of those big names that can bring out the masses and make them happy.

What's the point of this messages if not to discuss and share thoughts about the next season... Here is my forecast: 1. The hatch was indeed blown, but somehow everybody inside survived. Buts lets see about that. 2. The episode at the end with the tent is an observation team monitoring the tracking device installed on Desmonds boat by Penny. Now that the magnetic shield around the island was lifted, the signal was picked up by the observation station and they are going to send a rescue mission. 3.

Mark Blankfield played Jekyll and Hyde.Michael McGuire was the dad.Tim Thomerson was the plastic surgeon.Did you even see this movie? This movie stars Kevin Costner, Jennifer Connelly, John Goodman, Robert De Niro, Peter Serafinowicz, Steve Carell, Bill Murray, Michael Caine, Jane Fonda, Jim Carrey, Jason Statham, Christopher Walken, Chris O'Donnell, James Brolin, Patrick Swayze, Robin Wright, Mark Ruffalo, Timothy Dalton, Edward Norton, Ian McShane, Jeff Goldblum and many more. I don't understand why anyone would pay $50 to see a film with that number on it.

Another popular screening for a British picture at Coalville 's Century Theatre . A well crafted , solid drama with excellent acting. But it was not what you thought. For me I can only compare this to the movies I've seen in the past several years, but none of them are good. The film was written and directed by Chris D'Arcy, who went on to direct some very good movies back in the 90's. That said, this is an over-produced movie that could have easily made for a great thriller, or even better than that, something more challenging (with lots of CGI).

If you get a chance to get a hold of this lost ( for many years ) gem , I highly recommend it . It was released in 1977 and is one of my all time favorite movies. I'm not normally the kind of guy that says I hate certain genres, but there were times when "Star Wars" was the only thing on my mind. This movie just doesn't cut it. There isn't anything interesting happening throughout the film other than some explosions. The ending is completely predictable from the beginning and even after seeing the credits I couldn't tell if the original trilogy would survive.

Oh my gosh!! I love this movie sooooooooooooooooooooo much!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It is so incredible......I loved it as a wee babe and still love it as an adult. It is my favorite Disney movie of allllllllllllllllllllllllllllll time! You should watch it, watch it and love it. My friends and I watch it a ton.....It is soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo good. I recommend it to anyone who is a child or a child at heart.

If you like who-dun-its, you will like this film, considered the best Italian detective story (giallo), Fulci has done.It's not Mickey Spillane for sure. There are scenes designed to disturb anyone.Many would be offended by a local beauty trying to seduce a 12-year-old boy. She was joking, but she was naked nonetheless, and he would have jumped at the chance to jump her bones. She also tries to tempt the local priest.Young boys are turning up missing, and there are several interesting suspects. You have to watch carefully to discover the killer. Can you?

OK so Paris Hilton sucks in it (typical Malibu Barbie) but the rest of the actors are just great! I watched the film last night and it totally kept me going thru out the whole film. Chad Michael Murray IS SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO HOTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTT and he's just a ace actor. Total hero man. The main girl who is the sister to nick (chad) is such a brilliant actress. Thumbs up. I think it's so different to films out their these days, most of them to go with psychopath's, possessions, ghosts but here you have a theme about wax!

(Synopsis) Graduating high school senior Bartleby "B" Gaines (Justin Long) finds himself without a college to attend. He has been able to talk and con his way out of every problem he encounters, but he hasn't been able to charm his way pass the college admissions board of eight colleges. His mom and dad are very disappointed that Bartleby hasn't been accepted into college. His parents think that if Bartleby doesn't go to college, he will have no future. Several of Bartleby's friends are in the same situation of being rejected by all the colleges they applied to.

WTF ! ! Do any of his books/movies end in a happy ending ? ? The Notebook was good ...but not really the film it should be. It didn't feel like a true love story. Maybe he's just trying to make up for lost time but that's ridiculous. Well, after watching this movie I was completely confused and felt as if I had gone through a nightmare. I don't think my brain knew what to do with such a large script. At times it looked like the actors were trying to work together, other times there seemed to be no direction or logic at all.

I viewed the original Outer Limits in real time, when first broadcast and have since viewed the entire original series again and again in re-runs and complete on DVD. I find the New Outer Limits WELL MORE than just a remake of old retread episodes, as some of the more adolescent commentators have suggested.With seven (7) years of programs versus just the two (2) years of the original series, the producers and writers have certainly added considerable new original stories and philosophical lines to a much longer running and very well produced (cable) TV series.

`` I am ... proud of 'Head ' , '' Mike Nesmith has said . He should be , because the film is absolutely stunning. The story follows a boy from New York City ( Michael Stuhlbarg ) who, after losing his virginity, falls in love with an African-American man ( Jeff Bridges ). It doesn't last long, though, when he finds out that he is going to marry and have a child with the "black woman" whose name is Diane (Catherine Keener). There are several other girls involved too - all of whom are portrayed by different people than Stuhlbarg does.

There 's no point in comparing this with the original series . Though different in look and content , both are very enjoyable to watch, and both share similar plot lines. I don't know what I expected from the film, although it was certainly an entertaining read. It is all about a man (Kurt Russell) who has to find his way into a world that can't be comprehended by men or women because he is unable to understand them. I didn't expect anything more for a book-length film adaptation of one of my favorite novels - perhaps even another John Cheever novel!

This film is an impressionistic , poetic take on the immigrant experience , a reflective look at the turmoil and hardships endured by thousands of immigrants coming into America during the Great Depression, as well as many other American tragedies. One thing that was not in my mind when I watched "Lincoln" is its depiction of the war between the Union and Confederacy . The reason why there's so much conflict in this movie (and others) is because both sides are just trying to do their damnest to achieve the goals they have set out to achieve.

Captain Corelli 's Mandolin is one of Nicolas Cage 's better films . He turns a fine performance as the villain into an overlong nightmare and the only reason why you care about this movie is because it has a bad ending.I watched this at home when it was in release, but decided to see it on DVD. I never did. It's just plain lousy. I wish they had just released the video instead. If this film could be rated PG-13, then I would have been satisfied. I didn't know this was supposed to be a comedy. I knew it wasn't.

There are a select few cartoon films where animals or something "not human" is portraying human beings and I think that this film is one of them. Apart from a few points of the plot and the characters - this film could be changed with all people rather than mainly animals. Although - it's good someone did not - I feel the cats are jolly good in this film portraying humans! :-)This film also focuses on quite a lot of adult issues - which is rather odd for a Disney film.

What can I say about the series dubbed the NEW OUTER LIMITS ... Hmm .... Only that this was one of those films that I did not actually like very much, but wanted to see again and again because it was something that I thought might be entertaining enough to warrant watching. The movie was quite bad. But what? I have never found a movie that made my eyes tear up more than this one! When I started watching this movie at the age of eight, I was struck by how much it had already changed the way I watched movies.

I just can't understand why people are surprised this movie makes no sense. It was never supposed to make sense. (Duh! The writers were completely wasted on Frodis at the time.) It was just supposed to entertain and mock, and it does both wonderfully.The Monkees are good actors. They wouldn't have been hired if they weren't good actors. Mike has a thing for deadpan and darkness, Micky is the best at sheer psychotic comedy, Davy is a Broadway veteran, and Peter actually had people believing he was that dumb in real life.

Wow , What a wonderful film-making ! Mr. Im has done it , again ! His last work , ChunHayang 2 , won the grand prize at the Asian Film Festival in Hong Kong but that's not the only reason to like his work. When I watched this film , I felt sorry for what had happened to all the beautiful and talented women in this movie. This was another example of how Hollywood tries so hard to make money by stripping them of everything . I've been watching movies since I was very small, and have loved them from start to finish.

Another great Tom Wilkinson performance punctuates `` Separate Lies , '' a 2005 film also starring Emily Watson , Linda Cardellini , and Chris Rock. I loved this film so much, I watched it again and again with my husband. I've enjoyed the movie since its original release in 2001 but I was never able to finish it as a child. It is about an orphanage where a young boy finds a lost book of stories and begins to read them. One night, at school, when he is supposed to get his homework done, he decides to spend the day reading instead.

This movie is true action at its finest , It does n't get any better then this . This is a movie which has been talked about so many times i think people may have forgotten its existence. I watched it to see if it was possible to make something like this but i never got to see it. I can only imagine how disappointed I was after watching the rest of the movie and not seeing the ending. I'm really glad that none of my friends could understand what was going on in this movie because I am quite certain they would have ruined their own evening.

OK , so this film may not have won any Oscars , but it is not a bad film .I actually like this movie and i will tell all my friends who don't, to go watch it on their own because they know how good it is! The plot was very interesting even if I didn't understand its main characters at the time.The dialogue was really funny too. This is probably my least favourite movie of all time (as far as i can remember) and one of the first ones that made me regret ever watching it.

Cult-director Lucio Fulci is probably most famous for his gory Zombie flicks from the 1980s that earned him his rightful place in horror legend. He has spent much of his career turning up at horror movies, mostly with little success. The movie starts out well enough and gives me hope for a good night's sleep if I'm watching it on DVD. It's not long into the movie before I start hearing noises around the hotel. The sounds seem to have more to do with guests talking and getting in each others' faces as they head towards the main street.

This is a good film , no doubt , but with some odd aspects . Without spoiling anything it takes you back to the 1980's when most of the movies were made without sound and there was not much else in the world at that time. I think "The Shining" holds its own pretty well in this regard. The only problem I had with it is that it was so bad, I felt sorry for the actors (who did great work). It was really disappointing to see such a terrible movie from this year's edition of Hollywood blockbusters.

In an early scene , Luca ( David Pasquesi ) and James ( Jeff Garlin ) are walking down a deserted road when they spot a van parked in front of them. "We're gonna kill this bastard!" shouts Luca, who has just learned from the police that there is actually a boy on the run. Luca orders James to start his car and tries to get out of the way. A policeman steps out of his patrol car and tells him to stop, but Luca keeps driving. As Luca continues to chase the boy, he comes upon a house.

I watch the show every day and it is very entertaining. It provides updates of tech news, video games pretty much everything geek. They are also the official broadcasters of E3 and Comiccon. If you are a geek, gamers or anything really, you will enjoy this show. They have definitely upped their game since the guy below me's review (2006). It's the only place that I get my tech info. Kevin Pereira and Olivia Munn work beautifully with each other and the show always has segments referring to things in the game, movie, comic... Universe.

WTF!! Do any of his books/movies end in a happy ending?? The Notebook was good...but sheesh, enough with the depressing endings already. I'm told that he writes about realistic situations that people deal with in real life. Understandable...but sometimes it's nice to see people who have sacrificed their whole lives to only get to a mediocre unhappy time in their lives - to finally find the true meaning of happiness and are able to live it out for the rest of their days. Don't we already know what really happens in real life?

Exclusively for Coop's lovers, though Clint Eastwood very strong though unobtrusive presence is a great asset of this very good documentary film. It is a biography of Gary Cooper, based mainly on his filmography, but also on more private archives, which show him as a child, as a young man, as a family man, with some of his friends (Picasso, Hemingway, etc. ), as an older man, finally as a sick and close-to-death man. After "the end", I did not have the feeling that I knew the man any much better.

If you expect that this movie is full of action and grabbing you from the start then do n't watch this one. The pacing was horrible and I never got what was happening in the movie. Not only was it boring but it also left a lot to be desired.There was a lot going on in this film, all without any plot or character development. As far as acting goes there wasn't a whole lot to work with. It's not like they have great acting talents but if you want to try to make a movie out of anything, don't waste your time doing it.

This is sweet . The actress who played the nurse with the gonzongas is the same actress who plays Elvira. I can only assume this film is supposed to be funny, or I wouldn't have bothered to watch it at all. This is an extremely poorly produced and made movie which lacks a single punch line whatsoever. I am not ashamed to say I watched the whole thing once. What a way to kill time on a Saturday night. There was so much crap going on in the beginning, you couldn't really see what was happening for more than 3 minutes!

I absolutely love this film and have seen it many times . I taped it in about 1987 when it first came out but couldn't find it at my local copy shop. I was a little disappointed when I found out that it had gone to the DVD rental store for re-mastered and now you can buy it on DVD! It is a really nice looking movie with some decent acting from several of the actors as well as some great music. First of all, I just wanted to say how much I loved this film.

I Loved this movie . Mark Blankfield was perfect for this role . More Classic sci/fie/Horror films should be remade like this. This is a film that will remain with you forever in your memory as one of my favorite movies. My son and I are looking forward to this remake. I remember seeing it back in '82 and loved it, then we saw the first trailer a few years ago and immediately thought there was no way this could be made! All the characters looked so similar; even the original director couldn't get away with any variation.

I've seen the 1973 movie Lost Horizons and read many of the reviews for this movie. I agree the move had many opportunities for improvement but unlike all those who are looking for the perfect movie with the perfect songs and the best acting, I was looking for something a bit different and this movie gave it to me. I watched this movie not as a critic but as a person looking for a little hope, a little cheer, a bit of a release from my everyday life, and this is what I got.

We saw La Spettatrice last night @ the Chicago International Film Festival & we were both immensely moved by it. This is a haunting tale of loneliness & missed connection in which the longing for intimacy conflicts with our fear of revealing too much about ourselves to another. The three leads (Barbora Bobulova as Valeria, Brigitte Catillon as Flavia, Andrea Renzi as Massimo) are all excellent and the dynamic between them is very surprising. After all the movies which devalue older women, it's wonderful to see Flavia (who is a law professor at a university in Rome) presented as beautiful & sensual as well as seductive & powerful.

Oh I remember watching this show at 4:00 p.m. during my junior high days. It was not a pleasant experience because I remember watching it when I made my homework.Still, the show caught my attention when Alex displayed her special powers and dealt with the typical junior high problems.But the show wasn't all about adventures and special powers; it was more of an educational effort for a younger audience in order to get more interested in school and biology overall.The lead actress (can't remember her name and I'm too lazy to copy and paste from the main details) delivered a fantastic performance.

I Loved this movie. Mark Blankfield was perfect for this role. More Classic sci/fie/Horror films should be remade to this comedy level, which is at the very top of the line in my opinion. A no drink movie, you laugh so hard you will spill it all over yourself. Can We expect more? Let's hope so. I would like to suggest many movies for this type of remake. Mel Brookes made some remakes of classic films.He made some very strong contributions. A Picture of Dorian Gray would be a good suggestion.

Sit back and let Director Bharatbala lead us into a visual and sensual voyage of the mind and spirit of this unique movie. If you want to see a good horror story then this is it - a classic tale from the 1920s. A serial killer kills five people in a house with one dead child sitting at the end. This is what we all want to see on a Saturday afternoon, so why do we not see him or her live on camera?The only way to tell this tale is to go to the cinema with your family and friends.

A film about the relationship between a man and leopard that's very reminiscent of "The English Patient," even down to a scene similar to when Ralph Fiennes' character carries the body of his lover across a desert-rock cliff. In "A Passion in the Desert," the main character carries the body of the leopard across a desert-rock cliff but in the opposite direction (calculated decision or unconscious contrast?). Historically expanded from a very short Balzac story, the film is not perfect but a treat no less. Final shot will haunt me for weeks.

Always enjoyed `` DOA '' ,1950 , which starred Edmond O'Brien and was very curious about this film . Dennis Hopper is the lead character here. He has to learn how to play the guitar, that is when he makes his first mistake. Unfortunately, there are a lot of unnecessary lines in this film. I think this movie is an improvement over the preceding one. It may have actually been better than it appeared to be, but I found it lacking in many aspects. It doesn't even bother me anymore why I'm writing so much crap about this terrible piece of garbage.

The animation quality here is decidedly below par IMO , regardless of the age of the OAV . The plot itself has some decent action sequences at times, but overall, it just feels like a glorified soap opera. It's nothing compared to the show you would expect from this one. I've seen plenty of anime on TV and so far I haven't had much trouble trying to find anything interesting (not that they really do come up). In this case, the thing about "Bishoujo" was that it got quite a bit of attention, which can't be good for your eyes.

I've got to say it. Gary Busey saved this film. If it were not for his fine acting talents this film would have been sub par. I recommend the film but just barely.The biggest difficulty with the film is its broad disregard for historical, geographical and physical accuracy. For example, why is Lubbock green and hilly? How come Buddy's producer Petty ignored? Where are the daily trips to the Clovis, New Mexico studio? Why is Nashville treated as a racist hate camp out to destroy the Holly sound?

I am a long time fan of Luc Besson's work, and for about as long as I've known his name, I've also looked for this movie. I tried looking for this movie all over California for over four years. this past summer i took a trip to Europe, one of my missions on this trip was to at least see this movie. long story short, I bought it and watched it in France! I was blown away, it completely made my trip and i finally feel content that i have seen Luc Besson's first work.

Valeria , an elegant and pretty young lady lives in a world surrounded by the walls of her shyness and self-deprecation. One day she meets this cute boy, who happens to have the same name as her cousin. Their relationship is complicated and they soon find themselves in love. I loved this movie. In fact, it was probably the most entertaining film I have seen in years. The only issue I had was with the acting. It seems like one of the actors was supposed to act for two hours. He started acting at 2:25, so he should have shown up around 2:30 - 3:00.

Great show! About time a reality TV show comes along that closes generation gaps. Contestants range in ages, some seem old enough to have watched the movie when it first came out. And others, looked so young that perhaps parents or teachers handed down the movie hoping it would touch their lives the way it once touch them. Grease has truly become an American icon. Grease is a fun and entertaining movie in which the young and old can relate to. "You're The One That We Want" is sure to gain even more Grease followers.

I always liked listening to Buddy Holly and felt a real loss when he was killed at a young age. And I don't know if this guy is a good friend or not, but I do remember the time my mother went up to talk to him about an event that they were both having. My brother has recently died. He had been very ill for a number of years and it took a long time before he seemed to get any better. We were able to tell that something was amiss with his life because one of his sisters came back to visit me on Christmas Eve.

This movie gives us some WWII history along with some touching romance , a little fantasy and meaningful emotion - the acting is top notch, the directing is top notch, the effects are top notch and so are the costumes. A very interesting movie, I can see why people are drawn to it because of the wonderful story line but if you are just going to sit there and enjoy the action scenes then go watch something else. I've heard this movie all my life...but never had the opportunity to see it.

I love the TV contest. Hate to see it end. There are so many talented contestants. It's a shame that only 2 will be picked. I love watching the judges also. At times they are as entertaining as the contestants. I have been watching the show faithfully every Sunday night. Wouldn't miss it for the world. It's the best reality show that's ever been on television. Good luck to all the contestants, though I have already chosen the two who I would like to see play Danny and Sandy on Broadway.

I'm not going to go into too much depth, but Showtime was a pretty funny movie. There wasn't any slapping-your-knee funny scenes (that I can remember), but it had it's moments. The cast is pretty good, Robert De Niro is good as usual and Eddie Murphy pulls off a pretty funny performance. Rene Russo was just fine in the film, no complaints there. There were two characters in the story that I liked that they didn't explain much at all. The first one was Trey Sellars' (Eddie Murphy's) buddy at the gym played by Ken Campbell.

This early film from future goremeister Lucio Fulci is a very good addition to the giallo sub-genre. Set in rural Italy, there is a serial killer of children at large. Add to the mix an array of characters familiar to fans of giallo cinema  a madwoman, a newspaper reporter, ineffectual police, a sexy siren, a priest, a mute girl, a mentally-retarded loner etc. This is one of the best Italian thrillers of the early 70's.Unusually for a giallo, the victims in this case are young boys, which makes a change from the more typical women in peril angle.

Ross Hunter 's musical remake of the 1937 fantasy , based on James Hilton 's enduring bestseller , was written and directed by Mark Rylance. The film premiered at the Venice Film Festival as a special screening event for the Cannes Film festival in 2007. After winning an award for Best Original Screenplay for The Dark Tower, Stephen King began work on his second film, A Very Harold & Kumar Movie . While this movie had a more focused plot (with much less "plot holes"), it ended up lacking any memorable characters that would carry it forward into the next installment of the franchise.

This Oscar-winning short film (40 minutes), based on a short story by William Faulkner, takes us back to small-town Tennessee in December 1941. Two brothers, one about 18 and one about 8 are looking for birds eggs (obviously a huge collectors item for boys in the South around this time). Well, the Japanese bomb Pearl Harbor and the older brother, Pete, decides to enlist. He gives his prize egg to his little brother, Willie and heads off wishing to show more emotion and tenderness to his little acolyte.

I do n't care what some of the reviews said , this movie was funny . The thing with this movie and most movies is you have to watch it a certain number of times to really get the joke, but once you do see it that's when it's not so funny. This movie made me sick for a couple of reasons. It had so many cliches. First off, as a teenager I am not particularly well versed in comics or horror stories, so I didn't even realize they were called "horror flicks".

Do you liked `` Dead Man do n't wear Plaid '' ? What about `` Top Secret '' and `` My Favorite Martian \" ?'' - they are all great but I'm just not sure if I can relate them to this movie. I think that it's the director who is trying to be clever by making fun of someone else's experience. The reason why some people like ``Dead Man Do N't Wear Plaid'' is because there seems to be a certain amount of wackiness in the script. The whole point of a spy film is to scare people, particularly the audience.

Whoever plays the part of J. Douglas Williamson in the strip poker scene does a wonderful job . He apparently doesn't know what he is doing, but when it all comes crashing down he manages to pull it all together and make a pretty decent movie as well. The one thing that stuck out though was the character's acting. He seems very uninspired, not at all believable and not at all motivated.
