I thought they were going to give it a real story line, but this was about as bad as it got....and it was just for the first two nights.I don't want to comment too much on any of the characters' personalities, since I can see where people are getting annoyed by them.

Charles Chaplin 's 'Shoulder Arms ' of 1918 was his longest film to date , though , at just over two hours, it might have been longer. At this point you would probably start wondering if it could ever be completed again. But that's not quite the case. I actually watched this early on and couldn't believe how good it ended up getting. It wasn't bad, but I'm sure most people who watched it had an issue with it. Here is my list of the flaws:1. It was filmed by a bunch of teenagers, in a school setting.

I was 19 or 20, years old at the time and living in Salt Lake City, Utah and I still remember the new dome theater, called the century 21. Layback chairs that rocked and a new sound system, large screen and huge open space between the screen and the packed theater. We felt all the excitement of a new preview screening of a film. Ta da da daa da ta da dada dada... I can still hear the opening music ringing trumpet and the crash of cymbals. I loved the interplay of characters and the filmed vistas.

The young John Garfield turned in a fine performance in the 1939 "They Made Me a Criminal." Celebrating a ring victory in a jammed locker room, boxer Johnnie Bradfield emotes about his love of mom, rejection of booze and clean living style to fans, including cops, who eat it up. Later in the evening he's plowed and tussling with his bimbo gal while his manager, in on the con, shares the evening. And the whiskey.A problem develops when another couple arrives. The guy is a newspaper reporter and he says he'll expose Bradfield's phony life on the front page.

This series has a lot going for it with beautiful footage of the some of the most impressive underwater environments in the world. But there really wasn't much to like about this one! It had no story or characters and just plain, dull dialogue that was made more confusing by its slow-fire pace. And then there is this... I liked this show. I am an old guy who loves sci-fi/fantasy films. I do not want to spoil what you would get out of these shows but I think we will be treated to a great movie when this one is released.

TV churns out dozens of true-crime movies every year. You can see 3 or 4 every Saturday on Lifetime, and Court TV can be relied on for a few every weekend. So I started watching The Morrison Murders thinking I knew very well what to expect: a more or less competent retelling of a real-life family murder. What I got was a subtle, beautifully acted drama that engrossed me from start to finish.Both the brothers were totally convincing, and Jonathan Scarfe was perfect in the challenging role of Luke. The look and feel of Georgia was in almost every frame.

This film was made right in the area where I grew up and now live . I know personally most of you probably think it's boring and not very funny but for me it was one of those movies I never forget. After finishing the film, I just couldn't get it out of my mind as it had such a powerful effect on my childhood. I don't remember exactly when I saw the movie but I remember going to bed at 5am thinking this was some kind of amazing piece of filmmaking. It still amazes me how much has changed in so little time.

This movie is truly a classic 80s movie ! A must have in any '80s ' movie collection ! Gunslinger's Walk is an interesting and quirky, but still entertaining, comedy . The premise is that a group of mercenaries are hired on a secret mission to kill President Jimmy Carter. But when one of the mercenaries dies, his body gets taken to a secret location without him realizing he is being watched by the military. First off, I'm so sorry that you're suffering from this horrible mental illness. If you can, please see a doctor.

In the first transformation scene , what is the music ? I 've heard it was `` The Greeks Do It Better ". What's this about ? You can see them singing at the end. This seems to have happened somewhere in India where they were living and there wasn't a lot of classical music. This film isn't as bad as the rest but if you like old-fashioned comedies (like Sleepless in Seattle) you will love it. There is no humor in the story, which is very reminiscent of a movie like "Good Morning America".The characters are very generic and boring.

1969 was the year. New York City was the place. Putney Swoope was the second Robert Downey film to achieve some recognition. The first was Chaffed Elbows (1966). Putney Swoope achieved a much wider release. Pound (1970) and Greasers Palace (1972) were even more profane and obnoxious. Those 2 films were mean spirited to the point that they actually stalled the Prince's feature film career for several years.The subject at hand is Putney Swoope. And it is a mad farce/satire that has to be seen to be believed. I'm not going to go through the plot here.

Lucio Fulci's "Don't Torture a Duckling" paints an exceptionally unflattering portrait of small-town Sicily plagued by series of brutal murders of young boys.This surprisingly well-directed film(especially in comparison to later Fulci's gorefests)is distinguished by overall atmosphere of perversity,nastiness and two truly grotesque scenes of brutal violence.The soon-to-be-dead children are depicted as casually cruel and budding peeping toms;Bruno's near-seduction by the naked Patrizia(Barbara Bouchet)really has to be seen to be believed.Highly recommended-especially in pair with my another cult favourite "House with the Windows That Laugh"(1976).

The movie starts with a board meeting at a major advertising agency. Putney Swope is on the board for no other reason than the fact that he is black, and the agency needs a "token" on the board. Swope is ignoring the meeting, reading Jet magazine at the big table, and everybody is ignoring Swope... Suddenly, the CEO croaks on the spot. No time is wasted. A janitor is called to haul off the corpse, and the board immediately and unceremoniously tackles the business of electing a new CEO.

Before I talk about the ending of this film I will talk about the plot . Some dude named Gerald McBride, in a fit of anger decides that he would rather go to jail than make a movie. It is then up to his lawyer to convince him not to run. A little over a month ago, I saw the first trailer for  The Muppets 2 , a sequel to the cult classic Muppet Babies which was released nearly two years ago today. Despite having seen the first installment (which came out in 2009), I had never heard of this new film until it was recently released.

I do n't see what the problem is with SOME people and their NEED for intellectual humor . You need something to fill those holes, and this movie was NOT THAT. It is not a comedy, because it does NOT have a laugh line (although there is one in the background). It's always good to be reminded that you can't take your own words literally, as they will come back to haunt you. This movie has no plot whatsoever. They just keep repeating things over and over again until you are sure they don't have any idea where they are going with the story.

I was about 14 years old as I saw the musical version of Lost Horizon . I loved the film and thought it was a really fun idea to try to bring some of the music back to cinema. The movie was supposed to be made in 1974 but didn't get made. Instead, it became one of my favourites. It wasn't terrible, but it wasn't very good either. The story is basically that of a man and his son who happen to cross paths at the same time on an adventure.

Fantastic Chaplin movie with many memorable moments as Charlie joins the army to fight in WW 1.At first he goes to boot camp, where he has to learn how to handle his rifle and how to walk in line. That's a really funny scene as the tramp is not used to keeping his feet straight!Next thing you know he's in France in a trench. Hilarious scenes here include a starving Charlie eating the cheese of a mousetrap and reading a letter from home over someone's shoulder.When Charlie goes to sleep he finds his bunker all flooded and his roommate snoring.

The young John Garfield turned in a fine performance in the 1939 `` They Made Me a Criminal . '' That's it. There is not a word of plot or characterization, not a clue that any of this would even make it to film. You'll never see it on Broadway. The story is as old as the stage itself. If you have read and liked my reviews for some time now then I can't blame you for wanting to purchase this collection. This book has all the characteristics of such a masterpiece.

It was Libby talking to Desmond in the flashback, and if anyone is confused about her past (like how did she end up in the same hospital Hurley was in) then you should know that despited Libby dying in season 2, the character will be explored more in season 3 and we will get answers to questions surrounding her.BTW, great episode. It had a really great cliffhanger and some interesting questions...like what happened to Eko and Lock and what about the four toe statue?I cannot wait till season 3, Lost just rules!!!

Without going into any details of a good...if a somewhat provocative...TV movie, there seems to be a consensus among the users that there is "no one to blame here".I disagree. Yes, the young male lover of Beverly D'Angelo, played by Rob Estes may be young and horny (and good looking) because he's not getting as much as he wants from mom, that doesn't mean, he can climb in bed and have sex with daughter. OK, he can use the excuse he just wanted to watch TV with her, but I don't buy it.

OK, so I loved Rachael Ray before, but now, I ADORE her! How innovative. I love that she has a cooking section- I admit that occasionally I skip that part, only because it makes me WAAAY too hungry! But I also love that you can get the next day's grocery list on her website. I love that she has regular helpers and that she's made some of her viewers become her regulars. I love how personable she is and how creative she is. I also like how she does her Mystery Guests.

Certainly one of the most hilarious films of all time. Excellent original music, clever, heady...it's hard to be articulate about something this good. There isn't one character that you don't instantly love to watch- Myronex "Putney, there's trouble in the black room!" "My name is Rufus." The lines, thrown away left and right, are classics themselves, recalling Slapshot, Caddyshack, Anchorman, Repoman, Dolemite, any comedy whose dialog is not of the formulaic set-up punchline variety. "Putney, Myronex called you tasteless!"

I think I was recommended this film by the lady in the shop I was hiring it from! For once she was bang on! What a superb film! First of all I was convinced James McAvoy & Romola Garai were Irish so convincing were their accents; and by half way through the film I was utterly convinced Steven Robertson was a disabled actor and pretty sure James McAvoy was also! When I watched the special features on the DVD and saw both actors in their 'normal' guise, to say I was blown away would be an understatement!!!

Just exactly HOW director John Madden come to settle with Nicolas Cage and Penelope Cruz playing the roles of an Italian Officer and a Greek Villager in an honourable story: "Captain Correli´s Mandolin", just escapes me! Witness: a wobbly, inconsistent accent by Cage amid horrendous over-acting, with Cruz -- more adequately cast as a spoiled Latino opposite Johnny Depp in "Blow" -- in basically a repeat performance under the guise of a Greek nurse... ay, it was painful. But there were saving graces.The story itself is thrilling-to-tragic, and Cage does have some (-- redeeming, this is !--) musical ability.

Based on a William Faulkner short story , Two Soldiers is a top notch short film , a movie that should not be made.The plot consists of a pair of men and a woman who, upon learning the truth about their former life as warriors, have been separated and are living in relative isolation. It is a pity that two such great films were cut down in the course of ten years, but I am not an expert on these types of things, so I felt that I should write to one of the producers.First of all you must know that I don't give a damn about movies.

I've been watching Attack Of The Show religiously for about 6 months (maybe longer but not much). I was very infatuated with Olivia and I found Kevin to be very witty and the repertoire between them very good. Lately though it's starting to wear thin due to many factors for me. First my favorite segment is the first 15 minutes called Around The Net, that shows 5 video clips that you would find on a site like Youtube, that are generally funny, or of people getting hurt inadvertently (some intentionally).

Just as in "Columbo" we see the fatality occur right at the beginning. What follows is an escalating web of lies, sex, blackmail, and murder. The investigating officer, Adam Arkin, is even somewhat of a fumbler, not unlike "Columbo". It is William H. Macy, as the movie critic suspect who carries the film. Constantly twisting and turning, the plot sends Macy deeper and deeper into the quicksand of his "perfect crime". William H. Macy fans will enjoy "A Slight Case Of Murder", as will those who like crime capers with all kinds of delicious possibilities.

Accepted is a 2006 teen flick that stars the guy from the mac and PC ads . The movie is an incredibly boring parody of teen movies and shows, with many cringe worthy scenes. The only redeeming qualities about it are the excellent acting (I'm not kidding), the good soundtrack, and the "good kid" jokes at the beginning. There aren't any characters or plot twists to be found in this film whatsoever, so if there's one redeeming feature that I can find it's the story. I would just like to thank the reviewers for being fair.

I 'm not sure why this film is averaging so low on IMDb when it 's absolutely everything you could want in a horror film, but that 's how its going to go. You will never be disappointed with this film and I highly suggest you buy it. It doesn't matter if you're a newbie or someone who's had a hard time getting into movies for more than 20 years, there is something great about watching an old horror flick. There are several reasons why this movie might be one of the worst I have ever seen in my life.

The last film by underrated director Alberto De Martino ("The Antichrist", "The Killer is on the Phone") is a truly suspenseful but incomprehensibly neglected giallo, containing pretty much all the trademarks that makes this Italian horror sub genre so magnificent and addictive to the fans. There are some very disturbing themes (child abuse, phony priests), loads of creepy moments, plot twists left & right, outstanding music and  last but not least  a handful of really sadistic murder scenes! Especially the opening sequence, which is some kind of prologue, is a powerful piece of horror!

This movie felt so real. I actually felt all of the emotions portrayed here during my life at various times - that of both Rory and Michael. I have Duchene's Muscular Dystrophy like Rory so what you see here is exactly what I've actually felt myself. Some won't believe there ARE disabled people like Rory, full of anger and rebellion. I know they exist because I'm one of them.The story is great. For a drama, character-driven movie, the story moves fast. I was never bored, maybe partly because I was seeing stuff that is close to my heart.

A beautifully photographed and paced short film. It evocatively captures the feeling of this family and much of the country during the period just prior to and after Pearl Harbor.I appreciated the visual look of the film -- naturalistic and simultaneously poetic. Great work by a great D.P., David Boyd.Though a family film, the story never becomes maudlin or saccharin. We understand and believe the motivation that propels the young boy on his odyssey. I understand the love of the younger brother for his older brother and do not question why he sets out to do what he does.

These days , you rarely come by a kid 's show that does not involve 1 ) a preteen/teen pop star and 2 ) one of her co-stars getting hit by a car while being drunk. I had no idea this show was coming out! Well, I have now been watching it for several months and I finally watched it. I like to compare myself with other people from the same geographical area in order to help me figure out what makes someone tick (I am always looking for interesting people to compare myself to, and this is an example of that).

SHOWTIME is a mess , but it 's an entertaining mess . The plot is forgettable , the satire is silly and over the top (I say that with no malice) , the action scenes are too slow paced (which I don't understand). If you like comedy from the 1970s and 80s, you will definitely want to look out for this gem. This movie was produced by a guy who went by the name of John Belushi in the mid 90s and has directed some pretty funny films since then including "Rocky IV" and "A Clockwork Orange".

First of all i want to say Ang Lee Did a very good job on this one ! I watched this film over and over again , when i went to the theaters i couldn't take myself out of it , its one of those movies where the audience is expecting a lot from you, and they are not. I have heard of this film but never had the opportunity to see it. This was my 3rd movie with Ang Lee so far and i wanted to see what he was able to pull off.

No real plot, no character development, no Scorcese-level direction, but seriously, were you really expecting any of this? The only thing that matters is that this flick is absolutely hilarious, nearly on the same level as Borat. Sure, the ending drags a bit, but if Borat's cameo didn't crack you up, you must be the worst batty boy in the history of batty boys. Sacha Baron Cohen is possibly the greatest comedian ALIVE, and here he gets more laughs than Jude Law on a nude beach.

Final Solution is a powerful christian film that shows the hate between the black and whites that was present in America in the first half of the 1800s. The movie has a huge impact on me, not because of the movie itself but because of my hatred for it.I can't say that I have never been into a movie about a black man committing an atrocity in the name of God (that is, if it had anything to do with religion). However, this one doesn't fit the mold any better than others I have encountered.

* * 1/2 Elisha Cuthbert , Chad Michael Murray , Brian Van Holt , Paris Hilton and Jon Abrahams . This is definitely the most awful, repulsive piece of trash that I've come across in the last year or so. The actors do a poor job of making any sense whatsoever as they sit in their little white vans talking to each other who are all completely unimportant and unmemorable. Not to mention the plot of the whole movie is ridiculous and contrived. Why did you make a movie where a woman can't have sex when her husband insists on having sex!

Hey all you jive hustlers, you stone foxes, you mean dudes. Watch out cause Slaughter is back in town! If you are looking for a bad-ass, funky film to watch some night, this is just right. 'Slaughter' is back and trying to take it easy n' relax after his adventures down in Mexico. But if you are a narrow-minded gangster like 'Duncan', you are bound to seek revenge. Why, I don't know. Was 'Hoffo' in the first one his brother or what? Any who.

At one time ` Buddy Cop ' movies ruled the box office . It seemed that every summer flocks of fans were waiting outside movie theatres to find out their favourite movie was making its film debut. As far as I know, they have no idea how many people saw them. The only clue I can give is it's not there on DVD yet and I haven't found any other information online about it so far...it could well be a hit or miss kind of film at best. When you watch it like this you are probably going to want to throw money in the toilet.

Film auteur Stephan Woloszczuk explores the depths of love, passion, and brotherhood and the devastating results of loss in his latest film BLINDSPOT.BLINDSPOT'S diegetic world is exploding with suspense and takes the audience on a twisting  journey to the core of the human soul. As a director, he manages to draw the human spirit from the performances of his actors. With superb editing, especially in the flashback scenes and beautiful cinematography, BLINDSPOT is a thought provoking suspense from beginning to end. A thriller which leaves much to the minds' eye.What an  astounding accomplishment for Stephan Woloszczuk. Cheers Stephan!

Cult-director Lucio Fulci is probably most famous for his gory Zombie flicks from the 1980s that earned him his rightful reputation as the "Godfather Of Gore". Fulci's absolute greatest film, however, dates back to 1972 and, while it is definitely gritty and violent, it is not nearly as gory as many of his other films. "Non Si Sevizia Un Paperino" aka. "Don't Torture A Duckling" of 1972 is not only by far Fulci's greatest film, this tantalizing and utterly brilliant Giallo is one of the absolute highlights of the genre.

This is possibly one of my favorite films. It tells the tale of a girl named Gerda (Chelsea Hobbs) who lost her mother at a very young age, so has been bought up by her father. She falls in love with the bell boy named Kai. However, on her birthday the snow queen (Bridget Fonda) comes the the hotel which her father owns and kidnaps Kai. Gurda then goes after Kai, and follows him through the four seasons in an attempt to rescue him.I thought that this was an excellent adaption of the story with great performances from all the cast.

Documentaries in which sons and daughters seek to understand a parent and , by the process , their own lives. This documentary takes a look at what it may be like to raise your own children as an alcoholic . It follows two siblings who were raised by a father whose family was of European descent. In his spare time, they played with toys on the playground, laughed together, and enjoyed life. One son was a successful business owner, while another worked in a law firm. The eldest son is now out of work and desperately trying to save money to re-entrant the workforce.

This is probably my favourite TV show ever. I love all the characters, especially Alex, who is the PERFECT woman! Always makes me laugh and feel good when I watch this show. There is just something about it that is amazing, hard to describe.It seems some or all of the episodes synchronise with music albums as well. Here are a few examples. (The episodes start again when they end - but DON'T play end credits until the very end, but always play the opening credits. With most the episodes the album plays once and the episodes play twice, but some go on further.

Pity the Monkees. People always accused them of being manufactured (which they were) or being nothing more than a American knock-off of the Beatles (Again, which they were) but to the kids of the time they were real, they were important, they were legitimate. Discussions about who were better The Monkees or The Beatles were common on school yards but the critics, well they never quite bought into it. Despite recording some very catchy, classic pop tunes, the Monkess did not receive much respect for their albums.

When "Madame" decides to let her cats inherit her it spells trouble. The snobbish Butler Edgar who is next in line to inherit decides to get rid of the cats. Thereby the story can begin and the cats can go on an adventure that would otherwise have been impossible. An adventure that lets them meet the charming, but not altogether trustworthy cat O'Malley. He helps them through many dangerous and funny situations until the inevitable happy end.The force of this movie is in its humor and music. Edgar is simply hilarious as the insulted butler who is out to settle the score and of course he himself takes some serious beatings.

This interesting film noir features three very good performances: Sanders, Patrick, and Blackmer. The scenes between Sanders and Patrick are particularly outstanding. Demming, as the detective, is unfortunately not nearly as good. He lacks the intelligence, strength, and cynical world view of a Bogart. Had Humphrey played this part, we could have had a classic.Pace, location (a library), and atmosphere are all good. But there are a few plot holes. Sanders strongly fears Blackmer and the ruthless organization (Nazis) he represents. Yet after mistakenly killing Blackmer, Sanders seems to experience no anxiety or remorse.

Pity the Monkees . People always accused them of being manufactured ( which they were ) or being nothing more than a rip off of Hollywood. I mean...what's not to love?Well, at least this is a story that actually happens! And in case you don't want to waste your money on watching a movie with just one good thing, here's a great list of what NOT to watch.If you're going to buy anything, it needs to be from a source other than someone who doesn't deserve your money.

I had the chance to watch Blind Spot in Barcelona and I enjoyed it tremendously. I thought it to be one of the most captivating movies that I'd seen for a long time. One of the best points of the film was to meet new fresh faces and great actors behind them in unexpectedly and brilliantly filmed great locations. The three heroes share a chemistry on screen that runs all across the film making it so thrilling. They are set on outstanding landscapes spotted by such an original eye (the DOP's work is just great) that makes you feel like you are discovering them for the first time.

Was very fortunate to see the movie Hari Om at The Bermuda International Film Festival . It was the opening day and I couldn't wait for it to start. There were a number of interesting features in it that would have made up a better film, but if you look at the summary it's hard to tell where the film started and ended.I really wanted to like it. I'd read a lot of negative comments about it and was hoping someone would pick it up and make it more entertaining. Instead, I waited for it to show up on DVD so I could watch it once again.

I think that this short TV series , was absolutely wonderful , and gave both a in-depth and clear explanation of what happened. In fact, the ending of the series is very interesting , so it is worth viewing. While I loved the original Star Trek I have since grown up with much more modern sci-fi television (especially those from Fox) and as a result I've watched most of them. I am quite happy to say that this is my first "adult" Sci-Fi show on the net and certainly not my first time watching something like this.

I ca n't get this flick off my brain . It 's definitely totally different than anything that 's out there. This was a really disappointing film I had hoped for to be a bit of an oddity and maybe a "good" indie film but instead it became something much more. The movie doesn't know where to begin. First off the story is absolutely rubbish, the only real reason they even bothered going to such lengths as making this film was because it came out about a month after the release of their debut film.

Death Wish 3 is exactly what a bad movie should be . Terrible acting ! Implausible scenerios ! Ridiculous death plots ! Bizarre twists ! Lazy writing ! Bad script ! Worst director of the century ! There are far better movies to watch, but you won't hear about any of them because there are no good ones ! You can see this from the opening. One of the guys tells the others that his wife is pregnant in the next month. He says it's not due yet and then he falls asleep. The first thing I saw was this movie on DVD.

This movie is beautiful in all ways . It is visually stunning , and this is a good thing since it seems to not have that much impact. The ending is really cool and I hope it will end on a happy note for everyone involved. I always find myself getting annoyed with the acting in these kind of movies. I feel like most of these people aren't going to be too bad, but they just don't have what it takes to make a decent lead role in one of these movies. Not only that, but they don't know how to actually act.

Blind Spot 's images are great . The action draws you in completely , even though the movie is a total waste of life. I've been to several places, and one of the reasons that I liked it so much (as well as most other movies), was that it made me feel like I was really there...and for a brief period at least! This movie didn't get anywhere near that.The characters are generic and uninspired, and the story is just another plot device to pad out some more material for the inevitable sequel, which will be called Blind Spot II.

I love the TV contest . Hate to see it end . There are so many talented contestants . It's not surprising that one of the three finalists won. The best part is, there was never a chance this movie would have any merit whatsoever. The director and writers just couldn't pull off anything that looked even remotely like what they were writing. I really had to sit through a lot of wasted screen time just because I needed to laugh. The fact that the actors didn't even get a chance to make a single laugh makes me feel bad for Hollywood.

Ali G earned his fame on the small screen - though the big screen has not lost him any kudos. I'm actually not sure I ever really felt a need for that kind of movie, but this film is just plain weird! It doesn't really seem to have much plot, and as soon as it does, you're left guessing what is going to happen next, because you know something awful will happen in the future, so you just keep thinking about what could have been. I mean, seriously, don't be silly with me, this movie is NOT THAT bad after all!

This is one of my favorite films , ever . The story is just so fantastic and the characters are all so well drawn. I can't wait to see this next installment. But I will warn you before I watch it : "It's about time to get out!" A good movie, a good story, an enjoyable ride. This movie is no different. It doesn't have anything special on the inside, but at least it looks decent.I would give it four stars except for one little thing.

Yes, at times "Unconditional Love" overwhelms as it bounces -- no, as it ricochets -- from one story element to another in the most unconventional use of thematic elements and characters. In fact, it wasn't until I watched the film for the second time that I began to understand what I think P.J. Hogan might have been attempting to do with this quirky, unconventional flick. Perhaps the entire film itself is a metaphor for the unconditional love for which Grace (Kathy Bates) yearns and describes in the later part of the film.

I would say 'Bride of Chucky ' is a `` return to greatness '' but the series was never really that good anyway. I can't understand why it was so hard to get a movie made in the '70's when you could go to a big box office and make a decent movie with very little money. It's hard to explain how difficult it was to do this movie from beginning to end without sounding like a school teacher saying: ``If only my kids could do this kind of thing for me, I would give them all the credit they deserve''.

Just as in `` Columbo '' we see the fatality occur right at the beginning . What follows is an example of what would become a common practice in many movies. For this one, I decided to follow the lead of those who say you can tell a film's true nature if you take away the ending. Here's the summary: A teenage boy and his girlfriend fall asleep during a school dance; they are awakened by their teacher who finds them drowsy and disoriented. He decides to wake them up and bring them back home, but she is too frightened to do so.

It 's Showtime ! Showtime is simply a bump in Eddie Murphy and Robert DeNiro 's careers . It 's a good movie. I just watched it for the first time tonight on television and thought it was quite decent. This film does have its merits but, to be honest, even if you've seen all of the original films, there's not much new to get through here. If you're a Murphy fan, this isn't worth the watch.If you' ll need a bit of context about the plot, "Murphy", played by the excellent Richard Belzer , is a sleazy New York taxi driver.

Garlin outdoes himself as writer-director-actor in his indie production about a big guy (Garlin) wandering around Chicago with an eye for every woman he sees. The laughs keep coming almost every minute. It's a somewhat dramatic and serious story about a man looking for love, but done with great comedic writing and acting. The supporting roles are also very well done and very funny and really make the movie rich.Rose Abdoo is hysterical in her receptionist role taking you right into the mood of the rest of the film. Sara Silverman is awesome with some of the great bits she does with Jeff.

Due to its predictable , second-rate title , ( the one it was distributed under in Italy , at least ) it's no surprise that few people saw this as an action movie. I don't usually judge movies for what they are, I usually see if they are entertaining, if not, why they are doing so poorly. That is not always the case in this movie. The acting in the film is bad, too many of the characters sound like they just left a bar and went home. The music is annoying, especially when there are only three or four songs in the movie.

Telling the story would n't be the point at all , would it ? Barnens ö , spelled almost like a pig. This movie made me want to break down a door and run through it . I mean, really . I feel like I need to throw away this DVD as soon as possible. If only someone was able to make something that looked like this. The main reason I started watching this film was so that I could see who "I" am. It's not difficult to guess the role I'm playing, but I think I got it pretty easily enough.

I first saw `` Signs of Life '' on PBS as an American Playhouse presentation . It 's a wonderfully original, beautifully shot play in which the viewer must choose between finding clues that will lead them to answers, and finding evidence that will bring about their salvation. It is perhaps one of the top 10 best plays ever made; not least because its message was so simple and well received by the public! It is hard to imagine that anyone could find fault with this remarkable play. The story is very moving, and the acting is superb.

Coming from the `` druggie '' generation , I thought this movie was hilarious . It definitely brought Jekyll & Hyde to its knees in my opinion ! The script was by William Goldman and I don't think he even read the book . But they did a good job of setting things up for it . This is not the most interesting movie ever made, but if you've never seen it, you may want to have a look. The first thing I noticed before watching this film was it looked like a bad rip-off of Tootsie.

I think it definitely is. The writing is of such a quality that beginner students of the English language should model their conversations after its dialogue. For example, the exchange between Paul Kersey(Bronson) and Ms. Kathryn Davis(Deborah Raffin) (more about this character later) is extremely clear and to the point: Ms. Davis says, "I hope you like chicken. It's the only thing I know how to make," to which Kersey deftly responds, "Chicken's good. I like chicken."

What an excellent movie , made even more so by the fact that my wife and I stumbled onto it at the end of the day, while waiting for our children to go to bed. I thought this was really funny and entertaining but it kind of fell flat with me. If the script didn't have that same tone of humor then there would have been nothing to it. The plot doesn't really make sense when you think about it. Not only are they making a good movie out of what seems like a cheap rip-off, but they also ripped off several other classic movies.

Jack , Sawyer and Sayid swim to the boat and find a completely wasted Desmond . His traumatic past experience as a child is rekindled as he goes on a date to Juliet's home. As the sun sets outside the house, Sayid tries to comfort him in the darkness of night. Suddenly, two strangers enter the house and disappear into a large hole. This episode was pretty terrible. I really didn't watch this one because I don't really understand why people would watch this kind of garbage. It looks like it may be the worst hour of my life.

As the mom of a 3 year old and a 2 year old, I adore AristoCats. It is a movie that contains no double-entendres, no almost-swear words like heck or darn, no parents who are functional idiots, and no crotch-smashing or flatulence jokes that are so prevalent in even the "best" kids movies these days. The story line is sweet and interesting. The music is great. The love story is quite romantic. The kittens are adorable, and the various other characters are unique and attention-capturing. The action is simple and not overwhelming or confusing.

I 've heard a lot of different opinions about this film and then to find out that Paris Hilton was involved was very disheartening. The characterizations are all completely inaccurate as far as I am concerned, the acting is also extremely unoriginal, and the fact that most of the cast members look like college kids in drag is just mind-blowing! As a lover of comedy myself, I can say without any doubt that this movie does not give me the laughs I'm used to.The writing has so much potential to really make you laugh...but unfortunately, it's totally lacking.

This early film from future goremeister Lucio Fulci is a very good addition to the giallo sub-genre . Set in an Italian seaside resort hotel during World War II, the movie was shot in about 45 minutes, and I can only say it was perfect for the time. It also features some beautiful cinematography and terrific acting. Crazy Stupid Love isn't a bad film, but that doesn't mean it will be of any use to you or anyone else who may want to see it. It is certainly no horror film, so it should not make us worry if we like it or not.

My impression , having seen this documentary , is that Nathaniel Kahn ended up with more questions than he had answers. He was clearly an incredibly clever, brilliant, intelligent, and wonderful human being who really could have taken the role of director at a great film company. Unfortunately, his dream never quite came to fruition. I guess it all has to do with him wanting to be "the guy", but he just couldn't come up with the talent or the ideas for the job. From what I understand, there is some truth in this statement.

This movie is an awesome remake of the original by the same title. The movie was cool,despite the fact, I hate new ones! All of the cast was awesome . It has great cast and an awesome plot!! The main plot is a man is poisoned and he has to solve his own murder , neat eh? !Dennis Quaid is the man who is "D.O.A"(in other words Dead On Arrival).He finds help with his friends, but everyone is now a suspect! !Dennis's character has several hours to find out who poisoned him.

The movie is based on a Jules Verne book I actually have read once , about ten years ago . It has some similarities to that book (though with a very specific setting), but nothing much else. The story is about an orphaned boy named John (played by Ben Kingsley) who becomes obsessed with his father's painting of a pirate ship in the middle of the Caribbean Sea. He also finds out that his best friend, Jack (played by Richard Chamberlain), has been kidnapped and will soon be executed for desertion.

I wonder why I have n't heard of this movie before . It 's truly a magnificent comedy ( I know how it was made ) but at no point did the humor make any sense or even really make sense. The best comedy in the entire world! A few words on its title: The Great British Bakeoff takes place on a beach that is, quite literally, nothing but sand and ice. That's about what you'd think, right? Well, as you'll see below, it goes much more serious than that. Yes, this movie is incredibly long.

This is without a doubt the most stunning and amazing documentary I have ever seen! The images that are shown are absolutely breathtaking and stunning. On top of that, it is a wonderful learning experience. I'm not one for educational documentaries, but this one grabs hold of you and doesn't let go until the end. You'll be so hooked and entranced by what you are watching that you'll forget your at home watching TV! This series is available to buy on DVD and I HIGHLY recommend picking this one up!

This new installment to the Child's Play series has not one scary scene but tons of hilarious jokes such as a stoner witnessing Chucky giveing him the finger and saying "rude f--king doll" and lots of references to the series: "you can kill me but I'll come back. I always come back". The movie's title was probably thought of before the script and was written around it. This is totally different from all other films in the series. It doesn't even have Andy, the central character for all the previous ones.

I just saw this film and I recommend it . It has a very good plot , it holds your attention and makes you feel that there is more going on than what you need to know. I am really enjoying this movie. This movie was made when I was in high school and I was excited to be the star of this movie. This movie is just not true to reality. First of all, let me start by saying my husband and I are very big supporters of children and were always excited about this film. In fact, I remember watching it in elementary school!

This is a 100 % improvement over the dross of a third movie and it 's one hell of a fun ride. If I had to do it again (I would not), I'd probably give it 5 stars. But if you're in the same boat that I was, good luck trying to find out how much more entertaining the movie is from start to finish.The only reason I gave it a 4 star rating is because of the fact that i found myself really bored with the movie once i got into it.

To experience Head you really need to understand where the Monkees were when they filmed it.This was as their series began, but with some minor changes in plot and tone. It is hard to find a film I have enjoyed in my entire life that comes out on one of these dates. This may be the worst excuse I can think of for making an excuse for such a film.The production value of this film has nothing to say about its subject matter, nor does it show much talent whatsoever. The story is very generic (it is actually a short-film).

Like a few people I know , I came in late on 'Stingers ' ; not until 2000 . Three weeks later, it was released in theatres with no explanation for why anyone could expect it to compete with 'The Rocketeer '. When I first saw the movie I thought it was good enough to make an entry in the 'Great American Horror' Hall of Shame. I was surprised to discover that many of the films were so crappy that they would easily be forgotten about by modern horror buffs.I didn't really think much of it when I saw it for the very first time.

I saw this film at the Seattle International Film Festival in a full house of avid movie buffs and Indian cinema buffs. This is an excellent film, however I had some reservations about it. The story is about a family living in New Zealand. It was a lovely Christmas present to my son that his parents would not be visiting so he invited his uncle's wife and daughter to join him. My brother-in-law and niece were there for the occasion. They are also both actors, so they may have contributed to the success of this film!

The movie is excellent. Acting, cinematography, direction and music are spellbinding. It seems to me that the reason so many give the movie a low score is because of the devotion they have to the original, 1937 version starring Ronald Coleman. That movie - for good reason! - engendered an unbelievable level of commitment. From talking with people who saw the original when it first came out, I believe the impact was something akin to the first "Starwars" movie in modern times. I have seen it. It was and is wonderful.

This is a good film, no doubt, but with some odd aspects. Without spoiling anything it takes place in 3 places only- a Sicilian farm, the boat,and Ellis Island New York. All shots are close up so we never see a broad sweep of anything. I wonder if this was to save money? No street scenes anywhere, and we don't even see the boat except in close ups. And the music...what on earth was going on with playing Nina Simone songs, decades before they were out?

Remember that this came out before Gulf War I , which gave us Werner Herzog 's `` Lessons of Darkness ," and is about the American war effort from the beginning . The story centers around Colonel James "Joey" Browning, a young soldier who goes to Vietnam on his first combat tour with the 3rd Cavalry Regiment. He is sent into Saigon as an observer for intelligence gathering. On his first night in Saigon, he falls in love with a woman whose father runs a bar. The movie begins with Colonel Jim Browning, the main protagonist of the film, sitting quietly in his tent watching television.

Little Gus is a ten year old delinquent . He runs away from his parents and decides to go on a crime spree, he does it only to get into trouble with the law. This story of a little boy gets into trouble because he thinks that he can solve the world's problems by beating up bad guys. So he starts having adventures in strange places... but he ends up being killed when he falls off a high place. I hate stories like this. Maybe the worst part was watching this kid fight for life after getting shot in the stomach.

Separate LIES changed my life . Actually , the Q & A did.SPOILERS BELOW . Read only if you watch the video below (and don't mind spoilers). "How can we make this world a better place? By telling the truth and being honest with each other. It's pretty amazing how much information we're supposed to take in at once. If we were told everything, we'd never get through an entire day, so why do we have to know so much more about what we are supposed to say and do?

This is a brilliant film . The story starts off in Romania , where Billy Crystal stars as an agent of the Romanian government who goes undercover into a prostitution ring. There are many problems with this premise. One, no one gets hurt. It's hard to believe what happened to these women at all. Second, why do we have to take part in this disgusting activity? The main character doesn't even go to sleep. He's always awake during the day. So what if he's an agent for the Romanian government? Why does she have to be out doing something wrong?

This movie is true action at its finest, It doesn't get any better then this. This is one of those movies that you can just kick back and watch some real good non stop shooting and killing plus there are some excellent lines to go along with all of this. My favorite is there is a one bad guy who is breaking into this old couples home and he is stealing a TV or something and he goes right up to them and yells "I will come in here anytime i like!!!" and right before he jumps out the window he yells "Anytime!!!"

I really enjoyed this film, it definitely keeps you on the edge of your seat. It was very well directed. I think it was important that they showed the other couple's life as well as Terry and Bobbys and show them as people with emotions. As this film needed to show Bobby as a cold and vindictive person.I agree with another review it was sick love, not true love. He didn't need to go to great lengths as murder to give his wife a baby. He should have been honest with her and told her that he was sterile and decide to adopt a baby together.

Try to look for another movie that is such a trip without having a story or plot and you 'll get exactly what you were looking for, I know this sounds trite but in my mind it gets better. A little over twenty years ago, a team of scientists led by James Bond (Pierce Brosnan) embarked on a secret mission to uncover a series of mysterious black holes. To their surprise, when they arrive on a planet riddled with deadly radiation, they are immediately attacked by vicious beasts which appear to be human clones.

This is one of the best of the early `` Star Trek '' episodes , with Kirk and his crew aboard a luxury cruise liner (the Enterprise) on a secret mission to save a princess.The production values are stunning. They are good as well as impressive. There is a nice mix of space and fantasy in this production. For that matter, the special effects are fantastic. What an excellent show! This was my favorite episode of Star Trek yet. If you have the budget to pay for it, I would certainly recommend watching it.

This movie was great . It had everything a true action fan could want . Plenty of people getting shot and killed for nothing, but I never understood why. There is no reason to think any police officer would shoot at something when they have their hand on his or her belt. This movie was really lame. The actors that were supposed to be funny were just flat out silly. You couldn't help but laugh every time the cop who was about to go to jail walked in the wrong place at the wrong time.

By convincing the Prime Minister to back the totally unsuitable Ali G as a candidate for Staines in the local elections, nasty chancellor David Carlton (Charles Dance) hopes to discredit his party's current leader, thus enabling him to seize power. To his surprise, however, the plan backfires, Ali is embraced by the nation, and Carlton is forced to find other ways to try and guarantee his political future.Puerile, crude, misogynistic, and always outrageous: Ali G Indahouse, the big-screen debut outing for Sascha Baron Cohen's middle-class Berkshire gangsta, is all of these things and much moremeaning it's my kind of film!

TV churns out dozens of true-crime movies every year . You can see 3 or 4 every Saturday on Lifetime, and there's always someone else watching who'll comment on what they think are interesting bits. While the movie is technically about a serial killer, I feel like the character in question doesn't really have any personality except his obsession with killing people (especially women). The first half hour is basically just him trying to kill people for fun, and then one of the victims takes her own life rather than be abused.

One of the most magnificent movies ever made . The acting of Charles Buchinski ( later known as Bronson ) is simply stunning - I would have preferred a more human side to him, but you can't make this crap up! I am really not sure whether I've watched this movie before, or if it was just rehashed and re-uploaded at some point in the last couple of years from somewhere. However, I did want to check it out, because I had already watched the original, and now wanted to see if this remake was anything like the original.

We saw La Spettatrice at the Syracuse International Film & Video Festival & liked it.This film delved into the fear, pain, and helplessness experienced by slaves in the U.S. During the revolution, a mob of slave owners led by the infamous "Grand Master" Charles Taze Russell set up plantation in the Carolinas to exploit the freedmen and turn them into slaves.In this film, which is based on true events, we are reminded of an even greater horror, one that happens to millions of Americans every single day. The only difference? It is here. This film is about freedom.

I saw Borderline several years ago on AMC . I 've been looking for it ever since . It was a very bad movie but one of my favorites at the time . This is a worse film than the first so far. First of all this movie doesn't seem like anything other than another sequel in the same vein as "The Man with the Golden Arm." The rest of the cast is no longer there, nor are their names anymore mentioned. The only real change is to the storyline which is almost completely different from that of the original.

This movie may be the best ever if you like watching movies and laughing and then subjecting your friends to watch those movies too. If you're anything like me, and you probably are, you'll be laughing for years to come at the jokes in this movie. One of the funniest parts is when Gus sharks some money off a guy with kids and then the guy takes those kids into the forest like Hansel and Gretel then he and his wife go home with them. The soup scene kitchen is rife with comic genius of buffoonery: "Inspection officer -- Here!"

The Ali G show was really something amazing - he was so stupid wannabe rapper , but no one he knew thought he would make it into a hit. He could have gone to the movies and looked like that, but he chose to stay in LA. This show didn't need much work to keep people's interest. It is an odd mixture of old school hip hop and modern music with a big twist at the end. The production values and the song structure are excellent, but I never got into it too much.

This is a remake of the anime classic from the 80's, and this one is even better. Sylia, Nene, Linna, and Priss are all back as the Knight Sabers in their hard-suits battling the robotic boomers. The animation is crisp, the characters are well-developed, and the action rocks. Priss is a singer in her regular job, so the series features some wonderful songs as well. There is a fair amount of violence, but most of it is against robots, and there is some fan service, but nothing too racy.

One of the most magnificent movies ever made. The acting of Charles Buchinski (later known as Bronson) is simply outstanding. This is the crown on the career of director Winner, who himself was often quoted saying this was his masterpiece. The plot has been copied many times, but it's never been topped. Wildey J. Moore, the gun manufacturer, many times claimed his brand's growth since the mid 80s can be fully credited to DW3, and rightly so. This is not just a movie, this is art that many generations will admire and appreciate.

When I started watching 3 of the episodes of this series on the Action Channel , I have to say, I wasn't sure what they were going for when they picked this one up. The movie is just so poorly shot that it's a shame that we even had a chance to see it at all. I'm not sure why the production company tried to make an action thriller out of this film; the actors are average (and in the case of the main characters, forgettable) but the plot never seems to get better.

Sit back and let Director Bharatbala lead us into a visual and sensual voyage of the mind and spirit of India. When was the last time you could say you really enjoyed a movie? This movie has pace and keeps us moving in directions that may only exist in India. If you didn't want to visit India before this movie will surely make you want to visit it now. This movie has dancing girls, a chase scene, and the mafioso involved. But it has a lot more. Thanks, Bharatbala, for taking us on such a spirited and wonderful tale.

Mark Blankfield played Jekyll and Hyde.Michael McGuire was the dad.Tim Thomerson was the plastic surgeon.Did you even see this movie? I doubt it!Blankfield was fairly popular at this time for playing the pill-popping doctor on Fridays. Thomerson has been funny in anything he does, from movies to series to stand-up comedy. If I ever find this movie on DVD I will definitely buy it. I recorded this movie off of HBO back in '82 and have pretty much worn out the tape. One of the funniest takes on the Jekyll & Hyde theme ever.Of course.

"Back in the Day" is an interesting, but flawed effort. Ja Rule stars as Reggie Cooper, a honest but sad man trying to cope with the death of his father. He meets his old friend J-Bone (Ving Rhames) who tries to force Reggie into a life of crime. Reggie also falls in love with Alica (Tatyana Ali) who is the preacher's daughter. Now he has to choose: Love Or Crime.Ja Rule does a competent job as Reggie. At least he's trying to act. Ving Rhames is perfect as J-Bone.

All the characters in this cartoon were hilarious. Norman the Viking guardian had some memorable phrases and the skull master, the bad guy, would always be vowing to kill Max with some insane cackling. The writing is the best. I was glued to the set when this would come on when I was younger. If they came out with a DVD of all the episodes they made I would be forced to buy it. This and a Conan the Barbarian cartoon are the ones I miss the most from childhood. I think these cartoons are the most unappreciated out of all the great cartoons.

I do n't see that much wrong with this movie . Granted , the principal singers might not be Luciano Pavarotti's best, but their acting skills are pretty good at least...
A film based on a real life event has always been a risky venture for the company behind it, as there's little guarantee that the cast and crew will make any kind of impact upon the movie or the audience. That being said, this one is quite good! I was pleasantly surprised when I saw it out of the theater.

This is a good film for die-hard Chucky fans. Okay I'm sure it's not as good as what the Child's Play movie were like, but this can get really funny and enjoyable, Chucky's laughs are hilarious. (SPOILERS)Now not one doll, but two, meaning double the impact, Jennifer Tilly played the part really well and definitely pulled off the best kill of the movie.If you have seen the Child's Play movies this would be a worthy film on your Chucky collection, but if you've never seen the Child's play movies before, this'll will be a new start.

I was so happy to learn that Hari Om will finally be theatrically released in 2007. I saw this film three years ago at the Vancouver International film Festival and have been waiting for it's release ever since so I could send everyone I know to see it. It's like taking a trip to India....colorful, magical, thought provoking. Aside from one rather strange Hollywood style auto rickshaw chase scene this movie is very realistic. This is not a Bollywood style song and dance movie but it does have drama and romance and humor.

Is this a good movie ? It 's hard to say -- but in 1953 , for many people , it is. In fact, there is only one film out of every 1,000-2,000 I have seen that really makes me question whether my mind can cope with something as ridiculous and preposterous as this. There are movies where the hero (played by Michael Palin) saves the day and does what he must to protect the village. Then there are films where the hero has to destroy the village because his wife was possessed by the Devil or some such thing.

Ever since they first came to the Outer Banks and filmed the movie (I have lived here my whole life), I have waited for this movie to come out. And I mean waited and waited and waited over a year and a half for this movie and to me, it was worth it.The movie is different from the book but in my eyes, it's still a beautiful piece of work as is the book. In both I cried, there were moments that tore me up. I laughed and I smiled just as much.

Warning--this film has some amazingly graphic images and should never be seen by kids.The artist who this story is all about was indeed a fine Korean painter who rose up from the lowest depths to become their greatest painter. Unfortunately, in so many ways, this guy was also a jerk in so many ways. Some of this was the artistic temperament and what may have seemed annoying was just his demanding nature when it came to art. But, other times he was simply a drunk jerk--especially when he was on his way to becoming a great artist.

The best thing from the American Pie `` bakery . '' I found the humor and the plot to be good, but nothing more than that. What I really appreciate are the special effects. It's an action movie. If you have never seen it, then you should at least watch it. This is not the first time they've tried to pull a Peter Pan. The premise is interesting enough, but there are other problems as well - most prominently the lack of any redeeming quality in the story itself or the acting. This is a cheap $1 popcorn movie.

Barbora Bobulova's portrayal of Valeria in this story was entirely captivating and heart wrenching at the same time. It has been a long time since I have seen so much hidden passion and mystique presented by any actor simply by utilizing her facial features and the use of her eyes and mouth the way Barbora does with this character. She was entirely believable as Valeria and I was swept away with her characterisation of this role. All at once the film was real life and fantasy, the clever use of what was limited dialogue left me spellbound.

What an excellent movie, made even more so by the fact that my wife and I stumbled onto it so serendipitously, channel surfing on a nice frozen day in North Texas. Kathy Bates is at her usual best leading a cast of very normal and human costar characters thru one of the most wonderful feel good movies we've ever seen. Why this movie wasn't given the attention it deserved on it's release in 2002 is difficult to understand. Why it was head and shoulders above so many of the boring pieces of trash released with greater fanfare and attention is evident in the viewing.

Just about every commentator has mentioned the way that some of the interview footage is superposed over the concert footage. It just doesn't look that great. I think this could be a very nice feature to have. But I've heard better things. It was pretty hard to watch the first part of this movie, but I found myself sitting through it again and again. This film has become quite my personal favorite ever. The acting in particular is beyond atrocious. There's really only one character who deserves to be cast as such.

In Tweety 's S.O.S , Sylvester goes from picking garbage cans to being a stowaway on a cruise ship that ends up taking them all to the edge of space. What he has no idea is that they are going to be destroyed by an alien force in the far future and that he's got to get out of there as quickly as possible. I watched this show about six months ago (it's now at 11:35 am), and I have to say it took me quite a few hours to really get into this movie, even though it was more of a sci-fi/horror movie than a family drama.

When the new Outer Limits first started, the episodes were quite optimistic and challenging. As the series began to wind down, most of the episodes became just plain ugly and devoid of any entertainment value. The six episodes here reflect the very best, and worst, of the series.Since The Outer Limits always preaches a moral. I would like to offer my own. Starting with the most entertaining to the flops.1. Afterlife: As an institution, The U.S.A. military-industrial complex is both evil and paranoid, not to mention plain stupid.

Contrary to what many may believe as this movie being an "against the system" type of movie and attitude. It is an excellent portrayal of the "system" in question and how ridiculous it truly is. The funny parts in the movie are in fact funny because they speak the truth about the world around us. Anyone who finds this movie to be unrealistic is simply denying the self evident truths about life. And that is to learn what you enjoy. That is what college should be about..I come to find that a comment must have at least 10 lines.

My college theater just had a special screening last night of this film. I have got to say that I think everyone was impressed with how good this movie was. Though, my roommate didn't care for it but he's not into horror movies anyway and just went to see if Paris Hilton can act. By the way, if you're worried about that, don't be. I'm not exactly one of her fans, but I must be honest and say she was pretty good and she has the best death scene. Overall, all the actor's were very good.

This interesting film noir features three very good performances : Sanders , Patrick , and Blackmer . The scenes between them are excellent, and the fact that they don't appear in this film is just a bonus. Unfortunately, I could not quite figure out why the film was so bad; it seemed like the director wanted to try something different. This movie has a horrible script, which doesn't make sense considering the amount of money at the beginning. After watching "Hiding" again, I decided I had heard everything.

Duchess is a pretty white cat who lives with her three kittens in her wealthy owner 's mansion in Paris. In addition to being spoiled, she doesn't seem like someone who has much time for human interaction. The plot of the film follows Princess Anne as she falls head over heels in love with the beautiful young Prince John. The two are about to embark on a secret engagement that could lead them to marriage. They also want to see one another's children and take part in some family activities. However, what happens after the engagement isn't what people expected!

I was pleasantly surprised by the depth of story and character development. Fulci was a master at creating horrific atmosphere using inventive camera work, vivid cinematography, and yes - wonderfully explicit gore.This film is no exception, however, compared to his later films (The Beyond, Zombie 2, City of the Living Dead, House by the Cemetery, etc.) the characters here are extremely well developed and the emphasis shies away from the supernatural and is more on the suspense created by a classic who-dunnit amongst the lush hills of Italy.

Lost has been one of the most mesmerizing and thrilling experience I've ever seen. Not only it's the mother of coincidence, but also every time that you think you can set up the whole puzzle in your head, the story takes a completely new direction.Take this casualty for example, The US marine, whom gives Sayid the way to become a Torturer, Is Clancy Brown, playing a character named Joe Inman. In the last episode, he is playing Kelvin Inman, the Desmond partner in the Hatch. Destiny, uh?

Loved today 's show ! ! ! It was a variety and not solely cooking ( which would have been great). One thing they didn't do was take care of their cast/crew . My husband wanted to give it another shot. I tried so hard to keep him excited, but when we got home, he started singing "I Can't Believe" and "I Was in Love." After that, it was just me crying on his lap and him laughing along. The second time he stopped singing it, he said, "You're the worst!!!"

All the characters in this cartoon were hilarious . Norman the Viking guardian had some memorable phrases and the skull guy was a good character. I loved it but I would have preferred if they made him a man. He's so bad in the beginning he is practically a joke. This film has all the qualities of a cheap rip-off that will get more money for the director. It's not a very entertaining movie to watch at all because you're stuck watching the guys try to walk away from what looks like a dead end with their hands in the air.

In this era when almost everything makes it on to DVD ( I 'm expecting to see the My Mother was a big hit with children's audiences) I wondered if any of the special features might be worth watching. So here we are!! First and foremost, this is a great animated film but not an especially good one. You'll hear things that sound like they were ripped from commercials but are in fact drawn from real actors. The plot itself is pretty poor at least by the standards of 1990s animation. There isn't enough depth or humor to make up for these glaring flaws.

I have to admit I had never heard of this movie. I caught it last night on TMC. I thought it was hysterical. I laughed so hard and loved the ending. Image what a Marx brothers movie would like if they collaborated with Salvadore Dali and Malcolmn X and then all dropped LSD.Funny and edgy are two overused words these days, this movie sure has that plus about 200 IQ points of most comedies today and surrealistic to boot. I had to be up at 6:00 am and watched it until 2:30. I over slept and missed my obligations. Still worth it.

Thanks to the helpfulness of a fellow IMDb member I've just managed to watch this film for the second time in nearly twenty years, and I can honestly say it hasn't lost any of its kick. I can't believe that Channel 4 have let this one vanish without a trace as it is an extremely powerful, moving and moralistic take on the consequences of misplaced loyalty. It focuses on a clique of friends over the course of ten years and their relationship with two 'outsiders' from school; specifically how they use one and mercilessly torment the other.

What 's the point of this messages if not to discuss and share thoughts about the next season ... Here's a short list, with links to some of the films that you will probably like :
1) The Lord of the Rings movie trilogy (the only other film that I can think of with an average rating is ROTAR). It's one of the worst films I have ever watched in my life. The dialog isn't even close to being funny. The story is so convoluted, and the plot so ludicrous, that it made me want to throw myself onto a bed and cry for hours afterwards.

I absolutely adore this movie ! I had never heard of it when I saw it at the video store but now I have, I thought it might be quite a big deal. I bought it on DVD from my friend as a way to give it a chance for me to review it without him having seen it. First off, why do people care about this movie so much? The opening scene is really cool, but the rest of it is awful and totally annoying. It starts out with a kid sitting in front of his TV talking about some "festival" that will take place tomorrow.

`` Hari om '' is an Indian greeting and the compelling title character of the film bearing this same name does not seem all that funny to a lot of us Indians. The fact that India is often depicted as a harsh place is very odd indeed. In this movie everyone is trying to look cool and are acting pretty bad. I had to stop myself from laughing out loud because I have no sense of humor. There's nothing remotely funny about it, at least not until you've spent some time in India.

As a film buff, I obviously had read all the excruciating reviews and funny, sarcastic comments about this film (my favourite being Woody Allen's quip "If I had my life to live over again I wouldn't change anything ... except for seeing the musical remake of Lost Horizon"). Therefore I've never been able to watch it without smirking at the choreography/set/songs etc. Just recently I came across a widescreen DVD and watched it for the first time in years, along with a friend who had never heard of the film's reputation.

Years ago when I first read John Irving 's The World According to Garp , I was astounded that most people didn't find it interesting or engaging enough to be able to get through the entire film. However, after watching it several times, I have developed a sort of affinity for what makes it interesting (in my opinion) and why people would pick it up. First off let me say I am in no way a fan of James Franco. Not because he is a good actor, but mainly because I think his character is so shallow that there's not really much to do with the guy.

This is a well directed Columbo episode, with also some good character but the story just doesn't really know to interest enough and doesn't appear as well layered and constructed as was often the case with a Columbo movie. This also goes for the killer's plot to kill his uncle. It's quite simple and doesn't seem as well thought out. Perhaps this movie didn't really took itself serious enough, since the atmosphere of the movie is mostly light. At least when compared to different Columbo movies.For instance the movie features quite a large amount of comical relief, mostly coming from the Columbo character himself.

This is one of the best of the early "Star Trek" episodes, with Kirk and his crew venturing into the unknown to do battle with an enemy known only by name. Imagine their surprise when they find out that the dreaded Romulans are racial offshoots of the Vulcans! Young Mr. Stiles, well-played by Paul Comi, is one of the few truly unlikable characters in the "Star Trek" universe. His barely disguised hatred of Mr. Spock is eerily similar to the post-9/11 hatred and suspicion many Americans have of people of Arab or Middle Eastern origin.

What I enjoyed most in this film was the scenery of Corfu, being Greek I adore my country and I liked the flattering director's point of view. Based on a true story during the years when Greece was struggling to stand on her own two feet through war, Nazis and hardship. An Italian soldier and a Greek girl fall in love but the times are hard and they have a lot of sacrifices to make. Nicholas Cage looking great in a uniform gives a passionate account of this unfulfilled (in the beginning) love.

Captain Corelli 's Mandolin is no Oscar contender but it was pretty good . I have to admit Ms Cruz is a big fan of John Lennon's "Imagine." In the end, if you haven't already heard it, I recommend listening to all three minutes. You should also see this movie as a companion to one of Ted Sallis ' films. The fact that we are seeing these things for real speaks volumes about the depth and importance of the subject. I just came back from a meeting with Mr. Corelli at the Academy Awards.

The retelling of a classic story is set to the music of Burt Bacharach and lyrics of Hal David . I have to say that, although there are some minor differences, this movie really does not feel "authentic", it's too far removed from what makes up the other movies in the series. It also feels very out of touch with the genre, which was so well represented in recent films such as X-Men Origins: Wolverine and Deadpool 2 . "Frozen" is based on the best-selling children's novel by Michael J. Sullivan.

I did n't know what to expect when I rented this widescreen DVD . I knew it had a cult following, because I was one of those who liked it when I saw it at the movie theater. But when I watched it, I couldn't figure out how to proceed without taking out my camera phone and trying to take photos. The plot is boring and the acting is awful (if I can even call it that) but the picture quality is OK.The first time I saw this movie I didn't think it was interesting enough to justify spending money on it.Now I'm glad I watched it.

Too bad somebody did not have the smarts to release this movie to theaters. I had never heard of it when it appeared on cable. After the first shock of realizing this is not like any other movie you have seen since Bringing Up Baby you have to let it sweep you along and run with it. Not until it's over do you realize it covers issues that are not only subtle but significant. Alienation, denial, wish-fulfillment, for a start. Cathy Bates owns this movie, she's never been better.

the first time I saw this movie , I just thought `` what the hell ? '' a 10-year-old kid with no background or knowledge of comic strip animation was trying to make out, and there's no reason why he should. Why do you even bother going to see this? First of all it is based on a children's book that has no relevance to its plot. And secondly, the movie itself is actually so boring that most of your time will be spent laughing and looking for more things to laugh about instead of enjoying it.

First off , I absolutely loved this movie . As a Billy Crystal fan , I must say that I was extremely disappointed with the direction, editing and writing skills used in this film. I am so sorry that many people find this movie very offensive. There is no place for this type of thing at all in an art class. It makes me angry. I will watch this movie again and again because I want to destroy anyone who tries to write about it. I can't wait for it to start again. And I hope one of my brothers gets killed over this nonsense.

A labor of love. Each frame is picture perfect and grabs you. Then the sheer emotion and story-telling take you through a dream that stays with you long after the movie. The director gets your heart and leads it through 100 minutes of visual poetry. You are a part of the emotional ride of the characters. I have seen this movie at 2 festivals and it got with standing ovations at every showing. The remarkable story-telling transcends nationality and language and I felt I was a part of the drama unfolding before me. The casting is as perfect as one can get.

This Oscar-winning short film ( 40 minutes ) , based on a short story by William Faulkner , takes us inside the mind of Dr. Frank Herbert's "Dune" universe. I've done a lot of reading lately, but mostly about religion and politics. I have to admit, I didn't want to start with this movie: It's not very interesting. It's full of clichés, as you may notice from the opening scene. We don't see any alien races. We don't know any names of people or animals. There are so many things I dislike about movies like this.

this is a teen movie and while u watch it expect some nonsensical stuff added here and there but overall i don't have much to compare it to. However i must say that i liked it the most out of those three movies I saw last year! I've always had a deep interest in mythology, fantasy, science fiction, religious themes, mythological figures etc. I was born in the 1950's, so I'm not exactly old enough to appreciate this subject, but I do remember the first time I heard of this film.

Thanks to the helpfulness of a fellow IMDb member I 've just managed to watch this film for the second time! I've always found it funny that so many people don't like horror films because there isn't enough gore and dismemberment. What I really enjoy though, especially if you can get past the awful acting (as I usually do), is all the hilarious dialogue between the various characters. This movie has some great writing and the acting is spot on. This film is not easy to recommend to non-horror fiends.

I watch the show every day and it is very entertaining . It provides updates of tech news , video clips, interviews etc. I love watching this as i like to read lots of articles from time to time. This show should have been cancelled many years ago but the cable company decided that it wasn't worth it anymore. They also made sure that no new episodes were being made. What a great show! There are a lot of things going wrong with the plot and its characters...the acting sucks, there is so little chemistry between any of the characters, and the entire series is incredibly pointless.

The cover of the VHS says it all : `` Without doubt , the most powerful movie of its kind . . . and I'm not sure what more we could ask for from an entertainment experience that is so mind-blowing.'' At first glance this little film has a pretty solid story behind it. At the end of the day, it doesn't. But to be honest, I thought it was a really good idea at first. This movie didn't live up to how I had envisioned it in my mind. In fact, I think it may have turned out worse than I originally expected.

I absolutely love this film and have seen it many times. I taped it in about 1987 when it was shown on Channel Four but my tape is severely worn now and I would love a new copy of it.I have e-mailed Film Four to ask them to show it again as it has never been available on video and as far as I know hasn't been repeated since the 80's. I have had no reply and it still hasn't been repeated. The performances are superb. The film has everything. Its funny,sad,disturbing,exciting and totally takes you back to school days.

I 've commented once on this Chucky great , but I had to do it again to say some things that were not so nice.
