The story here is quite good, though it doesn't always follow the plot and it often seems like they have a plan in mind before everything goes wrong. The only redeeming factor for me was that I got to watch the film in its entirety for the first time as I'm getting old. I think it was important that the plot remained consistent, as there were many scenes that could have been edited out.

Even after nearly 20 years apart, the original members of Black Sabbath have not lost a thing. In this concert, they perform their best songs from their heyday (1970-1978), including "N.I.B. ", "War Pigs", and "Paranoid".Also included is priceless backstage footage with interviews and retrospectives into their days as the top hard rock band on the planet. The comments of Ozzy, Tony Iommi, Geezer Butler, and Bill Ward are just as interesting and intriguing to watch as the fabulous onstage performances.A must-see for all Sabbath and Ozzy fans.

Mark Blankfield (from the old late night TV show "Fridays")plays Dr. Daniel Jekyll, a mild-mannered surgeon who invents a powder that turns him into a drug-crazed party animal. This was not, of course, his intent, he had higher aspirations, but he goes with the flow. This is actually a fairly stupid movie, but it's also pretty fun. Of course, once the good doctor realizes what he's done, he's ashamed, but he's also not above doing it all again & running through Hollywood as a crazed sex machine with frizzed out hair & gold chains.

That's right. Ohwon (the painter and the main character) is an exceptional person. What strikes me most is the message this film might address to all of you people there. And the message is sad. It says that, it's very difficult to do anything that's amazing or maybe even genius without having to obey the governments, establishment and other VIPs of this world. And even if you try, you might not be able to bear it. It is about the battle of a single person with a system. With many systems.A great film of this wonderful Korean director.

William Faulkner was one of the American writers to win the Nobel Prize in literature. Faulkner mostly wrote about life in the South particularly during the depression years. Many of his stories have been adapted to screen. Short stories like Two Soldiers is an endearing tale of two brothers in December 1941 after the attack on Pearl Harbor. The older brother, Pete Greer, goes to Memphis, Tennessee to enlist like hundreds of thousands of young men, some who would never come home. His younger brother doesn't take his departure well. He manages to get a bus ticket to Memphis without any money to find his brother.

I believe that this is one of Elizabeth Montgomery 's best performances in a movie , and I have seen all of the trailers for it. It looks like something that someone would put together to raise money for charity. If you've never seen it or are curious, I suggest you rent it from your local video store.If you've not seen it, here's some information about it:It was released in 1980 as "The Last Temptation of Christ". After a couple of mediocre movies, it started to become a cult classic after the release of its first remake.

I first saw The Buddy Holly Story when I was about seven years old. I had no idea who Buddy Holly was, nor can I remember what it was that made me sit down in front of the television, tuned in to HBO, and watch this engaging biopic. What I remember was realizing that it was a (somewhat) true story, about someone who actually lived. I recall the music, great songs that I still love today (I can't believe Gary Busey sang his own songs and so well - What a stud!) Then, came the end.

This is one of Chaplin 's First National films from the period between his glorious Mutual shorts and the more recent The Dark Crystal. It was filmed in a very primitive state, mostly in black and white, except for occasional flashbacks to the 1930's. This is possibly the only film where Chaplin plays an old school cop who makes it back to modern day Los Angeles. The acting is fine, the cinematography is rather dull, but the story is compelling.I've had this picture before, and thought I would see if there was anything to say about it.

SPOILERSI love the Simpsons , and I have seen every single episode that had ever come out . I must say that I do not think this movie is bad, however, for some reason. The script is very well thought out, but it is a lot of repetitiveness to make you sit through several scenes. In my opinion, the whole movie is just a bunch of wasted time. It seems as though the main character will never get anywhere because he's stupid enough to walk right into the wrong people's lives.This movie may be funny and entertaining, but it fails miserably at delivering its message.

This is a remake of the anime classic from the 80 's , and this one is even better . While there are some flaws in the way the anime is done , it is still quite entertaining! The story of "Himeko no Rave" is pretty basic. A girl named Himeko has to get out of highschool before she hits her late 30's (or younger). She tries to leave home but ends up getting a job at a fast food chain. She does not like it and doesn't like her boss' attitude.

Remember that this came out before Gulf War I, which gave us Werner Herzog's "Lessons of Darkness".Le Dernier Combat is not "Sci Fi". It's more like Judgment. I've watched it at least a dozen times. It really is a fitting companion to Herzog's "Lessons of Darkness": "And in that time, men will seek death, but they will not find it, for death will flee from them. "That someday, alas, may be today, in Iraq.

I first started watching The Outer Limits back in 95 when I was 10 , and it just blew my mind. When I was 11 the show was cancelled, and I sat through it all again this past summer. There are sooooo many amazing things going on in there that it was impossible not to love it.The story is about a couple of space explorers who travel from planet to planet to explore alien life, which turns out to consist of almost everything we're used to living on earth. They meet an extraterrestrial woman and they form an impassioned friendship. This movie is really boring.

After spotting the boat at the end of the previous episode ("Three Minutes"), the survivors are shocked to find out who the occupant is. With the use of the boat, Jack and Sayid come up with a plan to confront "The Others". However, when Jack, Sawyer, Kate and Hurley follow Michael to "The Others", Jack is forced to reveal Michael's deadly secret whilst they are in the middle of nowhere.Meanwhile, Locke decides that the time has come to find out the time has come to find out what will happen if "the button" is not pressed.

Can the intensity of a husband 's love for his wife lead him to cover up a crime , despite being told he could not ? I just went to see this movie when I came to India in the winter. It wasn't too bad. There was very little action though and there wasn't much romance either. At least that is what I was told from the film's producers but it was really boring to watch. The only thing I would have liked about it was if they had taken some time to include a decent story line. It didn't.

Jeff Garlin's film is filled with heart and laughter. As in Curb Your Enthusiasm, his screen persona is hilarious; but in addition we get to see both warmth and a sense of emotional vulnerability that makes the story universal. While the film chronicles his character's dreams of love, performing success, and weight loss, it will appeal to anyone who dreams of a better life. The supporting cast brings the frustrations and joys of his life to the screen in funny and heartbreaking ways. The simple joys of food, friendship, and trying once again once life has disappointed us are all themes.

(Some spoilers included:)Although, many commentators have called this film surreal, the term fits poorly here. To quote from Encyclopedia Britannica's, surreal means:"Fantastic or incongruous imagery": One needn't explain to the unimaginative how many ways a plucky ten-year-old boy at large and seeking his fortune in the driver's seat of a red Mustang could be fantastic: those curious might read James Kincaid; but if you asked said lad how he were incongruous behind the wheel of a sports car, he'd surely protest, "NO way!"

What a shame this movie was never released . ( It is now playing on cable . ) I tuned into it early in the evening because I love comedy. Not only is it funny but also it makes me feel good. This is basically what you get if you don't like movies about animals, or at least the people who put them in there. "Killer Cow" is nothing more than a horrible excuse for human emotion. As a man of few words, I have little sympathy towards him. But to be honest, the film lacks any kind of humor or heart.

I first saw The Victim (aka Out Of Contention) well over 25 years ago when I was very young. Being a passionate fan of Bewitched since I was a child, I loved to watch anything that starred Elizabeth Montgomery. This movie was (and still is) a real treat - whether you are a fan of Miss Montgomery's work or not. Elizabeth always shines in her roles, such as her portrayal as the rape victim in A Case Of Rape and as the suspected murderess in The Legend Of Lizzie Borden.

It's up there with Where's Poppa, The Groove Tube, Putney Swope. It memorializes the NY city mind set of the period, a wonderfully strange man with a bizarre plan, hoist by by own petard, and at last retreating into the bed of his adoptive parents. Totally absurd, its the life one sees through the magic glasses, seeing things as they "really are"... I don't think it is ever shown anymore. If so, surely someone would Tivo the thing and put it out there.

Hey look , you do n't watch this movie to change your life ! But if you are female especially since it has nothing to do with porn or the arts, then watch it. The main thing that you see in this movie (at least the first few scenes) is that a guy does some dumbass shit while his wife is there watching from the sidelines. The second time she comes back and finds out what's wrong he gets so mad at her for ruining his life and she goes home to tell him how awful he was . I really don't care about this movie.

The success of SCREAM gave birth to a whole new horror flicks wave . I 'm happy with that , because I have seen quite a few of them (I'm a sucker for gore), but I never thought I'd say: "this is a good horror flick".SCREAM is one of those films where the film itself is just as interesting as the characters. Every scene in SCREAM is so bizarre and horrible that it was enough to make me fall asleep. If you're looking for a movie that's a mix of both genre and story, SCREAM might be an intriguing prospect.

I really enjoyed this film , it definitely keeps you on the edge of your seat . It was very funny to watch, which is always nice. I loved this movie! The story was really cool, but I hated some of the acting. At times it got a bit boring and the characters were pretty predictable. If you're going to make a "comedy" with comedy at its centre (and if you're making a comedy), you might as well have an actor who doesn't care what people think.

Enchanting. The best time to see this movie is sometime when unhappy or sad. It's all just so cute, all, even the way that white bear loves the Queen in secret and gets Her in the end, also the achievement the two young actors of Gerda and Kai gave. It's music is also very nice. The two of us will always be one combined with sad piano tones in some places gives a very touching result and if one watches both parts at once, he'll see the Snow Queen is not so bad.

This movie possesses something most other movies of its genre do not : intelligence and good messages . Accepted , but not great. I enjoyed it. I did not believe in it. There is nothing particularly new or original about this story. It just looks old fashioned. If the story were better, it could have been funny. If it were better... that would have been the same for me.If you are interested in learning about some of the problems associated with having children and how society can be made to take care of a parent/caregiver problem, this movie might be worth watching.

I am a long time fan of Luc Besson 's work , and for about as long as I 've wanted to get into the directorial arena, his films have always impressed me with their ability to create an amazing world. In the first film "La Morte d'Arthur", we've got Arthur (Jean Valjean), a young boy who wanders through the land trying to understand the nature of evil. But he soon finds out that what is evil lies far more subtle than he ever imagined. While investigating one of these dark places, Arthur comes across another man who was once a prisoner of fate.

At first I didn't think I would like this movie, but as it progressed it became better and better. I love music and I was impressed with how well Cage could fake the movements of playing a mandolin. My son was with me and he also like the movie a lot for its music and the story and the way the story unfolded--- slowly showing how Corelli won the girls heart. The acting and the story were both well done and well directed. At first Corelli's bravado was irritating, but soon he grew on you.

Blind Spot's images are great. The action draws you in completely, even though the movie is a bit long. By the end credits all that you can think about are the film's positive high-points. The lead actors have the most incredible screen presence. The story is heart-wrenching. The film score is nicely understated . Completely moving in its own powerful way. Not your standard melodramatic cuing. Trance-like moments add poetic resonance to the engrossing narration and terrific visual compositions. Hope you get a chance to see this film. It delves into some dark territory but you come out of the tunnel seeing nothing but white light.

This is by far one of the best movies I have seen in a very long time. Top 20 of my lifetime. I laughed more than I have since Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy, and cried more than I have since I saw The Notebook. If you are looking for a touching movie without the sappy edge...this is the one. It is real and powerful. See it and you won't regret it. I was reluctant at first and I only watched it because I had to do a school project about speech disabilities. But this movie is so much more than that.

The Aristorcats is a hilarious film that not many people have seen . Clearly not that many because it only has 6 hours of running time and doesn't show much of the plot. However, the movie is very funny as well. While there are many good jokes in this movie it also contains some fairly bad ones at times. As you may have read I mentioned several times before that I hated "Aristorcats" and had been doing so since I watched it about a year or so ago. This is the second part of a series of interviews I conducted for a DVD/Blu-Ray that will be coming out in November.

David Attenborough brings his fascination of wild life , this time the creatures under the sea , in this extraordinary film. This film is based on an original story by Howard Hughes, published in 1980. Hughes had never heard of The Island of Doctor Moreau while making this film for a magazine called Science World. It was very difficult for the editors to decide whether or not they wanted to publish it in print, and they didn't know which one to go with, so they stuck to their guns. When they did pick up the book they went straight to the end and threw away half of the first edition.

This movie got better with time. I can't believe that it has been forty years since I saw this at the age of 15. Yes, that's right. Movie ratings were not yet a reality, so any teenager could walk into any movie. Imagine what it was like for a kid my age to see both Midnight Cowboy and Putney Swope in the same year. Imagine the times. Bobby Kennedy and Martin Luther King has just been killed but the following summer had a man walking on the moon and Woodstock. Putney Swope was the Woodstock nation's chance to stick it to the man.

I agree that this is ONE of the very best episodes of the entire series -- my only detraction would be the fact that it wasn't aired in America, where the show has been successful. There were other shows on the network with better and more interesting characters (i.e. Friends & Family). I'm going to start this review by stating that if you don't mind me saying this much, I am a really bad person. I can't even begin to describe how incredibly disappointed I felt when I watched the pilot for this episode.

This little film is hysterical, full of stereotypes about gays, straights, dwarfs, British tea and pubs, American gun culture, divorce and marriage; yet, it manages to be sensitive to the issues surrounding each. Kathy Bates is "Amazing" Grace Beasley, and as a character actor of staggering range, she brings her considerable comedic talent to ground this somewhat unusual film as she did in Fried Green Tomatos. With the help of other comedic talents like Dan Akroid as Max, her ex-lawyer husband and the backdrop of downtown Chicago and rural England, the story is just intriguing enough to entertain.

Jeff Garlin 's film is filled with heart and laughter . As in Curb Your Enthusiasm , his screen persona has been a caricature of himself for many years. But after seeing him in The Night Manager , my first thought was, What the f**k is he doing? "I don't care about any of it. I hate that this movie even exists at all. I just found it very disturbing to see a guy who should know better spend so much time making people look dumb. That's the end of me." I love Kevin Spacey.

Oh my gosh ! ! I love this movie sooooooooooooooooooooo much ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! This was one of the movies I thought were bad but they are pretty good. There were a couple of really horrible scenes in this movie but when you're looking forward to watching it you'll be glad you did. The cast is actually quite decent. Peter Serafini does some really nice lines as the head of a small criminal organization called the "The Brotherhood". But, what really gets me excited is the supporting cast that also appears in the movie: Tom Selleck and Robert Downey Jr.

I didn't know what to expect when I rented this widescreen DVD. I knew it had a cult following but I had also seen a lot of the director's later works which although delightfully gory were also pretty much incoherent. DON'T TORTURE A DUCKLING actually had a linear storyline and a mystery that kept me guessing almost until the end. And after all was said and done, it was a genuinely unsettling and creepy experience. One major caveat: I would much rather have heard the original soundtrack and read English subtitles than the uneven dubbing found here.

Considering it 's basically low-budget cast , this is a surprisingly good flick about the life and death of rock star Elvis Presley. It's also, of course, one of the most famous movies ever made, which makes us wonder: how did you guys get such a great script, so bad acting and so little story? A few minutes before the opening shot of Elvis Presley's "You Can't Stop The Music" plays, we get a couple of glimpses into his life from his early days with his mother, Aunt Marlene.

Let me clarify that . This is not a `` good movie '' , but I am so glad it was made. There are several scenes where you feel there is something really wrong with the actor who played the lead, especially in certain parts. Also, the pacing is just awful. I'm a huge fan of this movie and would like to see it released. The casting is very bad and the script is extremely dated. So let's face it: don't put this movie on your shelf; you will never see it again!

The Simpsons of course started off with Christmas special `` Simpson 's Roasting On An Open Fire '' which had an all star cast including the likes of Fred Savage, Marge Simpson, Tim Allen, Peter Fonda and Al Pacino. The episode ended with a big bang as Homer falls asleep in front of the fireplace to the soundtrack of Santa Claus making his merry-go-round . This was one of my favorite Christmas specials of all time but I must say that I found it kind of repetitive. Most of the episodes were centered around family and friendship, and there was no real need for plot development.

I do n't usually comment on films since I am in the movie distribution business , but I have to say this was a poor effort. The acting was very amateurish and there were too many silly characters that just seemed like they were supposed to be amusing at the expense of the story. This could've easily been worse. It was directed by John Singleton and stars Tom Hanks as a "bad ass" ex-policeman (who now works as an actor) named Frank. Frank is a hard working cop who has lived a pretty decent life without being able to help his daughter who is mentally ill.

The Buddy Holly Story opens on a shot of a yellow neon moon on the roof of a roller rink. In the background you'll hear the announcer, "Buddy Holly is here." It's one thing to see someone who is famous as a song-and-dance number singer doing something new with it. But it can be very disheartening to watch somebody who is so dedicated to his craft being cast as the main character of a movie that just happens to be about him. So I was really excited to see this when it comes out at the end of July.

While I agree that this movie lacks any real substance and should not be taken seriously, its primarily directed to fans of the series who are looking for a quick fix. Bronson (Paul Kersey)once again takes to the streets (given a license to kill by the chief police no less) and moves into his friends apartment (who you guessed it) was killed by a street gang that has taken control of the neighborhood (which looks like Beruit). It's funny that people who associate with Bronson have a habit of getting killed.

This movie may be the best ever if you like watching movies and laughing and then subjecting your friends to being subjected to it. The problem here is that these kids have all the acting chops of an old school American football player (who probably would have been able to score a kick or two) and just can't get anywhere near what they're doing. The director makes them go to bed, sleep, take a walk on the beach, lie down, etc. And he says: "What? What's wrong with them?"

It 's up there with Where 's Poppa , The Groove Tube , Putney Swope . It memorializes the NY/NJ era of rock & roll. In fact, if someone ever wrote a song called "I Got You" about this band, I wouldn't let them get away with it.The only thing I'm not surprised by is how quickly this song became popular in the 90's, considering it was written in 1977. It also doesn't make sense that the group would have released this song while they were going through a bad bit of a financial mess and trying to recover some momentum.

What a cast of actors and actresses in this Columbo episode , beside Peter Falk , you have Julie Newmar . She is the most beautiful thing on the planet. I just want to tell everyone they will never be sorry, because if I were you I would hate it. What an overacting performance by Julie Newmar here, she seems to really believe she's getting away with everything she's saying and doing. You can't blame them for that; it's exactly like having a bad day at work, but worse than that, you don't go to the movies anymore.

If we could have "Separate Tables," why not "Separate Lies. "This becomes somewhat involved. A housekeeper's husband is killed when he is hit by a car while on a bicycle. The culprit turns out to be the woman she cleans for. The latter was having an affair with a friend and was driving the car with the lover in it when the accident occurred. To complicate matters further, the housekeeper once worked for the guy's parents and he had her jailed for stealing. Therefore, people will hesitate to believe that it was his car that caused the accident.

I just thought I would add another observation , here . While there are a couple of visual sub-references , they are not significant to what is actually being said, and it is impossible to believe that the author believes he is giving an accurate account.First of all, this movie is a complete waste of $13 million dollars. Why? There are some parts in this movie that were really impressive (the action scene, for example ) but other parts have nothing interesting about them at all. What happened to the director's eye for direction? Where is the acting?

I taped The Morrison Murders on Lifetime Movie network and I watched The Morrison Murders on Lifetime , Lifetime Movie Network. I've been looking for my home movies since they were on HBO back in the day. You know, when you go to see something, you can tell why it's not like the original. For example, one of the movie directors was so bad, he had to change all the words in the movie. And this movie is just terrible. The plot doesn't even make sense. This movie has a lot of flaws.First off there's the characters.

SPOILERS BELOW`A Dog's Life' was most noteworthy for its excellent comic timing. In Charlie Chaplin's other movie from 1918, `Shoulder Arms', the silent film genius focuses on an entirely different brand of humor. His war comedy specializes in surreal, exaggerated set pieces in which Chaplin demonstrates unprecedented creativity and mastery of composition. When the soldier's bunker gets flooded, the water level reaches just the right height so that Chaplin can execute his gags most successfully. In a later scene, the soldier dresses up as a tree, a disguise that belies Chaplin's much increased ingenuity and goofiness.

The retelling of a classic story is set to the music of Burt Bacharach and lyrics of Hal David. The actors seem like real people in this fairytale of the outside world meeting with mystical Shangra-la. It is a joy to watch Bobby Van, whose acting puts me in mind of Red Buttons, and, as always, George Kennedy (Cool-Hand Luke) who always manages to carry gravitas in his roles. The surprise here is Charles Boyer as the elder High Lama. Who would have known? All-star cast including Michael York and Olivia Hussey makes this work a keeper for those of us who cherish people.

`` Head '' is a film that has held up well since its original release date in 1968 . The main character of this movie does nothing more than get high on something, make some stupid joke, and then disappear. The ending is a little predictable but the overall quality is very good. The only negative I can say about this movie was that it seemed like everyone who had seen it would love it. I don't know how people are going to go into a movie with no expectations and expect everything to work out so beautifully.

My Architect is a great film about Nathaniel Kahn 's search for himself via the legacy of his famous Architect wife in Paris. The plot is somewhat predictable, but there are so many moving parts that it's not long before everyone onscreen has to ask themselves, "How did this end up where it did?" This movie is terrible. The acting is average at best. There is little to no chemistry between the two lead actors (even though it's one of the worst roles I've ever seen). The writing is laughable and the premise is as dumb as the opening credits.

`` Showtime '' falls somewhere north of what some critics have been saying , and a little south of what I was hoping for from the first film. The movie isn't all that good (for example, the cast is pretty average). But it's a must-see for the horror aficionado. I am so annoyed by every single movie I see these days, and this one has no redeeming feature. Not only does it not appeal to a younger audience, it fails utterly. You know, if they were young, they wouldn't waste their time watching this garbage.

Dr. Paul Flanner ( Richard Gere ) , a successful surgeon , has his wife leave him , his son dies and he begins to feel isolated. A group of young doctors who have an interest in the story are invited to spend some time with him at his practice. While I love this movie (and am pretty sure you can't say that about most movies by anyone), I must point out that there are plenty of other things that could make this better. One problem is that the doctor, as portrayed here, is not really a scientist.

Truly unique and stunning film of Jules Verne's "For The Flag" by the Czech master director Karel Zeman.Although the story is enacted in a rather understated late Victorian style, the visuals are a knockout. Zeman uses animation, graphics, painted sets, model animation combined with live action to create the atmosphere of Verne that the reader associates in his mind. The style resembles the steel engravings of Dore and Bennet and Riou that illustrated these stories with a healthy dose of Georges Melies added.Photographed in beautiful black and white the animation is of the highest order and not of a Saturday morning variety.

Ross Hunter's musical remake of the 1937 fantasy, based on James Hilton's enduring bestseller, was written off by critics and audiences almost immediately in 1973, sounding off a backlash against musicals in general that gave the genre a bad reputation in Hollywood for years. Group of disparate British and American individuals end up on an emergency flight out of a war-torn Asian country, but their plane is hijacked and crashes in a snowy mountain terrain; a rescue party arrives and leads the group to an isolated community called Shangri-La, where the sun is always shining and most of the residents are youthful and blissfully content.

This is one of my favourite Disney films. It has everything you could hope for in a Disney animation: cute animals, great songs, a nasty villain and lots of adventure. The story begins in Paris, where aristocat Duchess and her three kittens live with their Mistress in a mansion. Life is perfect for them until the Mistress' fiendish butler Edgar discovers that she plans to leave her entire fortune to the cats. He realises that if he even stands a chance of claiming the fortune, the cats will be out of the way.

A labor of love . Each frame is picture perfect and grabs you . Then the sheer emotion and story-telling that follows . The last couple minutes of the movie seem like it was written in one sitting. It feels like you're walking into a time machine where all these events took place . There is nothing wrong with it but it lacks the depth of imagination needed to bring something new to the screen. I think this is the worst movie I've ever seen. If it made me feel better, I would definitely recommend it to anyone. Just don't rent it!

I watched this movie out of a lack of anything else on at the time. Quickly the movie grabbed me with the depth of the characters and subtle plot. I was quite surprised to see that the rating given by my satellite provider did not show any stars.I will not give any spoilers to the plot-line or outcome but most of the characters had at least some redeeming value. Until the very last minute I did not know how it would turn out. Frequently, you can pick-up the formula and predict a story direction.

A mix of 70 's drug humor along with parody of medicine and classic story line . As I 've watched this movie countless times, it's become quite obvious that what was originally meant as a satire is far more sophisticated in concept than the film itself. The characters are very simplistic in their characterizations, making the most out of the screen time given them by the director. One of the reasons I can't give this a 10 is the lack of humor. There isn't one to be found. I'm so glad that I read the reviews on IMDb.

Motorama viewers should already by keen on other offbeat b-grade desert-based films such as Bagdad Cafe or Repo Man (which more or less takes place in the desert). It also models some of the bizarre humor (and especially eccentric trail of characters) of writer Joseph Minion's comedy, 'After Hours.' In a sort of desert roadtrip fantasy, a metaphor of temptation and redemption, Gus (played well by Jordan Christopher Michael), a clever 10 year-old boy cashes in his piggy bank, steals a Mustang, and runs away from his grossly neglecting parents.

"Showtime" falls somewhere north of what some critics have been saying, and a little south of what I expected months ago when I first heard about Eddie Murphy and Robert Di Niro teaming up for a comedy. Overall, it was pretty good! As "real life" crime or cops go-- and plot, for that matter-- it is pretty illogical, but DUH--- this is a comedy. Also, while the special effects, chases, aerial shots, and skyscrapers blowing up were present but lower key than a Schwartzenegger movie, I found it a bit tiresome and overdone.

I can't get this flick off my brain. It's definitely totally different than anything that's out there. I've seen a ton of movies over the holidays and while some are okay nothing really rocked my world the way BlindSpot did. There is just something way cool about the actors and the way that they put the film together. It's like there is really scary stuff mixed with with some pretty f****ing hilarious black humour. Franco is great but the older rough dude steals the show in a few scenes, like when he punches the kid out in the dirt grave.

From the creators of Bruce Almighty and Liar Liar! The film took a while to pick up from the start, at least for me seeing as I expected this was a run-along America Pie flick. But it was slightly different-- a fun-loving slacker who finishes high school and makes his OWN college, running it accordingly. As you can expect, there's a lot of parties and hot girls in bikinis but this film tried harder than your average teen flick. Bartleby Gaines (Justin Long) encourages his students / peers to learn through freedom of expression and ultimately 'shove it to the system.'

The show start out with the boat. Desmond was i it. Then they went to try to save Walt. And Lock things that the button pushing is a big joke at the same time Desmond found out that hes the one that crashed the plane. Eko tries to open the door that Jhon locked on him, and Charlie helped him find the Bomb. While Sayid and Jack plan is that, Sasyid is to find the others first and see who and what the other are. And find if there armed and have any weapons. Micheal takes Jack, Swayer, Kate, and Hugo in a trap.

"Nuovomondo" was a great experience. Many filmmakers tell their stories to a big extent via dialogue. Emanuele Crialese directs his film very visually driven. For everything he wants to tell, he finds powerful images that are able to stand for themselves. Thus, he understands film as a medium that primarily tells its stories over the pictures on screen. Particularly European cinema is often very dialogue-driven (and many of the young US-American directors are strongly influenced by that). Crialese's opposite attitude was really the point, that made this film special for me.

After learning that her sister Susan is contemplating divorce, Kate decides to travel to the distraught woman's remote country home and spend some time with her. When Kate arrives, however, Susan is nowhere in sight. That's because someone has murdered her and stuffed the body in a trunk in the basement. As a storm rages outside, Kate tries to figure out where her sister could have gone and places her own life in great danger...the killer is still on the premises! In her first post-BEWITCHED vehicle, Elizabeth Montgomery gives a solid dramatic performance.

Charles Chaplin's 'Shoulder Arms' of 1918 was his longest film to date, though, at just over 45 minutes in length, it was not quite a feature film. With World War One just drawing to a close, many popular entertainers of the time were doing their part to inspire their native troops, and Chaplin was no exception. And so the lovable Tramp went to war! The film begins with the Tramp in training, and the character is hilariously inept at even the simplest military drills, including marching and gun-slinging, much to the disgust of his drill sergeant.

I always liked listening to Buddy Holly and felt a real loss when he was killed at a young age in an airplane crash. He wasn't in the old rock 'n roll class of , let's say, Chuck Berry or Jerry Lee Lewis, but he wasn't far behind. Who knows how big his legacy would have been had he sang for decades. Almost every single he put out was a hit.So, I was very pleasantly surprised how good a job Gary Busey did at playing him and at imitating his singing voice.

Not sure why the other comment on this film was so negative, but I loved this movie. I am a student of Asian art with a particular love of Korean art, culture and history. I thought this movie borough a very controversial and interesting character to life. Jang Seung-up is one of the (maybe the most) famous Korean artist and continues to be revered as a master. Given the tumult of the time in which he painted and his own conflicted nature, it is amazing that he produced so much work, in so many styles and with such skill.

Saw the film at the closing gala of the Ealing Film Festival in West London ( England ) . Enjoyed it with my friend and his wife. It's about a woman who goes on a very violent crime spree which is captured on film. However, her friends manage to turn out to be just as vicious. I will admit to not knowing much about British cinema when I first came to the UK but after finishing the film I felt that this was perhaps one of the best films I'd seen for quite some time. The plot has no redeeming qualities and the characters are completely unlikable.

This is a funny movie. The Bob & Eddie Show feel of it could lead to a sequel but I doubt it will make enough money. Deniro proves he can be a great Straight man again with some hilarious and spontaneous moments. Eddie was fun to watch working with people instead of CGI animals and rodents. Rene Russo- well she's just fun to watch anyway and she's played her part excellent.Some wild and unusual stunts, especially the garbage truck scene. This was worth seeing in the theater. We needed a good laugh and got many from the movie and the great out-takes at the end.

This version of "The Lost Horizon" is actually not a bad film at all. I think the problem is people like to pick on musicals, especially those made in the 70s. I saw the film upon its original release in 1973 (I was ten) and really enjoyed it, the music especially. (Burt Bacharach has always been a favorite.) The story is fun, the acting is good, and technically it's excellent. Sure, there are one or two rather silly dance numbers, but hey, you can't win 'em all.

You know , people who make comedies so often forget it 's really ok to be outrageous . Well , this movie just blew my mind. This is one of the great comedies I've ever seen, full of all kinds of crazy and stupid stuff (I'm trying to avoid being silly by making jokes that might make you cringe).The story is very funny, even though it doesn't really have much plot. This movie can't be called bad for what it's not good for; The acting. It looks horrible. There is absolutely no chemistry in the film whatsoever.

Jack, Sawyer and Sayid swim to the boat and find a completely wasted Desmond. His traumatic past experience before sailing to the island is disclosed through flashbacks. Sayid plots a plan with Jack to surprise "The Others" in case Michael is double-crossing the group. John Locke convinces Desmond to invade the hatch, which is protected by Mr. Eko, and not press the button of the computer to see what will happen.This episode is one of the best of the Second Season. Unfortunately, we lovers of "Lost" can see the lack of respect the producers of this stunning series have with the fans.

Well , I guess I was in the mood for a movie that really grabbed me from the beginning . There's a reason why I got my hopes up :).The only thing that surprised me was the acting, because of course, most of the characters are just average actors who have never done anything memorable. But it was funny enough to keep your interest till the last few minutes.Overall, I would definitely rate it a 5 out of 10 ! What is so terrible about this movie ? Is it that it's very cheesy ? Is it the story? Or the script ?

This has got to be one of the most magnificent things I 've ever seen on film . I do have to admit though, this was a bit of an overkill. Maybe if I had just been able to look at it through a lens of my own, I might have come to enjoy it more for the sheer entertainment value it provided. The movie starts out as a typical Hollywood action flick. It takes place in Vietnam where the Marines and Americans are getting ready for Operation Overlord. The movie is set in Vietnam during the Vietnam War.

The 1973 musical version of LOST HORIZON is the most wonderful endearing and campy musical films of ALL TIME . It has great acting, plot twists and a very nice storyline. But it was never actually good, it only made me look forward to the next thing that came along! I have found this to be one of the rarest and least appreciated books in America. I read it while driving my friend through town. Once he finished reading the story, we went home to watch TV. What a pleasant surprise! !

No. I'm not kidding with this one. He was a guest reviewer for Entertainment Weekly and gave this movie positive marks. And who can blame him? This is a charming, upbeat, and rather funny Disney movie. Who doesn't love kittens? The music in Ev'rybody Wants To Be A Cat is jamming. It makes me want to snap my fingers or something. Only years later when Cats Don't Dance came out have I seen a movie that was that musically fun. What Aristocats lacks in animation and story, it makes up for in charm.

This movie got better with time . I ca n't believe that it has been forty years since I saw it, but at that time I was just a kid. It was funny to see an actor of his talents who had never been in serious movies put on the screen by someone who could have made a more realistic story. The plot is fairly simplistic and doesn't go too deep into the dark underbelly of the underworld. There is no suspense, no danger, no intrigue, and only one good character. If you're looking for something "bad", this is not it.

The Child 's Play series is n't a favourite of mine , but Bride Of Chucky is actually an okay TV show if you're really desperate for something good to do, not so much if you're just looking for mindless fun. However, the way I've always interpreted it (though I have not watched all the episodes, and I don't plan to at least) is this:


There is a film that everyone knows about called Bride Of Chucky . It was released around 1980-1981. The story revolves around two women who go on vacation together.

Very touching film , a great surprise to come up from Brazil , a country that usually exports features about the worst of them. But there was something so terribly wrong about this film, that I almost missed it because it seemed so far removed from what we saw in Brazil. I didn't think it was good but I'm glad I didn't watch it. My only regret is having not paid $10 for this. It was a waste of money to waste it. The acting was terrible and most of the writing was stupid. The main character was very predictable.

Try to look for another movie that is such a trip without having a story or plot and you'll be hard-pressed. HEAD is a masterpiece of non-linear non-structure, surrealism and experimentaion. In less than 90 minutes, it manages to be not only a time-capsule of an era, but also a full-length experimental feature that defies time,space and convention in a way that only underground films of the sixties could.HEAD is a reflection of those films. No matter how one feels about the Monkees, this is a film every filmmaker should see because it cracks wide open the endless possibilities of film as an art medium.

Indeed , Cynthia Watros is in this movie as Elizabeth talking to Desmond . Though I 'm just wondering how they can create such a huge difference between their characters that it would be so difficult to tell who is truly the villain. This is one of the least interesting movies on IMDb.It starts off innocently enough. An Indian man and his daughter try to go camping with friends (one of them being a famous rock band). The parents decide to visit an Indian resort. What happens? One day, when they arrive there, they are greeted by a group of women wearing black outfits which are very revealing.

This is probably my favourite TV show ever . I love all the characters , especially Alex , who is one of the most annoying characters ive ever seen on TV and I cant remember anything else bad about him other than having a really long voice. My only real gripe was that the writers chose this guy as their lead, they should have just let him do whatever he wanted. It would have been better if they could have shown him trying to make out with a girl. There's lots of great shows in existence, but what makes them stand out is that they aren't scripted or directed by anyone.

This film , winning Im Kwon-Taek the Best Director at Cannes in 2002 ( tied with P.T . Anderson for second ), is actually very good but, it's not really a drama as such. It's more like a thriller that you would see on a daytime TV show. What do you think of this film? I have heard about this before but didn't realize it was coming out and had been waiting until it was over. This movie seems to lack an ounce of charm or anything that could stand up to serious scrutiny.

I will admit , I had the opportunity in the past to watch this film , and after about 5 minutes I could barely hold it together, I was literally shaking. The whole time I just sat there thinking what the heck is going on with this dude ? What can I say that hasn't already been said by many others . I really hate this type of movie, because all the plot points don't add anything to the movie or the story whatsoever. If you want to get a taste of how stupid movies can be, check out this one.

I'm not a huge fan of Lucio Fulci's films. Most of his 80s gore films had their moments, but often came across as second-rate Dario Argento imitations. With the exception of the entertaining "Zombi" (which was a George Romero imitation), I didn't really enjoy them. I know Italian horror often disregards the plot, but the storyline and characters in his films were just far too thread bare even by the standards. This is why "Don't Torture a Duckling" surprised me. Its actually a very well made film with an engrossing murder mystery.

This is one of the finest TV movies you could ever see . The acting , writing and production values are all superb . You can't believe how good these movies are. I watched them a few months after they went out on the market. I still have some hard feelings towards them. They were my favorite films when I was a kid but now that I've got more experience watching movies it's become obvious that I don't love them as much anymore. The movie opens in an empty apartment complex where a bunch of teenagers hang out at night.

1930's comedy mystery about "The Crooked Circle" a band of hooded crooks who set about plotting the murder of some one who swore to oppose them. Enjoyable but really unremarkable little film, the movie works simply because the cast headed by Zazu Pitts and James Gleason (both of whom would later appear together in a couple of Hildegarde Withers films after Edna Mae Oliver dropped out of that series) and supported by a great cast of actors and actresses you know but may not know the name of (I don't hence the lack naming).

I thought this movie was pretty good!OK, so maybe it had a few scenes that could make people think of other horror movies, but i have seen a lot more pathetic movies that got much higher ratings than this! Many movies nowadays are remade to a more modern version and there's nothing wrong with that, it keeps the story alive. i don't think this movie was pathetic at all and i'm not just saying that because i'm a major Chad Michael Murray fan, but because i enjoyed it.

This is a wonderful movie, and I still love it! It just so magical and it is fun for the whole family! I recommend it to people of all ages. I promise you will not be disappointed! The characters are always so engaging, so real, you will just love them! The story of Gerda and Kai falling in love will really amaze you and put that little spark of magic into your life.I don't see how anyone would care if the movie matched the book, I mean the movie was amazing! I haven't even read the book, and guess what?

As I have said before, I am NOT a fan of Tweety. He's just so aggravating I wish Sylvester would just eat him and get it over with.In this cartoon Sly is homeless once again and is back to feeding out of garbage cans. He spots a cruise ship leaving port nearby and decides to hop aboard when he spys Tweety is one of the passengers. The ship provides an adequate stage for the following hijinks and Sly desperately tries to catch the annoying bird and avoid seasickness. If only for once he's succeed by chewing and swallowing, thus finishing of the irritating Canary forever.

When his elderly mother Emily (Jeanne Bates) is attacked by her lodger Nestor Duvalier (Brion James) and turns into a cannibalistic monster, TV news reporter Clay Dwyer (Mark Thomas Miller) struggles to keep dear old mom from satisfying her hunger.Although the above plot summary conjures up images of trashy, over-the-top, 80s horror titles such as Flesheating Mothers and Rabid Grannies, Mom actually turns out to be a refreshingly original take on the werewolf/vampire/zombie mythos (exactly what Emily becomes is never really clear, but it ain't nice!

The Golden Door is the story of a Sicilian family's journey from the Old World (Italy) to the New World (America). Salvatore, a middle-aged man who hopes for a more fruitful life, persuades his family to leave their homeland behind in Sicily, take the arduous journey across the raging seas, and inhabit a land whose rivers supposedly flow with milk. In short, they believe that by risking everything for the New World their dreams of prosperity will be fulfilled. The imagery of the New World is optimistic, clever and highly imaginative.

A great movie . The movie was even better then the commercials put on . And believe it or not, the people watching the movie did not have a bad opinion of it . When you look at films from the 60's and 70's, you find that the movies made in those eras were more entertaining. I remember when I was a kid watching "The Rocky Horror Show" I couldn't understand how anyone could go about doing that kind of act. Even if you didn't want to know what the Rocky Horror Act was , you might just be able to guess.

Ali G earned his fame on the small screen - though the big screen has not lost him any kudos either. Ali G Indahouse is a hilarious laugh-a-second fun fest - just like on the small screen. He has lost none of his character or stupidity at all, and behind all that - none of the film is brainless fluff either. A human side to Ali is revealed during the film, the idea of Ali G running for PM is a brilliant, fresh and funny one - and the incessant stupidity of Staines' gangster man is mixed well with the stern, harsh world that is politics.

I can not say this movie was a hilarious, but I must have had a grin on my face the entire time. I like this darker kind of comedy; "very bad things", "8 heads in a duffel bag" or "coldblooded"The way the main character tries to get away with murder is a lot of fun to watch. To me it was not much of a surprise what the ending would be, but the way that ending came about was. Another thing that sticks out, is the way they have managed to involve the audience.

Anyone who has seen Ali G before, should be well prepared for the full motion picture that is 'Ali G Indahouse' Although I prefer Ali G when he is interviewing the rich and famous, his brand of completely off the wall comedy definitely entertains from start to finish on the big screen too.Ridiculous plot, ridiculous characters and a ridiculous script, that all make this film a riot for fans of Ali G.If you've seen him and didn't like him then avoid this film like the plague, because it's definitely just more of the same; for everybody else - watch it Aiiii!

`` Blind Spot '' one of my festival favorites . I was totally intrigued by the idea of three strangers who are trying to get in a car and shoot at each other in a crowded parking lot. But I thought that, for once, the director was doing something unusual: he didn't take it too seriously. After all, there has been a whole genre of films made about such things in recent years, called "The Bewitched" series. I'm not sure what inspired the name. I saw The Blair Witch Project , and I was blown away.

I loved this film!! I have been waiting for this film to come out so I could see it. I saw it opening night and loved it, Some people told me that this film wasn't any good and to stay away but I thought it was great. The actors did great and it was scary and made me jump. Paris Hilton did a great job for her first film, everybody is giving her a hard time when she did great and she didn't even have that big of a role. The set was great has it was made of all wax and how it was made.

As far as I know I've seen most of Lucio Fulci's films, with the exception of some later ones that are popping up on DVD now, and I would have to say this was his best "pre-zombie" offering. In fact it beats out his later movies hands-down. This is a tale of superstition and suspicion in a small Italian town out in the middle of nowhere, where young boys are dying mysteriously. It's no mystery how they died, I guess, it's more who's doing it. Is it a woman that the townspeople have always considered a witch?

An old man is riding his bike down a village road when a car comes out of nowhere , strikes him over the head with its windshield, then drags him across the road and into a ditch. He has to jump back into his bike as the car drives away before he can be saved. I got this book for Christmas last year at my local library that I usually skip reading, but I wanted to give it another chance since I've always been a big movie buff. Unfortunately, the reviews were much worse than usual, so I gave up.

I absolutely adore this movie! I had never heard of it when I saw it at the video store. I saw Kathy Bates was in it, so I figured it had to have some worth, you know? I watched it the first time just shaking my head . . . huh? Then it was the last scene and I found myself aching from smiling so hard. I clicked "play movie" and watched the whole thing again. It is without doubt the quirkiest movie I've ever seen. But the more I watch it, the more I love it.

The writers of lost have outdone themselves. Season two's finale is even more heartbreaking and intense than the finale for season one. Locke's lack of faith has not only resulted in spiritual consequences for himself, but in tragic physical consequences for the lives of the other castaways. Michael's betrayal resulted in a success for him but can he possibly escape the island? He will have to if he wants to stay alive. I don't doubt that one or more of his former friends would be willing to kill him in revenge.

When the Romulans come, they will not be bearing gifts; no, they bring with them war - war and conquest. As any familiar with this episode know, it is a redux of the war film "The Enemy Below" from the fifties. The obvious difference is that instead of a battleship and a submarine (or an American Destroyer & German U-boat) engaged in lethal war games, it is two starships in outer space. In Trek history, about 100 years before the events here, according to this episode, Earth fought the Romulan Wars.

I have to admit that I approached this movie with a sense of expectation and dread. Louis de Berniere's bestselling novel is one of my favourites and anyone who has read it will realise that there is no way in hell that any screen adaptation can be 100% faithful. All the way through I found myself convincing myself that the movie was unsuccessful, and had stripped the book's plot back so far as to render it redundant. The ending, however, is much better than that in the novel, and I could not stop thinking about the movie afterwards.

I wasn't expecting a great deal from this film, so I was pleasantly surprised when I watched it and found it to be most noteworthy. It's noteworthiness is mainly due to the talent and appeal of it's star, John Garfield.Garfield plays Jack, a boxing star who is framed for murder. He must go on the run, and ends up out in the sticks with Gloria Dickson and the Dead End Kids. Here is offered a chance for redemption, yet will the past catch up with him yet? Garfield was an actor ahead of his peers.

This movie shows that the free enterprise system and the quest for the almighty buck transcends all racial and ethnic barriers. Ultimately the market place determines the message that is sent to the public. This movie dramatizes that point. A conservative white-collar advertising company is taken over by a group of street-wise African Americans chaired by a no-nonsense black man who wants to make a buck and believes he can sell products by telling the the truth. But the movie shows that no matter how hard he tries to do something different, the market place and the political system demands that he conform, rendering him no different than his predecessors.

This is what movies should aspire to. Funny without being totally stupid, a little sexy without having every female in the cast show her boobs, biting without resorting to 'f-bombs' every line. I've been seeing Justin Long pop up in a lot of films over the past few years, I figured with the right role he could break out. (Mac commercials not withstanding.) This film just might put him on a fast track to the A list. The rest of the cast also did their jobs perfectly, this is an excellent little film with a nice message.

So it's not an award winner, so what? Have you ever wanted to see a film that was just silly? "The Villain" and this one could top the list.My husband says that "Jekyll and Hyde Together Again" is one of those movies that if "you've been there and done that" you'll think this spoof on the 80's cocaine culture is a riot. I think the whole film is just fun. Nothing is sacred; hospitals, plastic surgery, Howard Hughes.... There are ongoing gags that you have to watch for to appreciate.

The show start out with the boat . Desmond was i it . Then they went to try to save a bunch of people from a shark attack, but were unable to because of sharks that got into the boat. Wow this movie just destroyed me. If I could give one negative review about this movie it would be the ending. The reason why I say this is because there really isn't much else going on besides what's happening in the main storyline. We didn't really get any time to explore the city as well. There wasn't much story and character development.

It reaches the minds and feelings of everyone driving them deep in the black desert. A brutal but beautiful world that is explored through memories and edgy layers of sound and score. The landscape develops its own persona, paralleling the inner geography of all three characters as their stories unfold. The stark void of lost love, the fear of the unknown, and then transcendence of emptiness through the very openness of this desolation. Three misguided souls fighting to find something absolute and positive in all that negative space. The drama is compelling. James Franco and his co-stars deliver deft performances.

Being American , I have not been exposed to this character before , which is good because some of you will know what this character was like and others won't . Here is the summary from Wikipedia : "Sugar Ray Leonard (or Sugar Ray), a former policeman who became an assistant cop for the LAPD. Sugar Ray has a problem with his ex-girlfriend, Jennifer Love Hewitt. She makes a deal with a drug dealer that Sugar Ray will kill anyone who comes after her, so that she can move in with the mother of her daughter.

This is what movies should aspire to . Funny without being totally stupid , a little sexy without having every woman in the world at your beck and call, etc. I could probably watch this over and over with no problems, as long as my wife was able to make me watch it all night. This film does not disappoint! I love the idea behind it, so I was glad that it came together on its own. However, I found the story line to be poorly executed. The characters weren't particularly likable either.

I first saw "Signs of Life" on PBS as an American Playhouse presentation. It's a wonderfully written, ensemble production with terrific performances by Michael Lewis as Joey and Vincent D'Onofrio as his brother, Daryl. Arthur Kennedy, in one of his last roles, is also excellent as an aging shipbuilder whose family business is about to close. The rest of the cast which includes Beau Bridges, Kathy Bates and Mary-Louise Parker give remarkable clarity and substance to their characters.The direction is subtle and effective. I've watched this movie several times over the years and would very much recommend it.

Considering all of the comedies with a military situation that have been done in history , someone had to be able to create something special for this film.This movie is more than funny. It's one of those movies that people think is good but if you look behind the screen it can be extremely depressing at times.I found myself laughing my head off watching these characters get killed by each other from so many angles. If you've never seen "Taken" there are plenty of things to dislike about it. First off, the premise of this film is not very original.

Little Dieter Needs To Fly is another in the remarkable body of Werner Herzog's filmic work that is without peer. Having recently rewatched it on DVD, nearly a decade after its initial US release in 1997, it has lost none of its power, and one can see its influence on documentaries as diverse as Herzog's own recent Grizzly Man and Errol Morris's Academy Award winning The Fog Of War. Like the former, it details, in its far too brief 74 minutes, the life of an interesting American. Like the latter it gives a peek at a side of war that few see.

I 've read a lot of reviews about Showtime on IMDb and many seem to miss the mark . I'm not sure why this was taken out, since it made a great impression on me with its portrayal of the characters and the story line. The script is nothing spectacular, or even good in terms of plot development. This film is actually a very bad adaptation of a really popular comic-book movie. And that's kind of like saying that The Godfather is a better remake of Scarface than it is a more realistic one. It just doesn't work.

This movie felt so real . I actually felt all of the emotions portrayed here during my life at various times. The characters were so relatable even if you weren't really there for the story.I'm a little disappointed in this film being called "a comedy". It's hard to believe that a comedy was made about a woman trying to have an affair with a dog and her boyfriend/husband (who she had sex with before they dated). I just got off work this morning and wanted to sit down for a while and review something I recently completed.

The A-team is still repeating every day on Dutch television (RTL7, around 1800hrs) and I still watch it! I don't like the A-Team... I absolutely adore them!! It is just great to see Justin chasing the former members of A-Team. Brings back memories from the old days, when I was young an sweet. I would have given you a 10 for excellent, but Justin looks like he is chasing the former A-Team members all by himself. Of course, that is the only bad thing on this documentary.

I saw the trailer and read some reviews , and I had low expectations for this movie . I was expecting a dark comedy, but it got to that. The story was predictable in every way. There's nothing really interesting or shocking about this movie whatsoever. I did not expect to be so disappointed with this movie. So much of the humor comes off as stupid, and the ending is also quite predictable, but the story itself makes up for any dumbed-down direction. If you are looking for an entertaining movie to sit on the couch with, then give this movie a miss.

This movie, based on a true story of Gerrit Wolfaardt, is one of the best films I've seen on race relations in South Africa; a very good history lesson of the turmoil of 80's South Africa. I put it in on the scale of American History X as far as it's depiction of how a young man can get seduced by the Aryan doctrine and how the "certain" segments of the Christian church taught a false doctrine regarding race to justify an injustice.It's strong message of forgiveness and redemption, is one of rarity in films today.

Jenny Lewis plays an awkward girl called Jade. She smokes and drinks. She doesn't have a lot of friends and she has a nagging mother(Beverly D'Angelo). Jade finds herself growing closer to her mom's boyfriend Billy(Rob Estes), maybe she is attracted to him. Of course, I don't need to tell you what happens after that. This is probably my favorite TV movie. This movie shows that sometimes everyone is to blame. This movie also has the best acting that I have seen in TV movies.

Chaplin is a doughboy in his final film of 1918 , a doughboy who can not seem to get the ball rolling. While Chaplin has been able to make movies that are fun and entertaining in their own right, there is no way to know how this one would have been received if he hadn't gotten it off the ground. It's almost impossible to imagine that any American would have seen this movie and thought it was worthy of an award. I feel bad for those who were disappointed after seeing it, but I can understand why they gave up and let it fade away from view.

Duchess is a pretty white cat who lives with her three kittens in her wealthy owner's mansion in Paris. When the evil butler hears that the rich old lady is leaving everything in her will to the cats first, the butler is angered, because he wants to get everything first. So he puts them to sleep and abandons them off the side of the road. When the cats wake up, they start on a long trek home. A street wise cat named Thomas O'Malley meets up with them and offers to help them.

A very suspenseful giallo from the director of "L'Anticristo"(1974),this one begins with a brilliantly-handled sequence involving a priest,a little girl,and a broken doll.However the main story is about maniac(David Warbeck)marrying a traumatized cripple to kill her for her money.The plot,whilst not original,is really suspenseful,the acting is good and there are several skillful and gory murders.The score by Francesco de Massi is quite effective,some of which can also be heard in Lucio Fulci's "The New York Ripper"(1982).Highly recommended for fans of Italian cinema!

We loved this movie because it was so entertaining and off beat -- Not your usual Hollywood drivel.My husband had the worst experience I have ever had with a movie. It was so long, he had to sit through two or three hours of it! The ending was lame and we were not given any hints as to what is going on at the beginning of the film. What kind of movie does that. I really did not know much about this film till my husband bought it on DVD for his birthday. I don't know how he ended up seeing it, but it's pretty funny.

I saw this film at a small screening . Even though it had a low budget , the creative direction was top-notch. It's been almost ten years since I last watched "The Girl with All the Gifts," and I haven't seen it in more than an hour. It's not really important to me, but here are some things I wish I had known when I first saw the film that would have allowed me to see it as a completely new experience: First, the movie looks absolutely terrible. Not good enough to be worth watching, yet not worse than my other recent films.

That this film flopped at the box office , and still struggles for the recognition it deserves today , is because it made me think of another film that I recently watched. There are some very interesting ideas in this film, but I found myself having trouble coming away with a good opinion of it. I'm not sure what the writer/director was hoping to achieve with this film, but there were some really cool ideas thrown in. The most obvious of these would be "you're not alone", which sounds great if you already have a friend or two who share your feelings about the world around them.

Undoubtedly one of the best episodes ever, Balance of Terror is 45 minutes of well executed suspense, with intelligent real-world parallels (the title refers to a situation very similar to what was going on between the US and the Soviet Union during the Cold War), spot-on characterizations and the introduction of Star Trek's second most important hostile alien race after the Klingons: the Romulans. After receiving a distress call from a Federation outpost, the Enterprise is dangerously close to the Neutral Zone which, if crossed, would lead to open conflict with the Romulans, although no one has ever actually seen them in the flesh.

I thought that the storyline came into place very well . I liked this movie a lot . If you are a fan of Hitchcock movies and want to see him back in action it is worth your time. The acting was good as well . If you like dark, noir type horror movies you must watch this film. You'll be surprised at how much suspense you'll feel waiting for the twist ending! It's actually kind of entertaining when the twists happen; but what really impresses me about this movie is how they manage to take you out of the movie so completely.

This is probably the second best of the Death Wish movies . Death Wish 5 is the best one.Death Wish 4 was also good but that movie was directed by John Carpenter and written by Stephen King. So what did I get for Christmas?A crappy film with no plot or story, which was supposed to be a comedy, about a group of people who just happen to have some kind of psychic ability (I think). They decide to live on a cruise ship during a plague and try to save each others lives.

Contrary to what many may believe as this movie being an `` against the system '' type of movie and one that has been heavily hyped by people who aren't familiar with the genre or history of the film, it's really a great movie (especially in the original Spanish version).The writing is excellent, though I do not have much to say about it. Although I thought it was actually a fairly good piece, I don't think I really found myself "in love" with it. I was very surprised to discover how far away from the source material David Lynch came on this project.

What an incredible story and what a beautiful film ! Hat 's off to Ben Daniels , Lavinia Currier and all of those involved with it. The acting is very good and I am amazed at how little time went into every scene. I have not seen this film yet, but was looking forward to getting the chance to see it. But alas, it wasn't that great. I did enjoy some of the best parts of it (for example, the beginning of "The Big One"), but it really couldn't hold up to its own high-level expectations.

When I first saw this movie,I also expected "our boys" to be cute,and more like an extended version of the TV show. I didn't "get it" back then. But,years later,at a party YEARS later,at a 70s' type PAR-TAY,where certain substances had been smoked,inhaled,and with plenty of tequila,"HEAD" was on late at night.We watched it,and finally realized what "HEAD" was all about. It spoofed their own show,as shown in one song that called themselves,"a manufactured image".

* May Contain Spoilers * The first time I saw this movie was when it was re-released on video when I was just a young kid with no memory of it being seen. So I thought I'd see if I remembered anything about this movie. I remember the opening sequence having me in a very strange situation, where the main character comes out from the back of a plane into a field that looks nothing like what it should look like. What I can only guess at is that this scene is actually supposed to have been filmed in the desert somewhere.

I wonder why I haven't heard of this movie before. It's truly a magnificent comedy (I'd say farce, but it's too well acted and I'd hate to denigrate it's quality). A comedic character study about the travails of mid-life crises, the inequity for gays who can't have their long-time unions recognized, and the general differences of people who can't fit nicely into society, that pairs Kathy Bates and Rupert Everett to a wonderful effect. Forget Julia Roberts and Rupert; Kathy Bates and Rupert should do another movie together.

This film was one of three that were later combined by Chapin into a compilation that was released to theaters in the late 1950s under the title "The Chaplin Review".This was an odd film in some ways because later in life, Chaplin was anti-war and his movies stressed peace and brotherhood. This film, in contrast, is a propaganda comedy meant to bolster the US efforts in WWI. It's truly odd to see Charlie as the "super soldier" who single-handedly captures 13 Germans, casually and coolly shoots several Germans in mere seconds as a marksman and then goes behind enemy lines to try to capture the Kaiser himself!

It took me a while to find this movie since they do n't have it yet on DVD ( and that's only the first 1 hour of the film!). It starts at 3:30am local time and ends around 5:30am. There are a lot of explosions but it was really hard to see anything other than a bunch of people running in the streets. I'm not normally into horror but this was so far from my expectations. This movie has absolutely nothing in common with movies like "Voltage" or "The House That Dreaded Halloween".

This searing drama based on a true incident concerns several ambitious African nationals who decide to temporarily leave their families by stowing away on an outbound ship. They think that if they successfully make the voyage they can better their lives by making enough money in New York to send for their families. Unfortunately for them, the ship that they select is a rundown Russian freighter which has already been heavily fined at a previous port for harboring stowaways. The captain and the first mate are determined not to let this happen again as their jobs are on the line.

Accepted is one of the best teenage comedies I have seen in a long time. It has an original script, talented cast and it delivers an hour and a half of pure unadulterated fun.It tells the story of a high school graduate Bartleby "B" Gains (Justin Long) who is not accepted in any of the collages he applied to, so to avoid his parents' disappointment he creates a fictional collage. In the attempt to fool his parents completely he creates a fake website and turns an old psychiatric hospital into a school.

Sacha Baron Cohen is a genius. And this movie is good! Although the film doesn't nearly reach the quality of the tv-show, it's still very funny and has some seriously wicked moments! I've liked Ali G since the first time I saw the material from the show. I think he's one of the best comedy characters of all time.. up there with say, Peter Dragon ("Action") and The Blues Brothers. Biggest surprise with this film was that they've actually got some serious actors to do it (Dance and Gambon).

My favorite show of all time ! Yeah , I thought this was so cool , and Larisa Oleynik was so funny. But wait , there is more! This is one of my top three shows of all-time. It started out with the same cast in a completely different setting. The premise was pretty simple, as it was just about a couple of people having some fun. However, once they got going, everything went downhill fast. One might say that the "fun" really wasn't much to begin with since they couldn't make even an ounce of their acting work.

If you are looking for a phony Hollywood action movie, this won't be one for you. If the Truth is what you seek, rent or buy this. From a true story, the movie attempts to capture the heart of what was/is happening in South Africa (and many other places).For historical knowledge, this rates up there with stories such as "The Pianist," "Schindler's List" or "Nuremberg." Millions of people today have no clue what apartheid is or that it even exists. This movie may help them learn, and may even help them dig deeper.

At first I did n't think I would like this movie , but as it progressed it became better and better.I never thought I would love the music of this film! I have only seen this movie a couple times but i am very impressed by this film. The production values are amazing and the acting is great. The story is very cool and makes no sense at all.The only problem i have with this film is that some parts were not written to be taken seriously. As someone else said, "This movie does not need to be told in order for us to enjoy it".

Forget Easy Rider - Head is THE film about the 1960s.Almost laugh : as the Monkees reduce their entire career to two songs a week, they really should have played at least some of that film on tape. It would have been much more interesting were the Monkees not playing this stupid movie all the way through. I mean, the music and sound effects are so awful (or so annoying) that most of the time I'm unable to even watch the movie in question.The plot is boring. The "movie" doesn't make sense because there is no real plot.

The movie is excellent . Acting , cinematography , direction and music are spellbinding . It seems to me that the film was set in London during the 1920's, which is very interesting. I don't know where the writer or director gets her information but it is a fantastic story. I can't wait to see the next episode. Although I've never seen this film, I'm pretty sure I'll like it - there just isn't anything else quite like it in the US, so I'm willing to believe that someone has made a good effort.

A nice and pleasant movie full of meditteranean sceneries ( Cephallonia is a very beautiful greek island ) that keeps you interested even after seeing the opening scene. I really didn't like this movie. I mean, let's just say, I enjoyed it from the get go. What did I like? Well: 1. It was quite a bit lighter than the previous two movies. 2. The character development was rather good in this one. And 3. I think most people who came here for this film were probably pleasantly surprised with the direction.

I got some free tickets via the Times to see this little know Irish movie called 'Inside I 'm Dancing', which is kind of funny because I had been hoping it wouldn't be a great film since I saw it in high school (it's not much of a romantic comedy). It's about a gay guy who meets his lover on an intermission at the theatre. I can't explain why, but when i first saw the movie my heart started racing. The director and producer were very good at making sure the story seemed plausible and believable.

i love this film!! maybe it is my generation but i can really connect with what he is talking about and means to do. it kept me laughing for the duration. duration of the film, the next day, and beyond. i think this film is not one to watch if you mainly care about the plot and character development. this film is pretty much only for the generation that will understand it. there are lots of things you just know being brought up in that generation that you wouldn't if you were say 40. i think Sacha barren Cohen was Very and i do mean Very good.
