He did one at Christmas to try and bring back a number one song, and now the terrific Justin Lee Collins wanted to reunite the cast members and maybe some crew of one of his favourite TV shows as a kid, The A-Team. The only member he wouldn't be able to get was the late great George Peppard who played main character Col. John "Hannibal" Smith, but he did get some kind of psychic to try and help. He did manage to reunite all members including Dirk Benedict (Lt. Templeton "Faceman" Peck #2) who went to Celebrity Big Brother in 2007, Dwight Schultz (Capt.

The `` all I have is 5 dollars and my wedding ring ... '' scene was a riot . I can only think of one thing that made it worth watching! This movie has been around for many years...I thought it was amazing. I watched it while in college, and loved it at its best. Unfortunately, my friend's daughter gave this film a shot, and she loved it more than I ever had. Now, about five years later, I'm just glad I didn't spend any money on it again.

This film biography of early rock and roll star Buddy Holly ( 1936-1959 ) is a tour de force for documentary filmmakers. What makes this one so amazing is the ability to create a compelling, entertaining, and in some cases, humorous story with no hard facts whatsoever. "Holly's greatest accomplishment as a filmmaker was to convince me that there is more to life than just the beauty of an apple. And if I'm not wrong about that statement, I'd like to believe that he did his research when he chose this subject matter.

This film as it is now is far shorter than it was when released in 1918 . In fact , the only other film I have seen that ever had more than 30 minutes of screen time prior to its end was an earlier MGM production titled "I Have a Dream" . This film has no redeeming value.The original script was terrible. The actors seemed to have been re-recruited to play the same roles again and again (except for Paul Reiser) with very different effects. The acting was simply atrocious, as was the script itself.

I have to offset all the terrible comments. I love this movie. I own the movie and the soundtrack. I watch it whenever I need a pick me up. Granted it's not like the Sound of Music but it's as much fun if picking at movies is not your thing. I adored the late (and great) Bobby Vann, and James Shigeta has always and will always be a favorite. I saw this when it first came out in the theaters. I'm a big musical fan and this one is 100 times better than Twiggy in "The Boyfriend".

What an incredible story and what a beautiful film! Hat's off to Ben Daniels, Lavinia Currier and the great Honore de Balzac. This captivating film conveys the passion experienced by the characters so effortlessly and yet so powerfully. I watched it mesmerized, almost holding my breath as the story developed towards its inexorable end. This film's execution was almost flawless: simple and pure, it plays with our hearts, guiding us in understanding the strange platonic, absolute thus possessive bond between two creatures not meant to be part of each other's world.

LOL.The mere fact that I start off my review with 'lol ' says it all . I used to watch this crap in college and now I can't sleep at night knowing what the fuck is wrong with you guys.I just got home from work recently and I have a copy of this DVD on my drive so I decided to see what could possibly go wrong. I saw this movie a couple of weeks ago and was immediately intrigued as to if it might be good, but I found myself completely unable to grasp the message at the end.

Garlin outdoes himself as writer-director-actor in his indie production about a big guy ( Garlin ) wandering around Chicago with the intention of finding his next girlfriend . I can't believe I haven't seen this movie since it came out just a couple of weeks ago! It's not bad, but when I first saw it I expected to have an awful time getting into it. However, after watching the trailer and thinking it over I'm glad I went ahead and did so.The main thing you notice about this movie is the fact that Garlin's characters are all extremely stereotyped.

Oh my word!! I have never seen a film so lacking in any kind of moral judgement or consideration for anything other than the death of the scum! Michael Winner here makes a valid observation of human desires in displaying a gung-ho troth world of deep and damaged execution. Not only does he spoon feed us with utter hell on earth seen through the face of the moustached Bronson, but he also shows us the spoon he's feeding us with and says "look at what your watching now look at your self and ask the question: Are you enjoying this?"

I did not know what to expect when I decided to watch this documentary . I knew it was about a story of a boy and his mother. My initial thought was that there was nothing about it that would appeal to me. The film starts off with a very cute young boy's father going out to a party. This movie is pretty bad. Not because it's bad, but because it's an extremely boring movie. Every scene looks like you're looking at photos on the Internet for the first time. It never gets any suspense from anything it says.

This is one of those movies where I just want to move my feet and dance around the house. It's a very positive and happy type of music. The movie has some sad parts but mostly the music is what makes me happy. Gary Busey did a great job as Buddy Holly. Buddy Holly kept on going even tho his pastor, his parents and the Nashville record producer told him no. Buddy Holly didn't give up on what he liked. I didn't know much about Buddy Holly until I watched this movie.

I remember years ago BBC1 used to show this movie in a very cut form . I tracked it down on the internet and it does indeed have some of the plot points that we've seen. The characters are great, you just wish they were more in character.The acting is bad. It's not all bad though, as with the actors who play the main characters, their performances are above-average.This movie is actually good. Not because it was well written, nor because it was fun to watch. It would have been a hit had it been made into a movie!

This is a brilliant film. The story starts off in Romania,where Billy Crystal stars as an agent who can talk anybody into doing anything. There is a really funny scene here, where Crystal is a child, and talks his father, who is a rabbi into eating pork (you filmophiles may know that this is a parody of Crystal's religion). He is mainly a talent scout, and he's trying to find a suitable villain for his latest movie. After finding out that the whole film has a terrible crew, he accidently falls into a small river.

Being a middle aged mom myself , I very much appreciated seeing a romance between grown-up people that weaves in and out of everyday scenes as it is. Unfortunately, the storyline did not provide enough plot to keep me reading for more than a few minutes at a time (which could have been avoided if the script had given any hint as to exactly what the plot would be in the movie, rather than making it difficult for me to follow). If you're new to The Walking Dead series, then I recommend watching this.

NOBODY ( 1999 ) is a fantastic piece of Japanese noir . It 's about three salarymen who get in over their heads and decide to murder each other's wives. This is an extremely odd story, but I'm not sure why the filmmakers decided to write it.The only reason I didn't go in expecting this was because you never know when you're going to find a good bit of violence and suspense. A movie that doesn't try hard to make anything interesting at times.It's a typical low budget, low production value film where the actors have no control over how they look or move.

"D.O.A" is an involving and entertaining little picture from start to finish. Dennis Quaid is at his caustic best; and Quaid is sadly one of the most underused talents in Hollywood. His then beau Meg Ryan also appears with him, but as is usually the case, doesn't really make much of an impact. The film is stylishly directed throughout, drawing on a number of influences to capture its 'seamy' feel. Would you credit that it's actually directed by two people? The answer is no. The whole thing is superbly slick, from its innovative camerawork to its unabashed use of black and white photography.

Just exactly HOW director John Madden come to settle with Nicolas Cage and Penelope Cruz playing the roles of an ex-girlfriend who finds herself in a world that's as dangerous as it is lonely. And I mean REALLY dangerous. What can you tell me about what went down when they came up with this idea? Is it just some sort of ridiculous plot line or have they gone back to the drawing board? This movie was supposed to be a remake of the film "In the Dark" but they couldn't find a way to adapt that script so now we get something completely new.

It was a terrific movie! I like to watch it again and again. The actors were awesome. The movie kept me on the edge of my seat. I would recommend this movie to anyone. I wish Lifetime would put this movie on DVD. I would most definitely purchase a copy. This movie just proves that you should be very careful about who you get hooked up with. You may think you know someone, but you never know. My daughter watched the movie with me. She thought it was great. All I know is, I will watch this movie every time Lifetime airs it.

Enhanced by the expressive cinematography of Agnes Godard (Beau Travail), Golden Door is a visually striking tone poem that follows the journey of a peasant family from their primitive home in Sicily to Ellis Island in New York at the turn of the century. It is a surreal, enigmatic, often strange, but ultimately deeply rewarding experience. Interweaving dreamlike and symbolic imagery with gritty realism, the latest film by Emanuele Crialese (Respiro) is like an impressionistic painting - a cinematic artist's rendering of what the immigration process may have been like for our parents and grandparents.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji , a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the anti-imperialist movement after WWII. The story centers on his childhood and education as a boy during the 1930's, during which he studied classical poetry at Kyoto University, where he also received a degree in composition. Miyazawa was influenced by early German writers such as Johann Sebastian Bach and Robert Schumann (in the same vein as Hölderlin).In this short film, Miyazawa portrays a "normal" life for him and his friends, except for one strange event.

The movie does n't take itself seriously , and if you follow its lead you 're going to have a hard time enjoying anything else the movie makes you watch. "There is something of a theme in this film that is really difficult to understand: it isn't about one thing but two or three things, and they both seem to conflict for our attention. I can see how it could be frustrating for the viewer, given that he or she has to wait several minutes to hear what each one of them has to say, especially if they don't all sound the same.

The "all I have is 5 dollars and my wedding ring..." scene was a riot. I also guffawed at the scene in the bar where Hyde snorted the horse radish and flipped the bird to the Japanese guy and said "Pearl Harbor buddy". I think my IQ is higher than 115, but I'm not sure because I can't count that high.Funny thing, this 10 line requirement. Seems as though they would bash you for making your comments too long, not too short. I hope I don't make it to 1,000 words before I get to line 10.I'm still two lines short.

James Franco is totally cool in this movie. Not just handsome and charismatic but genuinely open and vulnerable in a sincere kind of way. At the Tristan screening some folks were on his back for being pouty and sullen and doing the whole James Dean thing but I don't think this true. Blind Spot is proof positive of his tremendous talent. In this film he carries himself with a different sort of weight entirely. It's a unique performance. Bittersweet and really moving. The lines from his journal cut you like a knife. You sense a sharp intelligence of observation behind his words.

I've been a fan of Rachael's since the beginning of 30MM on the Food Network, so I have seen her grow over the years. The minute I saw her interact with Oprah, I predicted that this show would happen, because I saw how taken Oprah is with her, and with good reason: she comes across as very natural, and willing to laugh at herself, which is very engaging. The set is appealing, and there are some fresh ideas (I love the lazy Susan that the audience sits on).

I saw this movie when it first came out in 1973 and loved it . Since then I 've searched for this movie over and over again. So today I found it. And boy did I have to hate it. First off the story is just plain crazy. I was a little upset that I missed out on one of the most popular movies of all time, so I decided to watch it again. However, I still had no idea where the heck they were getting their information from. The movie didn't contain any plot twists nor did there ever be any.

What a cast of actors and actresses in this Columbo episode, beside Peter Falk, you have Julie Newmar, Jeannette Nolan, Martin Landau as twins. Anyway, the old uncle dies mysteriously and it looks like a heart attack on the bicycle discovered by his fiancé, Julie Newmar, who plays the role so deliciously. Jeannette Nolan plays the other woman of the house, the housekeeper who prides herself on her talents and chides Columbo's sloppy and often typical behavior with his cigar. Martin Landau plays identical twins in this one. Each who accuse the other of murdering their uncle for money.

Lucio Fulci made a lot of great films throughout his career and the way that many of them featured a certain type of character is extremely rare. What makes these movies so special is that they took place in an absolutely different world than ours, one that wasn't entirely as well developed but still held its own as far as acting goes. What I liked about this film was the ability to get some very interesting dialogue without spoiling anything. There's just enough to be able to enjoy the movie, but not enough to leave you crying your eyes out.

Unconditional Love is one of the best movies I've seen in a while. It's an emotional roller-coaster. One of my favorite scenes is the pub scene. When Dirk tells Grace that he didn't want to go to the pub because the villagers don't like him, you expect the worst. When the old woman holds her glass up and says 'To the Memory of Victor Fox and the whole pub follows suit, I wanted to cry. The funeral scene is hysterical! Julie does it in her typical Julie Andrews style. Johnathan Pryce is excellent as Victor.

This series has a lot going for it with beautiful footage of the some of the most impressive underwater environments on this planet. Being a staggering five years in the making, one would be hard-pressed to expect any less. I did get the impression that some scenes from the first episode where repeated in the latter ones, which is naturally only a minor gripe.David Attenborough is great as a narrator and comments are informative, leaving enough room for one's imagination, and well spaced out, so that viewers get plenty of time to reflect upon the breathtaking imagery.

This searing drama based on a true incident concerns several ambitious African nationals who decide to temporarily leave their families in order to travel to Africa, where the natives are no more. When the men finally arrive they find themselves suddenly face with a choice: live in poverty while being treated poorly or seek freedom as a "free man." The cast is extremely talented and this flick has an almost surrealistic quality that's difficult to put into words. I have watched hundreds of hours of black movies over the course of many years so it's hard to understand how this one managed to slip through the cracks.

As with so many modern US films , there has to be a supernatural element to the plot , but it seems like it could've been a little more direct than that. There is a scene where a car crashes into two other vehicles and they are separated, and as one of them gets back on its feet and drives away from the other it falls in the middle of a field, killing all four people on it. Well I am going to say it, I watched this last week and was shocked at what happened to me.I don't think anyone saw this coming.

The animation quality here is decidedly below par IMO, regardless of the age of the OAV. The plot itself makes sense, but the characters don't.This might sound picky, but considering that the city of Olympus is almost exclusively populated by living machines, would YOU feel comfortable there as a human? Would any machine ever emulate human arrogance, short-sightedness and greed quite so effectively? I doubt it. There are some pointers towards this in the movie, but only when the team can be bothered to put them in, by and large the 'bioroids' (or whatever they are) are interchangeable with human characters.

SPOILERSI love the Simpsons, and I have seen every single episode that had ever come out. I must admit, season one is by far the most underrated season, and this is the most underrated episode in season one.The episode begins with the family playing a game of Scrabble to get Bart ready for an intelligence test he needs to take at school. He says the game is stupid and he doesn't want to play it, but he needs to. He spells out a word that angers Homer and he chases Bart around the house.

The Child's Play series isn't a favourite of mine, but Bride Of Chucky is actually an okay movie. This time we have two dolls Chucky and his former girlfriend (when he was human) Tiffany. Together they go on a journey to find an object. There are a few interesting scenes through the movie like the guy getting hit by the truck and literally exploding, the sex scene between Chucky and Tiffany and the ending which allows for another sequel to take place. Wasn't really a straight forward horror, it mixed a lot of comedy and was a sort of spoof of the horror genre.

I remember this film of old . It 's a great , chilling , atmospheric horror picture about a man who runs away from home, where he gets lost in a town filled with supernatural monsters.He ends up on a deserted island with a group of teenagers. He soon finds himself being kidnapped by some bad guys. He tries to warn them of his impending fate, but they ignore him. One of the worst things I've ever seen or experienced. The actors were absolutely terrible.The story line was so nonsensical that it felt almost like they were attempting to cram all of these characters into one movie.

Motorama viewers should already by keen on other offbeat b-grade desert-based films such as Bagdad Cafe or Repo Man (both of which are just as weird). But, what I found to be a bit of a problem with this film was its lack of substance. The acting was not up to par, it had a plot that left me wondering where it would take the rest of the movie, the pacing was uninspired at times, and the script felt like an afterthought thrown together by the cast in order to make the movie seem funnier.

Before I talk about the ending of this film I will talk about the plot. Some dude named Gerald breaks his engagement to Kitty and runs off to Craven Castle in Scotland. After several months Kitty and her aunt venture off to Scottland. Arriving at Craven Castle Kitty finds that Gerald has aged and he has grown meaner. Gerald has certain rules for the castle(the rules have been the same for 200 years). Gerald does not want them to stay but, Kitty insist on staying by making excuses. One night her aunt catches a glimpse of the monster running across the hall.

I saw the trailer and read some reviews, and I had low expectations for this movie. I was pleasantly surprised. While the plot is a little off-beat, everybody in the making of this movie pulled off a pleasant flick good for many a laugh. The writing and jokes are far more literate than I have come to expect. Better yet, they are delivered with aplomb by unknown actors doing a good job, all of them.The main reasons I wanted to see this movie were Justin Long and Lewis Black. Long is from "Ed" and the new Apple computer ads.

I always liked this movie, I have seen it so many times but I always enjoyed it :) the story is interesting and special. But the only thing I have to disagree with is that I don't think Max lived in a Romanian monastery or what was that :P They don't look that way in Romania.. Anyway, back to the story, Ghita Muresan played pretty well but as someone said before me, his English needs to improve. And there were some funny moments and some tragical/sad parts too. It worths being seen, I thought it was sweet that the giant wanted to find his love.

No . I 'm not kidding with this one . He was a guest reviewer for Entertainment Weekly and gave a glowing review of my latest film, "Pulp Fiction". In that piece he praised the quality of his work. The worst movie in years. If you have been a fan of the Dark Knight Rises series, you are probably already aware of the atrocious performance by Heath Ledger (played by Heath Ledger), but if you're not, please go back and check this movie out: http://www.filmsurprise.com/watch/the-dark-knight-revolutions/ It has no plot whatsoever, yet it sells tickets and rakes in millions.

Even after nearly 20 years apart , the original members of Black Sabbath have not lost a thing . In fact their last album, "God's Not Dead" is arguably one of the most popular Sabbath albums of all time. I don't know much about these bands. My father used to watch them but he was always very picky when it came to television shows/films. We only saw them on the BBC because my sister liked them and wanted to watch them so we watched them while she watched other programs. But I guess those were the days in the 90s!

The cinema of the 60s was as much as time of revolution as the politics and the music. Filmmakers were daring to make avant-garde films discussing taboo subjects only permitted before in exploitation films. Starting with both "Breathless" and underground American cinema (such as Kenneth Anger), films became more and more experimental. All of this accumulated when Hollywood realized they had mass commercial appeal with "Easy Rider". One of the best (and most surprising) outputs of this era was also one of the least successful initially.

this is a teen movie and while u watch it expect some nonsensical stuff added here and there but overall the movie is effective very effective it makes you question and leaves you thinking the story is kinda far fetched but is believable and makes you feel good in sequences, its not like its the usual done and tried path. the characters are pretty well defined and are convincing. Justin long stands out among all the others and watch out for his speech in the end he will convince anyone with that speech he is simply brilliant in that speech.

The movie is based on a Jules Verne book I actually have read once, about ten years ago. I remember I liked the book a lot, and this movie does a good job in telling the story. The most important thing in this movie isn't the story, however, but the highly original visual look it has.The visuals are absolutely beautiful, and they are apparently achieved by a clever combination of animated drawings combined with live actors, stop-motion animation and sets that are painted so that they look much like from an animated movie.

I always liked this movie , I have seen it so many times but I always enjoyed it : ) . But when i started to work on my own screenplay and saw this movie about some old woman in a cabin, i decided to get myself involved. Well, first of all, yes, i'm a fan of classic movies and i have watched the original "The House with No Door" just like many other fans do. When i heard the story about the guy that was supposed to be the main character of the film, I wasn't really familiar with him.

What can I say about the series dubbed the NEW OUTER LIMITS...Hmm.... Only that this was one of the best TV series ever assembled!! You have actors of all ages, The actors that are somewhat known and that time forgot. Everyone playing their part to exact perfection! These shows always have some type of moral story to them which most of the time (if not all the time) is very true! You can feel that the man whose voice is dubbed over the credits and in the beginning and ending believes what he is saying wholeheartedly!

SPOILERS BELOW ` A Dog 's Life ' was most noteworthy for its excellent comic timing . In Charlie Chaplin's film, which is one of the greatest ever made (and I'm quite a big fan of this film), Humphrey Bogart has just escaped a life of poverty to become a successful actor and he can't seem to get over the fact that his beloved dog is dying from cancer. A few years ago when I was visiting my friends at home in Maine, we got up close and personal with a pair of leopards, who were pretty much invisible to us until we finally met them!

Double Shock is one of the many good Columbo episodes which reaches the level of a good movie.It has all the qualities of a great TV show, but as a comedy it's way too funny for comfort.In fact, it is so bad it makes me want to give up watching the series altogether. Columbo was written by Stephen J. Gould with David Slade as Columbo in his script. There were three different versions made before production and they were pretty similar. When Columbo aired on syndication I remember thinking that it was an awful film that should've been banned or even abandoned.

Before I forget , let me say the artwork in here is outstanding . From garbage cans to the huge city building , the characters are all extremely realistic and they fit their respective settings well . Even though the plot could have been better or more interesting , there was a reason why I watched this movie . A bunch of high schoolers go into a bar called "The Bowery". This leads to an absolutely awful night. But what can you do when your friends come in and ask for your help? In this case, they get turned on by a naked stripper.

1930 's comedy mystery about `` The Crooked Circle '' a band of hooded crooks who set about plotting the deaths of as many people as they can before turning themselves in. The title character plays the role of an accountant hired by one of them to find money. He travels to Mexico, finds some gold, and heads to Las Vegas to pay off his debt. My first impression of Mr. Rogers' Neighborhood was that it felt like a poorly directed movie. It wasn't until I sat down with it again recently that I could appreciate its charm.

After seeing The Aristocats : Special Edition in a two pack with The Fox in the Hound , I decided to try the movie. This was my first time watching this and I thought it was one of those "must see" movies. What's not to like?? Well, let me begin by saying that there were some parts of this movie that didn't seem too good. I don't know exactly what happened because I really didn't watch it but I had no clue how they got the idea to have a circus act in front of a bunch of clowns dressed like bears.

The Monkees, surprisingly, are a big favorite of mine. Yes, they might have been the original manufactured rock band; a gimmick that certainly has reached overkill in the 21st century. However, their music holds up as some of the best the 1960's had to offer. Last Train To Clarksville, Daydream Believer, I'm A Believer, (I'm Not) Your Stepping Stone, Valleri and Pleasant Valley Sunday are great songs, written by good songwriters such as Boyce/Hart, Neil Diamond, Goffen/King and John Stewart.

I will admit, I had the opportunity in the past to watch this film, and after about 5 - 10 minutes into it, I felt like many did. I was expecting a Monkey movie that was similar to the television show, but instead I was given... well, I didn't know what I was given to be honest.However, after finally watching this film, I realized that not only had I had a closed mind to the brilliance it depicts, I also found myself watching it over and over again.

Loved today's show!!! It was a variety and not solely cooking (which would have been great too). Very stimulating and captivating, always keeping the viewer peeking around the corner to see what was coming up next. She is as down to earth and as personable as you get, like one of us which made the show all the more enjoyable. Special guests, who are friends as well made for a nice surprise too. Loved the 'first' theme and that the audience was invited to play along too.

This was a riveting film, one that really drew me in. I'm a big fan of William H. Macy, and he puts in a wonderful performance. His great likeability, coupled with the way his character breaks the fourth wall, really gave me a sense of complicity in his actions. I found myself waiting tensely for the whole house of cards to come collapsing down around him (and by extension myself, as his confidante and silent witness). It took several minutes for me to relax once the film had ended, I was so wrapped up in it.

I wish there were more films about middle aged people. The intellectual journey and the twists and turns of life's moral highway make interesting viewing. There seems to be a different standard of judgement on women who have extra marital affairs than on men. Amy Watson's hurtful and humiliating behaviour towards her husband seems to pass without comment. Reverse the roles and one could expect a torrent of condemnation towards the man. If she found her husband boring and judgmental she could could have told him so, left and waited for a no doubt large financial settlement upon divorce.

Lucio Fulci made a lot of great films throughout his career and the way that many of them featured a bucket load of gore lead to him earning the title 'The Godfather of Gore'. While Don't Torture a Duckling was made before Fulci became well known amongst gorehounds, and isn't all that gory; it's certainly a gritty and nasty little thriller, and for my money - the best film that Fulci ever made! Don't Torture a Duckling really is head and shoulders above a lot of the Giallo genre in terms of production values and unlike many of Fulci's later films, everything about this Giallo is great.

My husband and I watched this last night ... It was wonderful .... For once he was wrong in guessing the title and the director! But it worked out as well as it did ! Great movie. The only thing that disappointed me about it was that the script was so terrible. The plot consisted entirely of talking heads and random stuff that didn't add much to the story, and even those scenes weren't necessary to complete the whole thing. A good movie is one that has a lot of action, but doesn't lose you any sense of time.

I 've never seen the original `` House Of Wax '' so I really did n't know what to expect when I saw this version. This was a very slow-motion horror film that I think would have been better suited for Halloween. My only gripe is that it does not have any gore, and that it seems to try to be scary every time someone goes up to somebody else. The only real gore I can see is a guy falling off a horse and breaking his neck after being stabbed by a woman in the chest.

Chucky 's back ... and it 's about time ! This time , with the help of Jennifer Tilly and Chris O'Rourke, we see just how much fun it really is to be a young man trapped in a woman's body. It was an enjoyable but not too great movie. There wasn't anything particularly brilliant or unique about it. It just had the right amount of violence and sex for me to care about it. I mean, I think that all women who look like they've done it before have got their moments in this movie.

He did one at Christmas to try and bring back a number one song , and now the terrific Justin Bieber has put him through his paces with his latest hit 'Pray For Me'.I can't say I'm really impressed with Bieber's voice, but what I was disappointed to find out is that in addition to having a somewhat annoying accent, there was also nothing redeeming to it whatsoever. There is no denying that Michael Jackson's movie The Thriller was one of the worst movies ever made. What's even more frustrating is that people are still willing to watch it on video today.

This was one of the worst Columbo episodes that I have seen , However , I am only in the minority as well. There are times when it just seems like the script was written specifically for a horror movie. The dialogue is really annoying and you can't figure out if any of the lines are actually funny. It would be better if the writer didn't seem to care much about the subject matter at all. It has a lot of great scenes, but the acting is not very believable. I saw this movie after my first viewing of "Pulp Fiction".

Ever since they first came to the Outer Banks and filmed the movie ( I have lived here my whole life but never actually seen or heard of this movie ) people have been talking crap about this movie and it is not the most recent, but that doesn't even matter. This movie is garbage. The cast are just plain bad. No chemistry whatsoever between any two parts. There is a lot of cheesy dialogue which only makes me want to vomit. A lot of times I wonder if the actors are so dumb that they didn't know better.

No , I have not seen the original series and I wo n't compare the two if I had . I do know one thing though, that was a good story about a boy in his teen years. It was very funny, and well written. The only thing is it did not get enough attention or respect. I can't believe this show actually lasted this long...and I am just going to tell you what the plot is like. First off, there are many characters to love and care for but none of them are around for more than 90 minutes at most.

Between sweeping, extraordinary scenes within a plethora of Indian locations and a plot which is Bollywood inspired yet grounded in reality, this highly moving film is a must-see for those who love a good romance/adventure. And by this, I mean "good", not a Hollywood or Bollywood easy and contrived happy ending. East meets West in a different take on the buddy film. The performances are inspired and brilliant, the cinematography epic and the plot entertaining, engaging and poignant without a trace of schmaltz or cheap tugging at heartstrings. HARI OM is a sweet film that won't rot your teeth.

I think that this short TV series, was absolutely wonderful, and gave both a in-depth and clear explanation of everything that was on the screen at the given time. This was by far David Attenborough at his best. I personally thought this was one of the best documentaries in the past decade. This is definitely worth peoples money!I also found the bit about the abyss and deep water the most fascinating and interesting part. It was incredible to find out that the 'Blue planet' team discovered more than 10 new species of underwater life!

This film is an impressionistic, poetic take on the immigrant experience, a reflective look at the turmoil and fear which might be associated with emigrating. These are aspects not often considered in movies about emigration to America in particular and to to any country more generally and the film vividly and convincingly depicts the nervousness and enthusiasm, if ignorance, that poor, illiterate Sicilian immigrants have in anticipation of their emigration to the United States. They have some fantastic, unrealistic notions about the United States which are disseminated on the trip over.

"A Slight Case of Murder" is an excellent TV movie, which is defiantly worth the price of a rental. William H. Macy is great as a movie critic who accidentally kills his mistress, and then has to try to conceal the crime. Although that may sound dark, the film is actually quite light hearted and funny, with many memorable lines ("Acting is harder than I thought- you ever see BODY HEAT? I think I owe Bill Hurt an apology" and my personal favourite "For next week answer these two questions about film noir, What do these people do during the day?

Based on a William Faulkner short story, Two Soldiers is a top notch short film, a movie that has enough story, emotion and great cinematography for a feature film and definitely leaves you wanting more in the end. The story involves two dirt poor Mississippi brothers, one only a kid, the other old enough to volunteer for the war effort shortly after the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor. The younger brother, played brilliantly by newcomer Jonathan Furr, doesn't want to let his older brother go, and he sets out on a quest to enlist in the Army himself.

When the trailer for Accepted first came up, many people began to get excited about seeing it... really excited. Who could blame them, it looked like fun. But that's exactly the thing. People went into Accepted looking for a good movie, but if you think about it, Accepted isn't the type of film destined to be a good movie. It's meant to be a film that pleases its crowd without too much effort being given. That being said, for those of you who expected a great film, you need to think about what could be made of a comedy like this one.

From the creators of Bruce Almighty and Liar Liar ! The film took a while to pick up from the very first scene. You know something's going to break, even if you can't feel it, because the camera moves so fast that everything seems to slow down or even disappear altogether! What I didn't expect was that this movie would end up costing over $30 million dollars and be such an embarrassment to the movie industry. This movie is not only stupid and dumb looking, but also has some serious moral issues concerning children.

This movie is an awesome remake of the original by the same title . The movie was cool , despite some cheesy acting and not getting enough action scenes to keep up with the original, this film is just another garbage flick. So, how do you make a "great" movie? Well, I would think there are a few ways.First of all, get the right person on the set (at least that's what I thought). There is nothing wrong with someone taking off their clothes when working out. Everyone should be clothed in their own way.

I gave it a seven only because the acting is good . And of course by that I mean Wilkinson who was just about as awful as could possibly be. But this film doesn't need a score, so I gave it a ten. What can I say ? It isn't even bad ! There is nothing to suggest it's going to make you go away from your seat at the cinema. Instead it gives you an hour and twenty minutes to get through all the boring crap in order to find something worthwhile out of it (see the end of the description).

This film set the standard for all rock biopics to follow. It accomplished this through the energetic performances of the leads, the steadiness of the camera-work (avoiding 'rock-video' clichés that were actually invented for the Beatles in their first two films), tight editing, and a non-judgmental presentation of the star as human being rather than symbol or god (or demon). Yes, there are minor holes in the plot, and incidental details that are a little unnecessary, and there will always be debate between families of those personally involved as to specifics.

Captain Corelli's Mandolin is one of Nicolas Cage's better films. He turns a fine performance as the title character. This is a romance set against the backdrop of a worn torn island. John Hurt's character gives his daughter, played beautifully by Penelope Cruz, some honest advice about love. This movie doesn't have the fault of being completely predictable. This movie also allows Cruz to turn in a performance as a strong woman who knows her own mind and heart. Once the film warms up beyond the opening sequence this film keep you focused on it.

I just ca n't understand why people are surprised this movie makes no sense . It was never supposed to be this funny. The only thing I liked about the story was the ending. I always wondered if this film was made to sell the idea that there was a real world, but you can't go there unless you leave the movie behind and move on into something else. This movie is a total dud. There are so many elements that make this movie interesting. One of them is how well-acted each character is. They act like they're actors who have spent years rehearsing for their next roles.

Valeria, an elegant and pretty young lady lives in a world surrounded by the walls of her shyness and depression. Although she may have a one-night lover or if someone lives with her, it makes no difference of being completely alone. Valeria is also a passionate woman who can take actions to approach that special man, Massimo, and at the same time the fear that allows her to answer his questions only with a "yes", "no" or "I don't know". The way to accent the loneliness of the character is magnificent.

William H. Macy always gives a good performance . He never looks lazy and never seems like he 'd rather sit down for a drink with his girlfriend'. The most interesting thing I've seen in this series was that they didn't want to follow up on what happened in the first few episodes as it seemed that the viewer may not even have gotten the whole of the main story, or even read all five episodes. For those who enjoy sci-fi movies, I'd suggest getting rid of this one.It is absolutely NOT worth watching any other version of this movie.

Emily Watson and Tom Wilkinson together - what a treat! With Rupert Everett and Linda Bassett rounding off the supporting roles to the foursome of lies and intrigue. Yet at the heart of it all, each character maintains a streak of decency - moral conscience held up in spite of obvious contradictions. "Contradictions are the source of all movement and of all life." How true these words are. Watson's Anne Manning is at the core of this intrigue - she's the central conscience that the other three latched on. She is the decency undeterred.

The film is n't perfect by any means but despite this it is very fun and amusing to watch . This film was quite bad, although not as bad as those that have made films in the last two years. It starts with a guy playing guitar in a desert and he meets his wife who happens to be an artist. After her death (who knows what would happen afterwards?) he goes back to his home where he will meet up with his young children. He ends up getting into trouble with some local gang members.

This is a stunning movie . Raw and sublimely moving . It felt like a very gripping , intelligent stage play as the characters struggle with the reality of their situations. It is a beautiful film that was directed by William Wyler. He is known for his short films in the late 70's and early 80's but this one was different because he had written a script that had been adapted from a novel, which made it more believable. In the beginning we are in a bar (one of my favorite bars in the city at least) and everyone seems to enjoy some kind of conversation.

This is one of those films where it is easy to see how some people would n't like it . I wouldn't have minded seeing it if it was not so boring. It's almost like you've got to go back to the 80s and watch this film to understand what's happening.The music in this movie is terrible , the acting is atrocious too. It seems as though every time a new TV series comes onto the air, someone (or several people) will write about the show and say, "it sucks".

My favorite show of all time! Yeah, I thought this was so cool, and Larisa Oleynik was the first crush I ever had (AAAAWWWWWW). It was well written, funny-except when it it wanted to be serious, and just a great show overall. But since we couldn't afford to keep Nick, I couldn't see any episodes after Feb. 1996, and maybe that makes me think more of the show than I should. To me it's more the epidemy (now that doesn't look spelled right!)

Most critics seem to have dismissed this film , like so many other Charles Bronson vehicles , as just another example of a man getting what he wants (or is allowed to get away with), but there is an element of truth in that.Charles Bronson's early films are often described as "horrifying", and they certainly were not by all means. They did, however, leave behind some truly disturbing scenes, one of which was probably the best scene in the entire collection.I'll start by saying I wasn't a fan of this movie until I saw the previews.

Enchanting . The best time to see this movie is sometime when unhappy or sad . It 's all just a story about love, jealousy and the need to kill your ex-girlfriend for revenge. When they do it is very emotional and painful but I could have done without seeing any of those emotions. A really annoying character in the movie makes me hate him so hard that I kept turning the subtitles off at least until halfway through. I watched this movie because it was being released on Netflix as an early Christmas present. I never knew what I was getting into when I went out with my friend last night.

Great movie. Post-apocalyptic films kick ass. This one is no exception. Kept up the pace and interest without a speck of dialogue (mainly through some good character development). The fight between Reno and the Hero was tight. I also liked the use of cave paintings and medieval-like weapons to show how primitive and savage mankind had become without their technology and guzzaline. The connection between the beginning and end was a little spacey, that is, I had a hard time understanding the distances between the hotel and the opening sequence.

I never heard of architect, Louis Kahn, until this documentary. In this almost two hour documentary which goes very quickly, his son, Nathaniel Kahn, explores his father's life from Estonia to the slums of North Philadelphia to the University of Pennsylvania in West Philadelphia where he studied and taught. He travels to Bangladesh, Israel, Connecticut, Trenton, and La Jolla, California as well as New York City to explore his father's creative genius. Personally, Louis Kahn had three families including his wife, Esther, who refused to give him a divorce and their daughter Sue Ann.

This film had about everything one could wish when viewing it originally, at the end of the 1960's decade. It was immensely entertaining, and provided a contemporary view of the many changes which had occurred during that period - and were still ongoing - in terms of the Black Power movement, Vietnam, and the volatile movement which followed the quieter, preceding postwar 1950's.All of this and one of the funniest films, then or now.Viewing it for the second time recently, I was surprised to find it as engrossing as when seen originally.
